Title: sulfate aaod@550nm
Description: This is the sulphate aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

Title: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Description: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Upwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
Description: The upwelling shortwave flux over sea ice (always negative)

Title: Hourly 100m wind speed
Description: Hourly 100m wind speed

Title: Square of Brunt Vaisala Frequency in Sea Water
Description: The phrase "square\_of\_X" means X\*X. Frequency is the number of oscillations of a wave per unit time. Brunt-Vaisala frequency is also sometimes called "buoyancy frequency" and is a measure of the vertical stratification of the medium.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: X-Component of Land Ice Vertical Mean Velocity
Description: The vertical mean land ice velocity is the average from the bedrock to the surface of the ice

Title: Dissolved Oxygen Concentration
Description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'.
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Sea Level Pressure
Description: not, in general, the same as surface pressure
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, dynvar_basic, DAMIP_monthly, CVDP_input, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, paleodata_assimilation, DCPP_Essential, paleo_land_atmosphere_surface, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_atmosphere, tipmip_baseline

Title: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
Description: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.
Processing Note: For models with a distinct shallow convection scheme only.

Title: Temperature at Snow-Ice Interface
Description: Report surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: simple change from existing monthly variable to daily.

Title: Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer
Description: liquid\_water\_content\_of\_snow\_layer

Title: Surface Ice Melt Flux
Description: Loss of ice mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the total surface melt water on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

Title: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
Description: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.

Title: Hourly relative humidity at the surface
Description: Hourly relative humidity at 2m above the surface

Title: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile
Description: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell\_method attribute "time: max")

Title: Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon  concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone

Title: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Description: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass per unit area from the surface resulting from their direct conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.

Title: Eastward Humidity Transport
Description: Eastward integrated moisture transport

Title: Grid-Cell Area for Ice Sheet Variables
Description: Cell areas any grid used to report ice sheet variables. These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of area integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere)

Title: Total surface organic aerosol
Description: The is the daily mean otal organic aerosol mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

Title: Total Runoff
Description: the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, DCPP_Essential, FireMIP_monthly, WaterResources_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_land_and_landice, tipmip_baseline

Title: Sea Water Salinity
Description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton iron component concentrations

Title: Wet Deposition Rate of NH3
Description: Surface deposition rate of ammonia (NH3) due to wet processes

Title: Total Emission Rate of Isoprene
Description: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field

Title: Mole Concentration of CFC11 in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3. The IUPAC name for CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Global Average Sea Water Conservative Temperature
Description: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Title: Nitrogen Loss to Sediments and Through Denitrification
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase. 'Denitrification' is the conversion of nitrate into gaseous compounds such as nitric oxide, nitrous oxide and molecular nitrogen which are then emitted to the atmosphere.  'Sedimentation' is the sinking of particulate matter to the floor of a body of water. "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

Title: Surface Downward Eastward Wind Stress
Description: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface

Title: Total Runoff
Description: the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell, averaged over the 3-hour interval.

Title: Surface Dissolved Ammonium Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Total Grazing of Phytoplankton by Zooplankton
Description: Total grazing of phytoplankton by zooplankton defined as tendency of moles of carbon per cubic metre.

Title: Eastward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Mass of Salt in Sea Ice per Area
Description: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area

Title: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
Description: Carbon mass per unit area in woody debris (dead organic matter composed of coarse wood.  It is distinct from litter)

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Longwave Radiative Heating
Description: longwave heating rates

Title: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

Title: Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-14 Concentration
Description: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic 14carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Title: Natural pH
Description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1 (natural component).
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Carbon Mass in Litter on Grass Tiles
Description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon has the standard name litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon.

Title: Ocean Vertical Heat Diffusivity
Description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic temperature field.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Percentage Cover by C3 Plant Functional Type
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C3 PFTs (including grass, crops, and trees).
Processing Note: Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

Title: CALIPSO Cloud Cover Percentage Undetected by CloudSat (as Percentage of Area Covered)
Description: CALIPSO Cloud Fraction Undetected by CloudSat

Title: Northward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization
Description: Vertical flux of meridional momentum within the orographic GW parameterization

Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Cloud Ice
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Title: Mass Fraction of Cloud Ice
Description: Calculated as the mass of cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton iron component concentrations
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_daily, seaice_budget_energy_daily, temperature_variability_daily_highpriority, DAMIP_daily, aerchemmip_2d_daily, DCPP_Essential, AgModelCoreDaily, AgModelExpandedDaily, AgAirPollution, HeatHealthExpandedDaily, CHELSA_land_daily, biodiv_land_daily, seaice_budget_energy_daily, ISIMIPMinimalAtmos, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_permafrost, tipmip_baseline, landice_glaciers_allfreq

Title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Diazotrophs
Description: Primary (organic carbon) production by diazotroph components alone

Title: Heterotrophic Respiration on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers), calculated on vegetation type.

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air Temperature

Title: Temperature at Ice-Ocean Interface
Description: Report temperature at interface, NOT temperature within lowermost model layer

Title: Iron Loss to Sediments
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

Title: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction
Description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: ocean_meridional_overturning_streamfunctions_yearly, CVDP_input, paleodata_assimilation, marine_bgc_baseline, paleo_ocean_transports, tipmip_extended, omip_transports_high_priority
Processing Note: Function of Y, Z, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftmz) and should in this case be omitted.

Title: Mass Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

Title: Surface Detrital Organic Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of detrital organic carbon component concentrations

Title: HCl Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydrogen chloride is HCl.

Title: Global Average Sea Surface Salinity
Description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Title: Mass of 14C in Soil Pool
Description: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in soil.

Title: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Diatoms
Description: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the diatom phytoplankton component alone

Title: Ice Sheet Rainfall Rate
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Clay Fraction
Description: Clay Fraction

Title: Condensed Water Path
Description: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Zooplankton Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

Title: Dimethyl Sulphide (DMS) Mole Fraction
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Calcareous Phytoplankton
Description: Primary (organic carbon) production by calcareous phytoplankton components alone

Title: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)
Description: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.

Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Advection
Description: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Advection

Title: Temperature Tendency Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Dissipation
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Ocean Vertical Salt Diffusivity
Description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic salinity field.

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Northward wind on pressure levels

Title: Sulfate Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
Description: Total aerosol AOD due to sulfate aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

Title: Total Soil Moisture Content
Description: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: DCPP_Wider, AgWaterExt, HealthFloodingDaily, biodiv_freshwater_daily, biodiv_land_daily, impact_energy_building_demand, WaterResources_daily, CFMIP_baseline

Title: Eastward Near-Surface Wind
Description: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_daily, dynvar_basic, aerchemmip_2d_daily, DCPP_Wider, CHELSA_land_daily, CFMIP_baseline, cordex [test]
Processing Note: normally, report this at 10 meters above the surface
Priority 1 (CMIP6): AerChemMIP, CFMIP, CMIP, CORDEX, DAMIP, DynVarMIP, GeoMIP, HighResMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: Eastward gridbox length at v points
Description: The width of the ocean model gridbox in at the v-point (dx)

Title: Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: seaice_budget_energy_daily, temperature_variability_daily_highpriority, DAMIP_daily, aerchemmip_2d_daily, DCPP_Wider, AgModelExpandedDaily, HeatHealthExpandedDaily, CHELSA_land_daily, biodiv_land_daily, seaice_budget_energy_daily, ISIMIPMinimalAtmos, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_permafrost, tipmip_baseline, landice_glaciers_allfreq

Title: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Air Temperature
Description: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell\_method attribute "time: max")

Title: Tree Cover Percentage
Description: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.
Processing Note: add scalar coordinate typetree and add "tree" to the CF area type table.  Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

Title: Near-Surface Air Temperature
Description: near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, clouds_basic_average, radiativeforcing_monthly, dynvar_basic, DAMIP_monthly, CVDP_input, paleodata_assimilation, DCPP_Essential, paleo_land_atmosphere_surface, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, biodiv_land_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_atmosphere, ref_earth_system, ref_impacts_and_adaptation, ref_ocean_and_seaice, paleo_permafrost, tipmip_baseline
Processing Note: normally, the temperature should be reported at the 2 meter height

Title: Snowfall Rate
Description: at surface. Includes precipitation of all forms water in the solid phase.

Title: Y-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "y" indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. "basal" means the lower boundary of the land ice.

Title: PM1.0 Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Mass fraction atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 1 micrometers

Title: Irradiance Limitation of Diatoms
Description: Growth limitation of diatoms due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Title: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Carbon
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. "Dissolved inorganic carbon" describes a family of chemical species in solution, including carbon dioxide, carbonic acid and the carbonate and bicarbonate anions. "Dissolved inorganic carbon" is the term used in standard names for all species belonging to the family that are represented within a given model. The list of individual species that are included in a quantity having a group chemical standard name can vary between models.  Where possible, the data variable should be accompanied by a complete description of the species represented, for example, by using a comment attribute.
Processing Note: integral over upper 100 m only.

Title: Zooplankton Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

Title: Carbon Mass in Roots
Description: including fine and coarse roots.

Title: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Evaporation
Description: zero for models using real water fluxes.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Cloud Ice Mixing Ratio
Description: Cloud ice mixing ratio

Title: Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: Sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations. In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration and Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration
Processing Note: The variable at the depth of 200 meters is requested.

Title: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Grounded Ice Sheet
Description: quantity averaged over grounded ice sheet

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, dynvar_basic, DAMIP_monthly, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_3d_monthly, DCPP_Essential, paleo_atmosphere, ref_atmosphere, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, CFMIP_baseline

Title: Eastward Near-Surface Wind
Description: Near surface eastward wind

Title: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Iron
Description: vertical integral of net time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron
Processing Note: integral over upper 100 m only.

Title: NO3 Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: NO3 Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from residual mean  (sum of Eulerian mean + parameterized eddy-induced) advection. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of phytoplankton carbon component concentrations.  In most (all?) cases this is the sum of phycdiat and phycmisc (i.e., "Diatom Carbon Concentration" and "Non-Diatom Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration"
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Rate of Change of Nitrogen Nutrient Due to Biological Activity
Description: Net of biological terms in time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)

Title: Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress
Description: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Ocean Grid-Cell Mass per Area
Description: For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times grid celll volume.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Ocean Tracer XY Laplacian Diffusivity
Description: Diffusivity is also sometimes known as the coefficient of diffusion. Diffusion occurs as a result of a gradient in the spatial distribution of mass concentration, temperature or momentum.  The diffusivity may be very different in the vertical and horizontal directions. "xy diffusivity" means the lateral along\_coordinate component of diffusivity due to motion which is not resolved on the grid scale of the model.  xy diffusivities are used in some ocean models to counteract the numerical instabilities inherent in certain implementations of rotated neutral diffusion. "laplacian diffusivity" means diffusivity for use with a Laplacian diffusion operator.
Processing Note: 3-d time dependent field

Title: Sea-Ice Volume North
Description: total volume of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere

Title: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Description: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized eddy-induced advective transport due to any subgrid advective process. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.
Processing Note: For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Pressure levels (3)

Title: Ocean Tracer XY Biharmonic Diffusivity
Description: Diffusivity is also sometimes known as the coefficient of diffusion. Diffusion occurs as a result of a gradient in the spatial distribution of mass concentration, temperature or momentum.  The diffusivity may be very different in the vertical and horizontal directions. "xy diffusivity" means the lateral along\_coordinate component of diffusivity due to motion which is not resolved on the grid scale of the model.  xy diffusivities are used in some ocean models to counteract the numerical instabilities inherent in certain implementations of rotated neutral diffusion. "biharmonic diffusivity" means diffusivity for use with a biharmonic diffusion operator.
Processing Note: 3-d time dependent field

Title: Ocean Vertical Tracer Diffusivity Due to Tides
Description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to tracers due to tides (i.e. caused by astronomical gravity changes which manifest as tides).

Title: Pressure at Model Full-Levels
Description: Air pressure on model levels
Processing Note: provide this field for models in which the pressure cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored already for each variable.  Thus, the pressures are needed for height or theta-coordinate models, for example, but not sigma- or eta-coordinate models.

Title: Sea Floor Depth Below Geoid
Description: Ocean bathymetry. Reported here is the sea floor depth for present day relative to z=0 geoid. Reported as missing for land grid cells.
Processing Note: save both native and spherical

Title: Northward Wind at 100m
Description: Meridional wind at 100m above the surface.
Processing Note: Instantaneous values

Title: Mole Concentration of CFC12 in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". The chemical formula for CFC12 is CF2Cl2. The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Square of Sea Surface Salinity
Description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.
Processing Note: Report on the ocean horizontal native grid.

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere

Title: Total Atmospheric Mass of CO2
Description: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide
Processing Note: Report only for simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), in which the CO2 does not vary from one year to the next. Report 12 monthly values, starting with January, even if the values do not vary seasonally.  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as co2massClim, not co2mass.  If CO2 is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Mole Fraction of CO2 (see the table entry before the previous one).

Title: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

Title: Total Basal Mass Balance Flux
Description: Greenland

Title: Grid-Cell Area for Ice Sheet Variables
Description: Cell areas any grid used to report ice sheet variables. These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of area integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere)

Title: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate organic nitrogen component concentrations
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Surface Mass Balance Flux
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods, and as forcing for ISM

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from additional phytoplankton component alone

Title: Natural Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Silicon in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton silica component concentrations

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Near-surface air temperature over land
Description:
For models with fractional land areas (SFTLF) we are not currently able to diagnose near-surface air temperatures over just the land part of coastal gridboxes, with the current CMIP diagnostic set. The TAS diagnostic will be a weighted mean of the air temperatures over land and sea. If the diagnostic (lets call it LTAS) is available, we can then diagnose the air temperatures just over land, and in conjunction with TAS and SFTLF diagnose the air temperatures just over sea/sea-ice in coastal gridboxes. This will enable consistent comparisons with observational datasets (e.g. CRUTEM5 which is just air temperature over land) over regional areas with large coastal areas. 
Reference: Jones, GS, 2020,  "Apples and oranges": on comparing near surface temperatures from climate models with observations, QJRMS, 146, Issue 733, 3747-3771, https://doi.org/10.1002/qj.3871.
Processing Note: The diagnostic is used within models that have fractional land areas to calculate coastal gridbox mean TAS, i.e., the mean of air temperatures over sea and air temperatures over land (weighted by the land/ocean areas) in models with fractional land areas. So it shouldn't be too difficult to produce the diagnostic for CMIP.
Cross-thematic group review comment: This should be Lmon.tas (because it is masked by land). It does not need extra coordinates -- these are implied by spatial and temporal shape. I've made these changes, and also changed the cell methods to include "time: mean" [Martin]
Atmosphere review comment: Atmosphere team happy to accept, but are contacting proposer to encourage them to attach to a variable group/opportunity

Title: Ocean Model Cell Thickness
Description: "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid-cell.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, ocean_coordinates, ocean_grid, omip_scalar_fields, tipmip_extended, omip_geometry_high_priority
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Zonal mean northward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization
Description: Zonal mean vertical flux of meridional momentum within the orographic GW parameterization

Title: Geopotential Height
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Total Organic Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
Description: total organic aerosol AOD, comprises all organic aerosols, primary + secondary ; natural + anthropogenic including biomasss burning organic aerosol

Title: Net chemical production of ammonium aerosol
Description: This is the net chemical production rate of ammonium aerosol in the atmosphere.

Title: Ocean Vertical Momentum Diffusivity
Description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to momentum.

Title: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate organic iron component concentrations
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Formaldehyde Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Upward Air Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). Upward air velocity is the vertical component of the 3D air velocity vector. The standard name downward\_air\_velocity may be used for a vector component with the opposite sign convention.

Title: Potential Evapotranspiration
Description: at surface; potential flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

Title: Total Heterotrophic Respiration on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers)

Title: Sea Water Salinity at Sea Floor
Description: Model prognostic salinity at bottom-most model grid cell
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longititude grid.

Title: Rate of Change of Alkalinity Due to Biological Activity
Description: Net of biological terms in time rate of change of alkalinity

Title: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux Under Sea Ice
Description: the net sensible heat flux under sea ice from the ocean

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

Title: Transformed Eulerian Mean Mass Streamfunction
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Ice Sheet Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Pressure on Model Half-Levels
Description: Air pressure on model half-levels

Title: Near-Surface Air Temperature
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

Title: daily Net Latent Heat Flux over Sea Ice
Description: the net latent heat flux over sea ice
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: "positive direction" adjusted to match standard name,

Title: Ocean Tracer XY Laplacian Diffusivity
Description: Diffusivity is also sometimes known as the coefficient of diffusion. Diffusion occurs as a result of a gradient in the spatial distribution of mass concentration, temperature or momentum.  The diffusivity may be very different in the vertical and horizontal directions. "xy diffusivity" means the lateral along\_coordinate component of diffusivity due to motion which is not resolved on the grid scale of the model.  xy diffusivities are used in some ocean models to counteract the numerical instabilities inherent in certain implementations of rotated neutral diffusion. "laplacian diffusivity" means diffusivity for use with a Laplacian diffusion operator.
Processing Note: 2-d time dependent field

Title: Cloud Optical Depth
Description: The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical\_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation\_wavelength or radiation\_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. "Cloud" means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.

Title: Ocean Grid-Cell Volume
Description: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields
Processing Note: a 3-d field: For oceans with more than 1 mesh, report on grid that applies to temperature

Title: Height of the Vegetation Canopy
Description: Vegetation height averaged over all vegetation types and over the vegetated fraction of a grid cell.

Title: Latent Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Surface Temperature
Description: Surface temperature (skin for open ocean)
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Y-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "y" indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.'

Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Phosphorus Due to Biological Activity
Description: Net of biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved phosphorus

Title: Omega (=dp/dt)
Description: Pressure levels (3)

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

Title: Mole Fraction of O3
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Processing Note: If O3 does not vary from one year to the next, report 12 months, starting with January.   (Note: include all 12 months even if the values do not vary seasonally.)  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as tro3Clim, not tro3. If the O3 varies from one year to the next,  then report instead the field described in the previous table entry.  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

Title: the depth of the 17°C isotherm
Description: **depth\_of\_isosurface\_of\_sea\_water\_potential\_temperature at 17C**

Title: PM2.5 Mass Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
Description: Mass fraction of atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 2.5 micrometers. To specify the relative humidity and temperature at which the particle size applies, provide scalar coordinate variables with the standard names of "relative\_humidity" and "air\_temperature".

Title: Percentage Cover of Stratiform Cloud
Description: Cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column due to stratiform clouds, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

Title: Abiotic Carbonate Ion Concentration
Description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the abiotic-analogue carbonate anion (CO3). An abiotic analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored.

Title: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

Title: Downwelling Shortwave Flux Under Sea Ice
Description: The downwelling shortwave flux underneath sea ice (always positive)

Title: Diffuse Surface Albedo for Each Band
Description: The fraction of the surface diffuse downwelling shortwave radiation flux which is reflected. If the diffuse radiation is isotropic, this term is equivalent to the integral of surface bidirectional reflectance over all incident angles and over all outgoing angles in the hemisphere above the surface. Reported in spectral frequency bands.

Title: Aerosol Extinction Coefficient
Description: Aerosol Extinction at 550nm

Title: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Description: surface\_snow\_and\_ice\_sublimation\_flux

Title: Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux
Description: includes both evaporation and sublimation
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Northward Eddy Temperature Flux
Description: Zonally averaged eddy temperature flux at 100hPa as monthly means derived from daily (or higher frequency) fields.

Title: Sinking Particulate Organic Phosphorus Flux
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
Processing Note: Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

Title: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
Description: the rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by sea-ice area

Title: Daily mean surface NO3 aerosol
Description: This is the daily mean for NO3 aerosol mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Soil on Land
Description: Needed to calculate soil bulk turnover time

Title: Thickness of Refrozen Ice on Melt Pond
Description: Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by meltpond covered area

Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus Due to Biological Activity
Description: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of phosphorus
Processing Note: integral over upper 100 m only.

Title: Percentage of Land Which Is Anthropogenic Pasture
Description: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by anthropogenic pasture.
Processing Note: add scalar coordinate typepasture and add "pasture" to the CF area type table. Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Rainfall
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Title: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Silicon in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton silica component concentrations
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Percentage of Entire Grid Cell That Is Covered by Burnt Vegetation (All Classes)
Description: Percentage of grid cell burned due to all fires including natural and anthropogenic fires and those associated with anthropogenic land use change
Processing Note: Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

Title: Tendency of eastward wind due to non-orographic gravity waves
Description: Tendency of eastward wind induced by the parameterized non-orographic gravity wave drag
Processing Note: We ask the modelling centers to report the induced tendencies separately for each component of the parameterization (where applicable) and to provide specific values of the tunable parameters used for the simulation in the metadata together with a specification of the part of the gravity wave spectrum that is targeted by the parameterization (e.g., minimally, the effective resolution of the model).

Title: Percentage Cloud Cover as Calculated by the MISR Simulator (Including Error Flag)
Description: MISR cloud area fraction

Title: total emission of organic aerosol from all biomass burning
Description: The is the total emission rate of particulate organic matter (organic aerosol) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

Title: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to longwave heating, all sky
Description: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to longwave heating, all sky, with the extended number of vertical levels.

Title: Mole Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from calcareous (calcite-producing) phytoplankton component alone

Title: 3D-Field of Transported CO2
Description: requested for all Emissions-driven runs

Title: Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
Description: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

Title: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton nitrogen component concentrations
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Photolysis Rate of NO2
Description: Photolysis rate of nitrogen dioxide (NO2)

Title: Carbon concentration of miscellaneous phytoplankton
Description: Carbon concentration of miscellaneous phytoplankton
Processing Note: Analogous to Oday.phyc

Title: 2m Dewpoint Temperature
Description: Dew point temperature is the temperature at which a parcel of air reaches saturation upon being cooled at constant pressure and specific humidity.

Title: northward ocean salt transport
Description: This refers to the already available definitions of Omon.sltovgyre and Omon.sltovovrt, but should provide the total northward salt transport including all contributions (similar to heat transport, were a measure of the total transport exists via hfbasin); I believe that no cell measure apply and selected --Mod only since I was forced to select one of the options.

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere

Title: Surface Total Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic phosphorus" means the sum of all inorganic phosphorus in solution (including phosphate, hydrogen phosphate, dihydrogen phosphate, and phosphoric acid).

Title: Mass Fraction of Rain in Air
Description: Rain mixing ratio

Title: Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Upwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

Title: Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.

Title: Water Vapor Path
Description: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

Title: Convective Precipitation
Description: at surface.  This is a 3-hour mean convective precipitation flux.

Title: Surface Temperature
Description: Surface temperature (skin for open ocean)

Title: Sinking Flux of Aragonite Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Description: Downward sinking flux of aragonite at seafloor
Processing Note: Variable value should be reported as the flux exiting the bottom of the deepest ocean layer
Cross-thematic group review comment: Matches pattern of existing Omon variables.

Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Iron Due to Biological Activity
Description: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron
Processing Note: integral over upper 100 m only.

Title: Ocean Momentum XY Biharmonic Diffusivity
Description: Lateral biharmonic viscosity applied to the momentum equations.

Title: Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to Eliassen-Palm Flux Divergence
Description: Called "acceldivf" in CCMI table; we suggest new name. zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: dust absorption aerosol optical depth @550nm
Description: This is the dust aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

Title: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass.

Title: Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Upwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation  (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)
Processing Note: Report on model half-levels (i.e., interfaces between model layers).

Title: Downward Flux of Aragonite
Description: The phrase 'expressed\_as' is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. Aragonite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of aragonite is CaCO3. Standard names also exist for calcite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.
Processing Note: at 100 m depth.

Title: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
Description: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Title: Geopotential Height
Description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

Title: Total Emission Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass
Description: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Title: O3 Production Rate
Description: ONLY provide the sum of all the HO2/RO2 + NO reactions (as k\*[HO2]\*[NO])

Title: Nitrogen Mass in Vegetation
Description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Title: Convective Precipitation
Description: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

Title: Sea Water Redistributed Potential Temperature
Description: A passive tracer in an ocean model which is subject to an externally imposed perturbative surface heat flux. The passive tracer is initialised to the potential temperature in the control climate before the perturbation is imposed. Its surface flux is the heat flux from the atmosphere, not including the imposed perturbation, and is converted to a passive tracer increment as if it were being added to potential temperature. The passive tracer is transported within the ocean as if it were potential temperature.

Title: Zonal Mean Longwave Heating Rate Due to Volcanic Aerosols
Description: longwave heating rate due to volcanic aerosols to be diagnosed through double radiation call, zonal average values required

Title: Upward Component of Land-Ice Surface Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Convection
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Irradiance Limitation of Picophytoplankton
Description: Growth limitation of picophytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Title: Age of Sea Ice
Description: Age of Sea Ice
Processing Note: I would imagine that this is just a repeat of the monthly field but I'm adding it for consistency with the proposed variable group
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: simple change from existing monthly variable to daily.

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air Temperature

Title: Mass of 14C in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
Description: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil, and forestry and agricultural products (e.g. paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock).

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: sampled synoptically to diagnose atmospheric tides, this is better than mean sea level pressure.

Title: Sea-Ice Thickness in Thickness Categories
Description: K=ice depth bands

Title: Surface Temperature
Description: Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere

Title: Aerosol Level Absorption Optical Thickness for Each Band
Description: Optical thickness of atmospheric aerosols in wavelength bands.

Title: Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
Description: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

Title: CloudSat Radar Reflectivity CFAD
Description: CloudSat Radar Reflectivity

Title: Mole Concentration of Nanophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: Mole Concentration of Nanophytoplankton only Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

Title: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Fluxes are requested at all levels

Title: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
Description: In some models part of nitrogen (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.

Title: Ocean Kinetic Energy Dissipation per Unit Area Due to XY Friction
Description: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from lateral frictional dissipation associated with Laplacian and/or biharmonic viscosity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Shortwave Heating Rate Due to Volcanic Aerosols
Description: downwelling shortwave  flux due to volcanic aerosols at  the surface to be diagnosed through double radiation call

Title: Mole Concentration of SF6 in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". The chemical formula of sulfur hexafluoride is SF6.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: daily Net Conductive Heat Fluxes in Ice at the Bottom
Description: the net heat conduction flux at the ice base
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: "positive direction" adjusted to match standard name,

Title: Dissolved Nitrate Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

Title: Wilting Point
Description: Wilting Point

Title: Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Calcite in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure calcite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.

Title: Precipitation
Description: Total precipitation flux
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_subdaily, AgModelHourly, impacts_climserv_hourly_core, urban_impacts_additional, HealthPollutionhourly, biodiv_microclim_hourly, WaterResources_subdaily, hydro_modelling_subdaily

Title: Depth Below Geoid of Ocean Layer
Description: Depth below geoid
Processing Note: This 3-d time dependent field should only be saved for models where it cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored in the file.

Title: ISCCP Cloud Area Percentage
Description: Percentage cloud cover in optical depth categories.
Processing Note: 7 levels x 7 tau

Title: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile
Description: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell\_method attribute "time: min")

Title: Omega (=dp/dt)
Description: commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

Title: Surface Downward X Stress Correction
Description: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
Processing Note: If this does not vary from one year to the next, report only a single year. Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Eastward Surface Stress from Planetary Boundary Layer Scheme
Description: surface

Title: Sea-Ice Area Percentages in Thickness Categories
Description: K=ice depth bands
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: simple change from existing monthly variable to daily.

Title: Carbon Mass in Soil on Grass Tiles
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The "soil content" of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including content\_of\_soil\_layer are used.

Title: Sea-Ice Snow Mass South
Description: Total mass of snow on sea ice of all Southern-Hemisphere grid cells

Title: Daily Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice
Description: the net sensible heat flux over sea ice
Processing Note: the net sensible heat flux over sea ice
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: "positive direction" adjusted to match standard name,

Title: Near-Surface Relative Humidity
Description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Sea Water Conservative Temperature
Description: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, DCPP_Essential, marine_bgc_baseline, SO_BGC-cloud_ocean_monthly, fish_model_core_mon, FireMIP_monthly, paleo_ocean, omip_scalar_fields, tipmip_baseline, omip_scalars_high_priority

Title: HO2 Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydroperoxyl radical is HO2.

Title: Total Soil Moisture
Description: "Water" means water in all phases. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The mass content of water in soil refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including "content\_of\_soil\_layer" are used.

Title: Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Raiation

Title: Bare Soil Percentage Area Coverage
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.
Processing Note: Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

Title: Surface upwelling shortwave radiation
Description: Hourly surface upwelling shortwave radiation

Title: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Shrub Tiles
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.

Title: Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
Description: Sensible heat flux

Title: Mole Fraction of Odd Oxygen (O, O3 and O1D)
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Ocean x salt transport
Description: Contains all contributions to "x-ward" heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes.
Processing Note: 3D field. Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Specific Humidity
Description: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

Title: Surface Snow Melt
Description: surface\_snow\_and\_ice\_melt\_flux

Title: CALIPSO Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: CALIPSO Total Cloud Fraction

Title: Bare Soil Evaporation
Description: liquid\_water\_evaporation\_flux\_from\_soil

Title: Snowfall Flux
Description: at surface.  Includes precipitation of all forms water in the solid phase.  This is the 3-hour mean snowfall flux.

Title: Northward Near-Surface Wind
Description: Near surface northward wind component

Title: Mole Concentration of CFC12 in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". The chemical formula for CFC12 is CF2Cl2. The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Mean-Squared Air Temperature
Description: Air temperature squared

Title: Percentage Cloud Cover
Description: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.
Processing Note: Report on model layers (not standard pressures).

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air Temperature
Processing Note: on the following pressure levels: 850, 500, 250 hPa

Title: Mean Age of Snow
Description: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Reported as "missing in regions free of snow on land.

Title: Mole Concentration of SF6 in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". The chemical formula of sulfur hexafluoride is SF6.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid
Description: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint  distribution, liquid

Title: Surface Snow Amount
Description: Computed as the mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excluded is snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.

Title: Stratiform Rainfall Flux
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  Stratiform precipitation, whether liquid or frozen, is precipitation that formed in stratiform cloud.
Processing Note: report on model half-levels

Title: Vertically Averaged Sea Water Potential Temperature
Description: Vertically averaged ocean temperature

Title: Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Surface Altitude
Description: This is needed in case the ice sheet elevation changes in time

Title: Lightning Flash Rate
Description: Lightning Flash Rate
Processing Note: frequency of lightning flashes per unit area

Title: Sea Ice Salinity
Description: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell

Title: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence
Description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

Title: Relative Vorticity at 850hPa
Description: Relative vorticity is the upward component of the vorticity vector i.e. the component which arises from horizontal velocity.

Title: Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Title: Dry Deposition Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass
Eastward Wind
Description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

Title: Temperature of Bare Soil
Description: Temperature of bare soil

Title: Deforested or Harvested Biomass as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use or Change
Description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

Title: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
Description: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.

Title: ISCCP Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the International Satellite Cloud Climatology Project (ISCCP) analysis. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  (MODIS). Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

Title: Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is a 3-hour mean.

Title: Surface Zooplankton Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

Title: Ambient Aerosol Optical Thickness at 550nm
Description: AOD from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 550 nm"

Title: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Description: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
Processing Note: Function of latitude, Z, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftyzmpa), which should in this case be omitted.  For other models, this transport should be approximated as the transport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.

Title: Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, radiativeforcing_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, Bjerknes_Index_ENSO, poleward_heat_transports, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, paleodata_assimilation, paleo_radiation_fluxes, ref_atmosphere, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, seaice_budget_energy_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_permafrost, landice_glaciers_allfreq

Title: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as Abiotic CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Gas exchange flux of abiotic CO2 (positive into ocean)

Title: Percentage of the Grid Cell Occupied by Land (Including Lakes)
Description: Percentage of horizontal area occupied by land.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_fixed, aerchemmip_fixed, paleo_fx, hydrology, CFMIP_baseline, dynamical_downscaling_core
Processing Note: For atmospheres with more than 1 mesh (e.g., staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy.

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: Surface Pressure .. needed for vertical coordinates

Title: Land Ice Area Percentage
Description: This is needed in case the ice sheet area changes in time

Title: Downward Dissolved Oxygen Flux at Ocean Bottom
Description: Dissolved oxygen loss to sediments

Title: Water Flux into Sea Water Without Flux Correction
Description: Computed as the water flux (without flux correction) into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Processing Note: This should be the sum of the various processes contributing to water fluxes. Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.

Title: Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation at Each Level for Each Band
Description: Calculated with aerosols but without clouds. This is a standard clear-sky calculation

Title: Load of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter
Description: The total dry mass of secondary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.

Title: Sea Level Pressure
Description: Sea Level Pressure
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_daily, temperature_variability_daily_lowpriority, dynvar_basic, DAMIP_daily, aerchemmip_2d_daily, DCPP_Essential, CFMIP_baseline, cordex [test], statistical_downscaling_core_daily
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CFMIP, CMIP, CORDEX, DAMIP, DCPP, DynVarMIP, GMMIP, HighResMIP, PAMIP, RFMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice
Description: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint distribution, ice

Title: Precipitation Flux of Water Containing Deuterium (1H 2H O)
Description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain one atom of the hydrogen-2 isotope (1H 2H O), including solid and liquid phases.

Title: Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: Upwelling longwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)
Processing Note: Report on model half-levels (i.e., interfaces between model layers).

Title: Northward Ocean Salt Transport
Description: function of latitude, basin
Processing Note: For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport should be approximated as the transport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.

Title: Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile
Description: End of year values (not annual mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac\_lnd = 0.5, frac\_ocn = 0.5, frac\_crop\_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac\_lut(crop) = 0.5\*0.2 = 0.1)

Title: Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_daily, clouds_basic_average, paleo_land_atmosphere_surface, DCPP_Wider, transport_impacts_essential, CFMIP_baseline, cordex [test]
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CFMIP, CMIP, CORDEX, DAMIP, HighResMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: Northward Near-Surface Wind
Description: Northward component of the near surface wind
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_daily, dynvar_basic, aerchemmip_2d_daily, DCPP_Wider, CHELSA_land_daily, CFMIP_baseline, cordex [test]
Processing Note: normally, report this at 10 meters above the surface
Priority 1 (CMIP6): AerChemMIP, CFMIP, CMIP, CORDEX, DAMIP, DynVarMIP, GeoMIP, HighResMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: Sea Surface Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of phytoplankton carbon component concentrations.  In most (all?) cases this is the sum of phycdiat and phycmisc (i.e., "Diatom Carbon Concentration" and "Non-Diatom Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration"

Title: Natural Delta CO2 Partial Pressure
Description: Difference in partial pressure of natural-analogue carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  A natural analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings.
Processing Note: Difference between atmospheric and oceanic partial pressure of CO2 (positive meaning ocean > atmosphere) - natural component

Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Excluding Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux) from natural fires + human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the DGVM, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc, defined below (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).

Title: Northward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux
Description: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics Meridional component Fy of Eliassen-Palm (EP) flux (Fy, Fz) derived from 6hr or higher frequency fields (use daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr are not available). Please use the definitions given by equation 3.5.3a of Andrews, Holton and Leovy text book, but scaled by density to have units m3 s-2.

Title: Liquid Water Path
Description: The total mass of liquid water in cloud per unit area.

Title: Temperature at Ice-Ocean Interface
Description: Report temperature at interface, NOT temperature within lowermost model layer
Processing Note: Report temperature at interface, NOT temperature within lowermost model layer
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: simple change from existing monthly variable to daily.

Title: Total Odd Oxygen (Ox) Production Rate
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Dissolved Organic Carbon Content
Description: Vertically integrated DOC (explicit pools only)

Title: TOA Clear-Sky Longwave Radiative Forcing Due to Dust
