Description: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover.

Title: Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: seaice_budget_energy_daily, temperature_variability_daily_highpriority, aerchemmip_2d_daily, AgModelExpandedDaily, seaice_budget_energy_daily, CFMIP_baseline, landice_glaciers_allfreq

Title: Grid-Cell Area for Atmospheric Grid Variables
Description: Cell areas for any grid used to report atmospheric variables and any other variable using that grid (e.g., soil moisture content). These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of global integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere).
Processing Note: For atmospheres with more than 1 mesh (e.g., staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy.

Title: Maximum Speed of Wind Gust at 10m
Description: Wind speed gust maximum at 10m above surface
Processing Note: Time maximum required

Title: Surface Total Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic silicon" means the sum of all inorganic silicon in solution (including silicic acid and its first dissociated anion SiO(OH)3-).

Title: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice
Description: the net sensible heat flux over sea ice

Title: MODIS Liquid Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Description: Percentage liquid-cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of LWP (cloud liquid water path) and r\_eff (droplet effective radius).
Processing Note:
7 LWP levels x 6 effective radius levels. NOTE: "p1000" is chosen as a coordinate to enable form submission and should be ignored.  An extra dimension of LWP should also be added to this request (although it is not an option in the form).

[BD removed the p1000 coordinate on 4/9/24]
Atmosphere review comment:
Atmosphere team happy to accept variable.

Moved back to in progress, as it has been noted that there are duplicate compound names. Could suggest to the author to submit new physical parameters to avoid this.

NOTE need to add extra dimension 'LWP'

Title: NO2 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Radiative Heating
Description: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Radiative Heating

Title: Calcite Concentration
Description: sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentrations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Liquid Water Content of Permafrost Layer
Description: liquid\_water\_content\_of\_permafrost\_layer

Title: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
Description: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: Total Ice Algal Carbon Amount
Description: Sum of ice algal carbon component content

Title: Florida Strait Heat Transport
Description: The heat transport through the Florida Straits, from the coast of Florida to the Bahamas at 26.7N.
Processing Note: Integrated depth and longitude section of temperature multiplied by velocity at 25.7N from the Florida coast (~80.5W) to the Bahamas (~77.4W), If the east coast isn't resolved go up to ~77.4W.

Title: OH Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Omega (=dp/dt)
Description: Omega (=dp/dt)

Title: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Silicon in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate silica component concentrations
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Iron Limitation of Calcareous Phytoplankton
Description: "Calcareous phytoplankton" are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Title: The Cell Area of the Ice Sheet Model
Description: When interpolated to a regular grid, it should be interpolated (not summed) with a conservative scheme to preserve total area

Title: Transformed Eulerian Mean Upward Wind
Description: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics w\*, upward component of the residual meridional circulation (v\*, w\*) derived from 6 hr or higher frequency data fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available). Scale height: 6950 m

Title: Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone

Title: Mineral Nitrogen in the Soil
Description: SUM of ammonium, nitrite, nitrate, etc over all soil layers

Title: Nitrogen Limitation of Diatoms
Description: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Title: Convective Cloud Optical Depth
Description: Convective cloud optical depth

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized dianeutral mixing. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Title: Total Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic silicon" means the sum of all inorganic silicon in solution (including silicic acid and its first dissociated anion SiO(OH)3-).

Title: Surface Snow Amount
Description: The mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excludes snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.

Title: Sea-Ice Mass per Area
Description: (in OImon, sim included snow and sea ice mass)

Title: Ocean Mixed Layer thickness Defined by Sigma T
Description: Thickness of the layer bounded by the depth at which potential density Sigma0 exceeds density at 10m by 0.03 kg.m-3
Processing Note: The density to be used is sigma0, referenced at the surface. The mixed layer thickness is approximated by interpolating between the model level where the density exceeds density at 10m by 0.03 kg.m-3 and the level just above.

Title: 3-hourly Dry Deposition Rate of NH4
Description: 3-hourly Dry Deposition Rate of NH4

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
Description: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.

Title: Daily mean surface CO
Description: This is the daily mean for CO volume mixing ratio in lowest model layer

Title: Eastward Wind
Description: Eastward wind on pressure levels

Title: Grounded Ice Sheet Area Percentage
Description: This is needed in case the grounded ice sheet area changes in time (NO floating ice shelf)

Title: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Floating Ice Shelf
Description: quantity averaged over floating ice shelf

Title: Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice
Description: Calculate as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  Include precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: Surface Mass Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Title: Net Chemistry Tendency of O3
Description: This is the net chemical production of ozone in the atmosphere

Title: Surface Mass Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

Title: Silt Fraction
Description: Volume fraction of silt in soil

Title: Total Calving Flux
Description: Antarctica

Title: CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 560hPa

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CORDEX, HighResMIP

Title: Ocean Tracer Bolus Biharmonic Diffusivity
Description: Parameterized mesoscale eddy advection occurs on a spatial scale of many tens of kilometres and an evolutionary time of weeks(sometimes called bolus advection). Reference: James C. McWilliams 2016, Submesoscale currents in the ocean, Proceedings of the Royal Society A: Mathematical, Physical and Engineering Sciences, volume 472, issue 2189. DOI: 10.1098/rspa.2016.0117.

Title: Ocean Mass Y Transport
Description: Y-ward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Total Heterotrophic Respiration on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: only requested for DECK HIST, 1980-present

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Top-of-atmosphere outgoing clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

Title: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Relative Humidity over Crop Tile
Description: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

Title: Thickness of Soil Layers
Description: Thickness of Soil Layers

Title: Ocean Tracer XY Biharmonic Diffusivity
Description: Diffusivity is also sometimes known as the coefficient of diffusion. Diffusion occurs as a result of a gradient in the spatial distribution of mass concentration, temperature or momentum.  The diffusivity may be very different in the vertical and horizontal directions. "xy diffusivity" means the lateral along\_coordinate component of diffusivity due to motion which is not resolved on the grid scale of the model.  xy diffusivities are used in some ocean models to counteract the numerical instabilities inherent in certain implementations of rotated neutral diffusion. "biharmonic diffusivity" means diffusivity for use with a biharmonic diffusion operator.

Title: Mole Fraction of O3
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Processing Note: If this does not change over time (except possibly to vary identically over each annual cycle), report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

Title: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Description: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Mass Fraction of Water
Description: includes all phases of water

Title: Basal Temperature of Grounded Ice Sheet
Description: quantity averaged over grounded land ice

Title: Natural Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Gross Primary Production on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total GPP of trees in the grid cell

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: not, in general, the same as mean sea-level pressure
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Hourly surface wind speed
Description: Hourly near-surface wind speed at 10m above the ground

Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Model Physics
Description: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physicsl.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.

Title: Snow Area Percentages in Ice Thickness Categories
Description: K=ice depth bands

Title: Downward Flux of Calcite
Description: The phrase 'expressed\_as' is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Standard names also exist for aragonite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.
Processing Note: at 100 m depth.

Title: mean 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature
Description: **mean 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature**

Title: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction
Description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: ocean_meridional_overturning_streamfunctions_yearly, DAMIP_monthly, CVDP_input, paleodata_assimilation, DCPP_Essential, marine_bgc_baseline, paleo_ocean_transports, ref_ocean_and_seaice, omip_transports_high_priority
Processing Note: Function of latitude, Z, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftyz), which should in this case be omitted.  For other models, this transport should be approximated as the transport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.

Title: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Description: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
Processing Note: Function of latitude, rho, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftyrhompa), which should in this case be omitted.  For other models, this transport should be approximated as the transport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.

Title: Specific Humidity
Description: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

Title: Sinking Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Description: Downward sinking flux of particulate organic carbon at seafloor
Processing Note: Variable value should be reported as the flux exiting the bottom of the deepest ocean layer
Cross-thematic group review comment: Matches pattern of existing Omon variables.

Title: Leaf Area Index on Vegetation type
Description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

Title: Snow Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of sea ice, by area, which is covered by snow, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice . Exclude snow that lies on land or land ice.

Title: Ice Water Path
Description: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, clouds_basic_average, DAMIP_monthly, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, SO_BGC-cloud_cloudvars_monthly, CFMIP_baseline

Title: Fraction of Time Convection Occurs in Cell
Description: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell .

Title: Sea water salinity
Description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

Title: Mole Fraction of CH4
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Water Flux into Sea Water
Description: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.
Processing Note: net flux of water into sea water, including any flux correction. Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.

Title: Mass Fraction of Snow in Air
Description: Snow mixing ratio

Title: Total Land NOx Flux
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The phrase "expressed\_as" is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. "Nox" means a combination of two radical species containing nitrogen and oxygen NO+NO2. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

Title: Aragonite Dissolution
Description: Rate of change of Aragonite carbon mole concentration  due to dissolution

Title: Surface Temperature
Description: Surface temperature (skin for open ocean)

Title: Percentage Cover by C4 Crops
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 crops

Title: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
Description: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate organic phosphorus component concentrations

Title: Surface Temperature of Sea Ice
Description: Report surface temperature of snow where snow covers the sea ice.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, seaice_state_monthly_basic, DCPP_Wider, SO_BGC-cloud_ocean_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_cryosphere, paleo_cryosphere_high_priority

Title: Ice Sheet Surface Altitude
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Longwave Radiative Heating
Description: clear-sky longwave heating rates
Processing Note: Identical to AERmon.tntrl but for clear-sky radiation.

Title: Nitrogen Limitation of Diazotrophs
Description: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Title: Carbon-13 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: The rate of synthesis of carbon-13 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

Title: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Flux of carbon-13 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.

Title: High Frequency Surface Meridional Velocity
Description: This is just vo for comparison of high-res vs. coarse models and for compound extremes.
Processing Note: Same as vo

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Flux Due to Volcanic Aerosols
Description: downwelling shortwave flux due to volcanic aerosols at TOA under clear sky to be diagnosed through double radiation call

Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation in Bands
Description: Calculated in the absence of aerosols and clouds, following Ghan (2013, ACP). This requires a double-call in the radiation code with precisely the same meteorology.

Title: Mole Concentration of Other Zooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon from additional zooplankton component concentrations alone (e.g. Micro, meso).  Since the models all have different numbers of components, this variable has been included to provide a check for intercomparison between models since some phytoplankton groups are supersets.

Title: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources

Title: Total Water Content of Soil Layer
Description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

Title: Layer-Integrated Lightning Production of NOx
Description: Integrate the NOx production for lightning over model layer. proposed name: tendency\_of\_atmosphere\_mass\_content\_of\_nox\_from\_lightning

Title: Sinking Flux of Calcite Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Description: Downward sinking flux of calcite at seafloor
Processing Note: Variable value should be reported as the flux exiting the bottom of the deepest ocean layer
Cross-thematic group review comment: Matches pattern of existing Omon variables.

Title: Mean-Squared Eastward Wind Speed
Description: u\*u

Title: Snow Area Percentage
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Surface Mass Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll from diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

Title: Depth Below Geoid of Ocean Layer
Description: Depth below geoid

Title: Near-Surface Air Temperature
Description: near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature

Title: Iron Limitation of Diatoms
Description: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).
Processing Note: on the following pressure levels: 850, 500, 250 hPa

Title: Snow Area Percentages in Ice Thickness Categories
Description: K=ice depth bands
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: simple change from existing monthly variable to daily.

Title: Tropopause Altitude Above Geoid
Description: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

Title: Needleleaf Evergreen Tree Area Percentage
Description: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by needleleaf evergreen trees.

Title: Maximum Root Depth
Description: report the maximum soil depth reachable by plant roots (if defined in model), i.e., the maximum soil depth from which they can extract moisture; report as "missing" where the land fraction is 0.

Title: Ocean Kinetic Energy Dissipation per Unit Area Due to XY Friction
Description: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from lateral frictional dissipation associated with Laplacian and/or biharmonic viscosity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.
Processing Note: 3-d time dependent field

Title: Total Carbon in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
Description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: c4mip_land_cn_cycle_monthly, DCPP_Wider, c4mip_land_carbon_cycle_tier1, FireMIP_monthly, ref_land_and_landice, carbon_conservation_check_variables

Title: Iron Limitation of Other Phytoplankton
Description: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Miscellaneous phytoplankton" are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Title: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
Description: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area

Title: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 300m
Description: Upper 300m, 2D field

Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Including All Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: From all sources,  Including natural, anthropogenic and Land-use change. Only total fire emissions can be compared to observations.

Title: Floating Ice Shelf Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of grid cell covered by floating ice shelf, the component of the ice sheet that is flowing over sea water

Title: Aragonite Saturation Depth
Description: Depth of aragonite saturation horizon (0 if < surface, "missing"  if > bottom, if two, then the shallower)

Title: Biogenic Silicon Production
Description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

Title: MODIS Cloud Area Fraction
Description: Percentage of total cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same used by the ISCCP instrument simulator. This is the equivalent MODIS version of the ISCCP _clisccp _variable.
Processing Note: 7 pressure levels x 7 optical depth levels (x latitude x longitude x time). NOTE: please disregard the _Coordinates_ input; it is only to ensure form can be submitted.
Atmosphere review comment:
Atmosphere team happy to accept variables based on the fix below.

There was a typo in the initial submission of clmodis and cltmodis which had the metadata for the two variables swapped. MZ contacted submitter to confirm this. On confirmation, the variables have been corrected.

Title: Integral with Respect to Depth of Product of Sea Water Density and Potential Temperature
Description: Full column sum of density\*cell thickness\*potential temperature. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Relative Humidity
Description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

Title: Time Varying Gridbox thickness at u-points
Description: The time varying thickness of the gridboxes computed on the u-points

Title: Surface Snow and Ice Melt Flux
Description: Loss of snow and ice mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the total surface melt on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.

Title: Carbon Transferred Directly to Atmosphere Due to any Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Activities [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This annual mean flux refers to the transfer of carbon directly to the atmosphere due to any land-use or land-cover change activities.  Include carbon transferred due to deforestation or agricultural directly into atmosphere, and  emissions form anthropogenic pools into atmosphere

Title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Picophytoplankton
Description: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the picophytoplankton component alone

Title: Mole Fraction of CO2
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Processing Note: Report only for simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), in which the CO2 does not vary from one year to the next. Report 12 monthly values, starting with January, even if the values do not vary seasonally.  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as co2Clim, not co2.   If  CO2 is spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Total Atmospheric Mass of CO2 (see the table entry after the next).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

Title: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Convective Cloud
Description: This variable represents a monthly mean for Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Convective Cloud

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Model levels or plev\_27

Title: Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation at Each Level for Each Band
Description: Calculated with aerosols but without clouds. This is a standard clear-sky calculation

Title: Boundary layer depth
Description: Boundary Layer depth

Title: Net Longwave Surface Radiation
Description: Net longwave radiation

Title: Mean Age of Stratospheric Air
Description: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.

Title: Northward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Description: Tendency of the northward wind by parameterized nonorographic gravity waves.  (Note that CF name tables only have a general northward tendency for all gravity waves, and we need it separated by type.)

Title: algal production
Description: **algal production**

Title: Annual Gross Percentage That Was Transferred into This Tile from Other Land-Use Tiles
Description: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as a percentage of atmospheric grid cell

Title: Ice Sheet Mass
Description: Greenland

Title: Surface Abiotic Carbonate Ion Concentration
Description: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the abiotic-analogue carbonate anion (CO3). An abiotic analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored.

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation
Description: Flux corresponding to rsutcs resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation

Title: Ocean Momentum XY Laplacian Diffusivity
Description: Lateral Laplacian viscosity applied to the momentum equations.
Processing Note: 2-d time dependent field

Title: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-13 as 13CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Gas exchange flux of abiotic 13CO2 (positive into ocean)

Title: X-Component of Sea-Ice Velocity
Description: The x-velocity of ice on native model grid
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, seaice_dynamics_basic, paleo_cryosphere, DCPP_Wider, SO_BGC-cloud_ocean_monthly, paleo_cryosphere_high_priority

Title: total emission rate of C2H6
Description: This is the total emission rate of ethane (C2H6) into the atmosphere

Title: Y-Component of Sea-Ice Velocity
Description: The y-velocity of ice on native model grid

Title: CALIPSO High Level Cloud Area Percentage
Description: CALIPSO High Level Cloud Fraction

Title: CH3COCH3 Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction "mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". Acetone is an organic molecule with the chemical formula CH3CH3CO. The IUPAC name for acetone is propan-2-one. Acetone is a member of the group of organic compounds known as ketones. There are standard names for the ketone group as well as for some of the individual species.

Title: Isotopic Ratio of Deuterium in Sea Water
Description: Ratio of abundance of hydrogen-2 (2H) atoms to hydrogen-1 (1H) atoms in sea water

Title: Wet Deposition Rate of Dust
Description: Surface deposition rate of dust (dry mass) due to wet processes

Title: Particulate Source of Dissolved Iron
Description: Dissolution, remineralization and desorption of iron back to the dissolved phase

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

Title: Total Runoff from Land-Use Tile
Description: the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land use tile portion of the grid cell

Title: C3 Pasture Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 pasture

Title: Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Frozen Water Content of Soil Layer
Description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in ice phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Shortwave Radiative Heating
Description: Heating rate due to shortwave radiative flux

Title: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere

Title: C4 Pasture Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 pasture

Title: Total Emission Rate of Biogenic NMVOC
Description: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.\_If\_ fixed molecular weight of NMVOC is not available in model, please provide in units of kilomole m-2 s-1 (i.e. kg m-2 s-1 as if model NMVOC had molecular weight of 1) and add a comment to your file.

Title: Wet Deposition Rate of NH4
Description: Surface deposition rate of ammonium (NH4) due to wet processes

Title: Geopotential Height at 100hPa
Description: Geopotential height on the 100 hPa surface

Title: Y-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "y" indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.'

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air temperature at 850hPa

Title: Total Reactive Nitrogen Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model); list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. NOy = N + NO + NO2 + NO3 + HNO3 + 2N2O5 + HNO4 + ClONO2 + BrONO2 Definition: Total reactive nitrogen; usually includes atomic nitrogen (N), nitric oxide (NO), NO2, nitrogen trioxide (NO3), dinitrogen radical (N2O5), nitric acid (HNO3), peroxynitric acid (HNO4), BrONO2, ClONO2 add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields

Title: Total Grazing of Phytoplankton by Zooplankton
Description: Total grazing of phytoplankton by zooplankton defined as tendency of moles of carbon per cubic metre.

Title: Downward Flux of Aragonite
Description: Downward flux of Aragonite
Processing Note: Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

Title: Surface Snow Amount
Description: the mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excludes snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.

Title: Autotrophic Respiration on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total RA of trees in the grid cell

Title: Precipitation
Description: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
Description: To be specified only in  models which do not separate cloud, precipitation and boundary layer terms.  Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive ones.

Title: Geopotential Height at 10hPa
Description: Geopotential height on the 10 hPa surface

Title: Net Primary Production Allocated to Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This is the rate of carbon uptake by leaves due to NPP

Title: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Frazil Ice Formation
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Frazil" consists of needle like crystals of ice, typically between three and four millimeters in diameter, which form as sea water begins to freeze. Salt is expelled during the freezing process and frazil ice consists of nearly pure fresh water.
Processing Note: In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe. Report on native horizontal grid. If a function of depth, perform online remapping to depth or pressure, if not native vertical grid.

Title: Carbon concentration of nanophytoplankton
Description: Carbon concentration of nanophytoplankton
Processing Note: Analogous to Oday.phyc

Title: Concentration of Dust
Description: Mass concentration means mass per unit volume and is used in the construction mass\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". "Aerosol" means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. Aerosol particles take up ambient water (a process known as hygroscopic growth) depending on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles. "Dry aerosol particles" means aerosol particles without any water uptake.

Title: Daily mean surface PM2.5
Description: This is the daily mean PM2.5 mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

Title: Near-Surface Specific Humidity
Description: Near-surface (usually, 2 meter) specific humidity.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, DCPP_Essential, paleo_land_atmosphere_surface, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, biodiv_land_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_permafrost
Processing Note: Normally, the specific humidity should be reported at the 2 meter height

Title: Wet Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
Description: Deposition rate of sea salt aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes

Title: Near-Surface Specific Humidity
Description: Synoptic Near-Surface Field (2m)
Processing Note: This is sampled synoptically.

Title: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Description: Report only if there is a submesoscale eddy parameterization.
Processing Note: Function of Y, Z, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftmzsmpa) and should in this case be omitted.

Title: Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from additional phytoplankton component alone

Title: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Other Phytoplankton
Description: Primary (organic carbon) production by other phytoplankton components alone

Title: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud
Description: This variable represents the monthly mean Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud

Title: Silicon Production
Description: Vertically integrated biogenic silica production

Title: Detrital Organic Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of detrital organic carbon component concentrations

Title: Mean Daily Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Mixing Scheme
Description: The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by the mixing scheme is a diagnostic of ocean models. "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer.
Processing Note: Report on the ocean grid.  This variable appears in WGOMD Table 2.2

Title: Omega (=dp/dt)
Description: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards)

Title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Picophytoplankton
Description: Primary (organic carbon) production by the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Boundary Layer Mixing
Description: alevel site time1

Title: Total Odd Oxygen (Ox) Loss Rate
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Mass Fraction of Cloud Ice
Description: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. This is the mass of  cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: Mass of 14C in Vegetation
Description: only requested for DECK HIST

Title: Convective Rainfall Rate
Description: convective\_rainfall\_flux

Title: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 10m
Description: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 100m, monthly
Processing Note: Max instantaneous gust over grid cell, recorded monthly

Title: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Melt Flux
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Downward flux of particulate organic carbon
Description: downward flux of particulate organic carbon

Title: Sea Water Vertical Velocity
Description: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

Title: Omega (=dp/dt)
Description: commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, dynvar_basic, DAMIP_monthly, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_3d_monthly, paleodata_assimilation, paleo_atmosphere, DCPP_Wider, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_atmosphere

Title: Zooplankton Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

Title: Eddy Viscosity Coefficient for Momentum
Description: Vertical diffusion coefficient for momentum due to parametrised eddies

Title: Stratiform Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Title: Northward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Description: Tendency of the northward wind by parameterized nonorographic gravity waves.  (Note that CF name tables only have a general northward tendency for all gravity waves, and we need it separated by type.)

Title: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water
Description: Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward".  When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance".  In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance".  In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  "shortwave" means shortwave radiation.
Processing Note: In general the shortwave flux should be reported as a function of ocean depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe. Report on native horizontal grid. If a function of depth, perform online remapping to depth or pressure, if not native vertical grid.

Title: Mole Fraction of CO2
Description: CO2 volume mixing ratio

Title: Net Primary Production on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total NPP of trees in the grid cell

Title: Surface temperature
Description: Surface temperature (skin for open ocean)

Title: Mole Concentration of Dimethyl Sulphide in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration of dimethyl sulphide in water

Title: Eastward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Description: Tendency of the eastward wind by parameterized nonorographic gravity waves.

Title: Air Temperature
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CORDEX, HighResMIP

Title: Convective Precipitation
Description: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

Title: Mole Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from calcareous (calcite-producing) phytoplankton component alone
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Square of Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Description: The phrase "square\_of\_X" means X\*X. The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by "temperature", "sigma", "sigma\_theta", "sigma\_t" or vertical diffusivity is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea\_water\_sigma\_t\_difference can be used to specify the sigma\_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. Sigma-t of sea water is the density of water at atmospheric pressure (i.e. the surface) having the same temperature and salinity, minus 1000 kg m-3. "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Ocean Grid-Cell Mass per Area
Description: For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times grid celll volume.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Geothermal Heat Flux Beneath Land Ice
Omega (=dp/dt)
Description: plev\_4

Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Load of SO4
Description: The total dry mass of sulfate aerosol particles per unit area.

Title: Precipitation Flux of Snow and Ice Containing Oxygen-18 (H2 18O)
Description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-18 isotope (H2 18O), including solid phase only.

Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Cloud Ice
Description: alevel site time1

Title: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Silicon in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton silica component concentrations

Title: Air Temperature
Description: The difference is to request greater vertical

Title: Sea-Ice Extent South
Description: Total area of all Southern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice

Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Rainfall
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Title: nitrate aaod@550nm
Description: This is the nitrate aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

Title: MODIS Ice Cloud Area Percentage
Description: MODIS Ice Cloud Fraction

Title: Net Rate of Absorption of Shortwave Energy in Ocean Layer
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from penetrative shortwave radiation within a grid cell.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: Surface downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation

Title: Surface Dissolved Nitrate Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Mass of Water Vapor Containing Oxygen-18 (H2 18O) in Layer
Description: Water vapor path for water molecules that contain oxygen-18 (H2 18O)

Title: Height of the Vegetation Canopy
Description: Vegetation height averaged over all vegetation types and over the vegetated fraction of a grid cell.

Title: Meltpond Mass per Unit Area (as Depth)
Description: Meltpond Depth

Title: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to model physics
Description: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to model physics with the extended number of vertical levels.
Processing Note: We ask the modeling centers to provide all the simulation specific settings of the underlying parameterizations (e.g. in the metadata).

Title: Mole Fraction of N2O
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.
Processing Note: For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If N2O is spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry after the next one).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

Title: Land Ice Vertical Front Mass Balance Flux
Description: Total mass balance at the ice front (or vertical margin). It includes both iceberg calving and melt on vertical ice front

Title: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Other Phytoplankton
Description: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by other phytoplankton components alone

Title: 3-hourly Wet Deposition Rate of NOy
Description: 3-hourly Wet Deposition Rate of NOy

Title: Sea Ice Thickness
Description: (in OImon, sit was volume per entire cell area)
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, seaice_state_monthly_basic, DAMIP_monthly, DCPP_Essential, paleo_cryosphere, SO_BGC-cloud_ocean_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_cryosphere_high_priority

Title: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Gas exchange flux of carbon-14 as CO2 (positive into ocean)

Title: Leaf Area Index on Land-Use Tile
Description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

Title: Carbon in Soil Pool on Land-Use Tiles
Description: end of year values (not annual mean)

Title: Mass Fraction of Water
Description: includes all phases of water

Title: Eastward Wind
Description: Pressure levels (3)

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Other Zooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon from additional zooplankton component concentrations alone (e.g. Micro, meso).  Since the models all have different numbers of components, this variable has been included to provide a check for intercomparison between models since some phytoplankton groups are supersets.

Title: Primary Carbon Production by Phytoplankton
Description: total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress
Description: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Snow Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories
Description: K=ice depth bands
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: simple change from existing monthly variable to daily.

Title: Downwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
Description: The downwelling shortwave flux over sea ice (always positive by sign convention)

Title: Daily Upwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
Description: The upwelling shortwave flux over sea ice (always negative)
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: "positive direction" adjusted to match standard name,

Title: Y-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice
Description: Y-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice

Title: Ice Sheet Snowfall Flux
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Snow Thickness
Description: (in OImon, snd was volume per entire cell area)
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, seaice_state_monthly_basic, paleo_cryosphere, DCPP_Wider, SO_BGC-cloud_ocean_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, snow_allfreq, paleo_cryosphere_high_priority

Title: Surface Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation for Each Band
Description: Calculated with aerosols but without clouds. This is a standard clear-sky calculation

Title: Eastward Near-Surface Wind
Description: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, dynvar_basic, DAMIP_monthly, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, DCPP_Essential, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_permafrost
Processing Note: normally, the the wind component should be reported at the 10 meter height

Title: zg700
Description: 700 hPa geopotential height at 6 hourly instantaneous frequency

Title: Mole Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Eastward Wind
Description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, dynvar_basic, DAMIP_monthly, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_3d_monthly, DCPP_Essential, paleo_atmosphere, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_atmosphere

Title: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction
Description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
Processing Note: Function of latitude, rho, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftyrho), which should in this case be omitted.  For other models, this transport should be approximated as the transport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.

Title: Surface Downward Net Flux of Nitrogen
Description: Flux of nitrogen into the ocean due to deposition (sum of dry and wet deposition), fixation (the production of ammonia from nitrogen gas by diazotrophs) and runoff (liquid water which drains from land).

Title: Height of Trees
Description: Vegetation height averaged over the tree fraction of a grid cell.

Title: Sea-Ice Heat Content per Unit Area
Description: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Water at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine. Heat content is always negative, since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water

Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Cloud Ice
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Title: Sea-Ice Volume South
Description: total volume of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere

Title: Percentage Cloud Cover
Description: Percentage cloud cover, including both large-scale and convective cloud.

Title: Floating Ice Shelf Area Percentage
Description: This is needed in case the floating ice sheet area changes in time (NO grounded ice sheet)

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon from the diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

Title: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: 17C Depth of Isosurface of Sea Water Potential Temperature
Description: The depth of the 17°C isosurface of sea water potential temperature serves as the threshold for the survival of various fish species.
Processing Note: Similar to t20d, but in 17C

Title: Carbon Mass in Products of Land-Use Change
Description: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through  land use change.

Title: Ocean Momentum XY Biharmonic Diffusivity
Description: Lateral biharmonic viscosity applied to the momentum equations.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
Description: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  Calculate as the mass of cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cells. Precipitating hydrometeors are included ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Processing Note: Report on model layers (not standard pressures).

Title: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs
Description: computed as the iceberg melt water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Land Ice Calving Flux
Description: Loss of ice mass resulting from iceberg calving. Computed as the rate of mass loss by the ice shelf (in kg s-1) divided by the horizontal area of the ice sheet (m2) in the grid box.

Title: Total Autotrophic Respiration on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Growth respiration is defined as the additional carbon cost for the synthesis of new growth.
Processing Note: This flux and rMaint provide a breakdown of the higher priority "Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration" [ra]; thus the sum should be identical to that.

Title: Energy of Sublimation
Description: Energy of sublimation

Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Due to Biological Activity
Description: Net of biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic carbon

Title: Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: or the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud. This is a 1-hour mean.

Title: Permafrost Layer Thickness
Description: where land over land: This is the mean thickness of the permafrost layer in the land portion of the grid cell.  Reported as missing in permafrost-free regions.

Title: Geopotential Height
Description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

Title: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Relative Humidity over Crop Tile
Description: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

Title: Surface Downward CFC11 Flux
Description: gas exchange flux of CFC11

Title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Diazotrophs
Description: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the diazotrophs alone

Title: Grid-Cell Area for River Model Variables
Description: Cell areas for any grid used to report river model variables (may be the same as for atmospheric variables). These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of area integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere).

Title: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH3
Description: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH3

Title: Load of NO3
Description: The total dry mass of nitrate aerosol particles per unit area.

Title: Divergence of the Sea-Ice Velocity Field
Description: Divergence of sea-ice velocity field (first shear strain invariant)

Title: Sea Water Age Since Surface Contact
Description: Time elapsed since water was last in surface layer of the ocean.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Maximum Hourly Precipitation Rate
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Convective Mass Flux
Description: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the updrafts).
Processing Note: Report on model half-levels (i.e., interfaces between model layers).

Title: Surface albedo of Sea Ice
Description: Mean surface albedo of entire ice-covered part of grid cell, defined as upward divided by downwelling shortwave broadband radiation.
Processing Note: Defined as missing variable if there is no sea ice and when downwelling shortwave radiation is below 10 W/m2.

Title: Downward Flux of Particulate Phosphorus
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
Processing Note: at 100 m depth.

Title: Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to TEM Upward Advection
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Specific Humidity
Description: Specific humidity on pressure levels

Title: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction
Description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
Processing Note: Function of Y, rho, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftmrho) and should in this case be omitted.

Title: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations.

Title: Percentage Cover by Shrub
Description: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.
Processing Note: add scalar coordinate typeshrub and add "shrub" to the CF area type table.  Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

Title: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

Title: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Mortality
Description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

Title: Snow Area Percentage
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet  only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: Sampled synoptically to diagnose atmospheric tides, this is better than mean sea level pressure.
Processing Note: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Title: Mole Fraction of O3
Description: Mole Fraction of O3

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Pressure levels (3)

Title: Pressure Tendency
Description: at 500 hPa level; commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

Title: max 2m daily NOAA heat index
Description: max 2m daily NOAA heat index

Title: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Nanophytoplankton
Description: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by nanophytoplankton.

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: surface pressure, not mean sea level pressure
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CMIP, CORDEX, PMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
Description: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is the mass of  cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
Description: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: seaice_budget_energy_daily, temperature_variability_daily_highpriority, paleo_radiation_fluxes, DCPP_Wider, seaice_budget_energy_daily, CFMIP_baseline, landice_glaciers_allfreq

Title: Primary Carbon Production by Phytoplankton Due to Nitrate Uptake Alone
Description: Primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton due to nitrate uptake alone

Title: Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
Description: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

Title: Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Carbon Monoxide
Description: monthly averaged atmospheric loss

Title: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Grass Tiles
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.

Title: Capacity of Soil to Store Water (Field Capacity)
Description: reported "where land": divide the total water holding capacity of all the soil in the grid cell by the land area in the grid cell;  reported as "missing" where the land fraction is 0.

Title: Dissolved Oxygen Concentration at Saturation
Description: "Mole concentration at saturation" means the mole concentration in a saturated solution. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen".
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Net Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed\_as" is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.

Title: Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
Description: X-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force

Title: Basal Temperature of Grounded Ice Sheet
Description: quantity averaged over grounded ice sheet

Title: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Evaporation or Sublimation
Description: the rate of change of snow mass through sublimation and evaporation divided by sea-ice area

Title: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Mortality
Description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

Title: Land Ice Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of grid cell covered by land ice (ice sheet, ice shelf, ice cap, glacier)

Title: Mole Fraction of CO2
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Water Flowing out of Snowpack
Description: surface\_snow\_melt\_flux\_into\_soil\_layer

Title: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
Description: The mass of water in all phases in the upper 10cm of the  soil layer.

Title: Mass Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Ice sheet thickness
Description: This variable (named fx.ice?) shall identify the thickness of a prescribed ice sheet. This information is relevant to better understand how different models treat ice. For models where an ice sheet is just orography + an ice sheet mask, I believe the value should be set to zero. For models that explicitly resolve an ice sheet thickness, the thickness of the ice sheet should be provided.

Title: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
Description: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.

Title: Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance".
