In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Instantaneous surface Dust Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites
Description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface Dust Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Numerical Diffusion
Description: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical temperature diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the temperature budget.

Title: Surface Downward Northward Wind Stress
Description: Downward northward wind stress at the surface

Title: Precipitation Flux of Snow and Ice Containing Deuterium (1H 2H O)
Description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain one atom of the hydrogen-2 isotope (1H 2H O), including solid phase only.

Title: Ice Sheet Mass
Description: Antarctica

Title: Boundary Layer Depth
Description: Boundary layer depth

Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]

Title: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Prognostic Salinity
Description: Full column sum of density\*cell thickness\*prognostic salinity. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.

Title: Mineral Nitrate in the Soil
Description: SUM of nitrate over all soil layers

Title: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L\_mon and O\_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., "net ecosystem biospheric productivity", for land, and "air to sea CO2 flux", for ocean.)
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Precipitation Flux of Water Containing Oxygen-17 (H2 17O)
Description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-17 isotope (H2 17O), including solid and liquid phases.

Title: Fraction of Time Convection Occurs in Cell
Description: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell .

Title: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
Description: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Near-Surface Specific Humidity
Description: Near-surface (usually, 2 meter) specific humidity.

Title: daily ocean_heat_x_transport
Description: Contains all contributions to "x-ward" heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Title: Precipitation
Description: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_daily, clouds_basic_average, temperature_variability_daily_lowpriority, dynvar_basic, DAMIP_daily, aerchemmip_2d_daily, DCPP_Essential, paleo_land_atmosphere_surface, AgModelCoreDaily, AgModelExpandedDaily, AgWaterCore, AgWaterExt, transport_impacts_essential, HealthFloodingDaily, biodiv_freshwater_daily, CHELSA_land_daily, impact_energy_hydropower, biodiv_land_daily, WaterResources_daily, hydro_modelling_daily, ISIMIPMinimalAtmos, CFMIP_baseline, cordex [test], paleo_permafrost, tipmip_baseline, landice_glaciers_allfreq
Priority 1 (CMIP6): AerChemMIP, CFMIP, CMIP, CORDEX, DAMIP, DCPP, DynVarMIP, GMMIP, GeoMIP, HighResMIP, LS3MIP, LUMIP, PAMIP, PMIP, RFMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: Surface volume mixing ratio of NO2
Description: NO2 volume mixing ratio at the model level corresponding to the surface.

Title: Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

Title: TOA Incident Shortwave Radiation
Description: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
Description: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.

Title: Total Water Content of Soil Layer
Description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

Title: Height of Grass
Description: Vegetation height averaged over the grass fraction of a grid cell.

Title: Northward Near-Surface Wind
Description: Near surface northward wind

Title: Ocean Vertical Momentum Diffusivity Due to Form Drag
Description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to momentum due to form drag (i.e. resulting from a model scheme representing  mesoscale eddy-induced form drag).

Title: Florida Strait Volume Transport
Description: The net volume transport through the Florida Strait at 26.5N.    The volume transport between Florida Coast (~) and Grand Bahama (~)
Processing Note: Integrate meridional velocity across longitude and depth, ideally from coast to coast, if there is no coast on the East integrate to ().  Make sure to output in Sv (10^6 m^3/s).  Include the bolus (parameterized) transport in computation if available.

Title: Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Condensed Water Path
Description: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, clouds_basic_average, DAMIP_monthly, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, SO_BGC-cloud_cloudvars_monthly, CFMIP_baseline

Title: O3 volume mixing ratio
Description: This is the mole fraction of ozone in air, sampled on the first day of the month as an instantaneous field.

Title: Precipitation
Description: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, clouds_basic_average, radiativeforcing_monthly, dynvar_basic, DAMIP_monthly, CVDP_input, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, paleodata_assimilation, DCPP_Essential, paleo_land_atmosphere_surface, ref_atmosphere, ref_impacts_and_adaptation, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, fish_model_expand_mon, FireMIP_monthly, biodiv_land_monthly, WaterResources_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_earth_system, paleo_permafrost, tipmip_baseline

Title: Mass Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll concentration from the calcite-producing phytoplankton component alone

Title: Nitrogen Mass in Leaves
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.

Title: Primary production of OH (H2O+O1D)
Description: This is the primary production rate of the hydroxy (OH) radical via H2O+O1D

Title: Eastward Near-Surface Wind
Description: Near surface eastward wind component

Title: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Frazil Ice Formation
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Frazil" consists of needle like crystals of ice, typically between three and four millimeters in diameter, which form as sea water begins to freeze. Salt is expelled during the freezing process and frazil ice consists of nearly pure fresh water.
Processing Note: If only the vertically integrated heat flux is available, report as this 2-d field; otherwise hfsifrazil should be used.

Title: Total Nitrogen Lost (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and Leaching)
Description: Not all models split losses into gaseous and leaching

Title: Surface Mass Balance Flux
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Dissolved Nitrate Amount in Sea Ice
Description: Mole amount means moles of substance per unit area

Title: Sea-Surface Tilt Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
Description: X-component of force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt

Title: Temperature of Soil
Description: Temperature of single near-surface soil layer.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea".

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized  eddy advection (all forms of eddy advection). Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Surface Net Downward Longwave Radiation
Description: This is defined as "where ice\_free\_sea over sea"
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Longwave Radiative Heating
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Mole Fraction of CH4
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Description: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Height of Crops
Description: Vegetation height averaged over the crop fraction of a grid cell.

Title: Ice Sheet Thickness
Description: This is needed in case ice sheet thickness changes in time

Title: Surface Altitude
Description: height above the geoid; as defined here, "the geoid" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Reported here is the height above the present-day geoid (0.0 over ocean).
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_fixed, aerchemmip_fixed, paleo_fx, CHELSA_land_daily, biodiv_microclim_hourly, CFMIP_baseline, dynamical_downscaling_core, landice_glaciers_allfreq

Title: Nitrogen Mass in Roots
Description: including fine and coarse roots.

Title: Convective Snowfall Flux
Description: Convective Snowfall rate

Title: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon
Description: The phrase 'expressed\_as' is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
Processing Note: at 100 m depth.

Title: Surface SO2 volume mixing ratio at CF sites
Description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface so2 volume mixing ration at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
Processing Note: Unsure about which cell method to use here.

Title: Stratospheric Optical Depth at 550nm (Sulphate Only) 2D-Field (Stratosphere Only)
Description: Stratospheric aerosol AOD due to sulfate aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

Title: X-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "x" indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.

Title: Dissolved Ammonium Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-13 Concentration
Description: Dissolved inorganic 14carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Snowfall
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Title: Mole Concentration of Other Zooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon from additional zooplankton component concentrations alone (e.g. Micro, meso).  Since the models all have different numbers of components, this variable has been included to provide a check for intercomparison between models since some phytoplankton groups are supersets.

Title: HNO3 Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Sea-Ice Area Percentages in Thickness Categories
Description: K=ice depth bands

Title: Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, clouds_basic_average, radiativeforcing_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, DCPP_Essential, paleo_land_atmosphere_surface, SO_BGC-cloud_cloudvars_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, biodiv_land_monthly, CFMIP_baseline

Title: Water Evaporation Flux Where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
Description: computed as the total mass of water vapor evaporating from the ice-free portion of the ocean  divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Snow Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories
Description: K=ice depth bands

Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)
Processing Note: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.

Title: TOA Outgoing Longwave Radiation
Description: outgoing LW radiation at TOA

Title: Total Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic phosphorus" means the sum of all inorganic phosphorus in solution (including phosphate, hydrogen phosphate, dihydrogen phosphate, and phosphoric acid).

Title: Omega (=dp/dt)
Description: commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

Title: Tropospheric Ozone Column
Description: Tropospheric ozone column, should be consistent with definition of tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp).

Title: Instantaneous surface NH4 aerosol mass mixing ratio at CF sites
Description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface NH4 Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
Processing Note: Unsure which cell measures to use here!

Title: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate organic nitrogen component concentrations

Title: Sinking Particulate Organic Nitrogen Flux
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
Processing Note: Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

Title: Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

Title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Picophytoplankton
Description: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the picophytoplankton component alone

Title: toa_outgoing_longwave_flux_assuming_reference_mole_fraction_of_ozone_in_air
Description: This is outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference ozone field

Title: Surface Carbonate Ion Concentration
Description: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).

Title: Percentage Cover of Sea Ice by Ridging
Description: Fraction of sea ice, by area, which is covered by sea ice ridges, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .
Processing Note: Fraction of sea ice, by area, which is covered by sea ice ridges, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: simple change from existing monthly variable to daily.

Title: Percentage Cloud Cover as Calculated by the MISR Simulator (Including Error Flag)
Description: MISR optical thickness - height histogram

Title: Surface Temperature
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

Title: Hourly precipitation rate at the surface
Description: Hourly precipitation rate at the surface.

Title: Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation

Title: Soil Liquid Water Content
Description: The mass (summed over all all layers) of liquid water.

Title: Downward Flux of Particulate Silicon
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
Processing Note: at 100 m depth.

Title: Bedrock Altitude
Description: This is needed in case bed rock elevation changes in time

Title: Stratiform Snowfall Flux
Description: large-scale precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase.
Processing Note: report on model half-levels

Title: TOA outgoing longwave flux assuming clear sky and reference ozone field
Description: This is the outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference ozone field

Title: Cloud Liquid Droplet Number Concentration
Description: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration in liquid water clouds.

Title: Surface pH
Description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.
Processing Note: On behalf of the DCPP Team, I would like to propose a few variables that the colleagues will need in order to study extreme events in the decadal climate prediction experiments.

Title: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool Above 1m Depth
Description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Title: Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.
Processing Note: The variable at the depth of 200 meters is requested.

Title: Albedo of Snow
Description: Albedo of snow - this is similar to Eday.albsn, but providing monthly averages

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized dianeutral mixing. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: total emission rate of NMVOC from all biomass burning
Description: This is the total emission rate of non-methane volatile organic compounds (NMVOCs) from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

Title: loss of methane from the atmosphere due to biological consumption in the soil
Description: This is the loss rate of methane from the atmosphere due to soil sink

Title: Height of Pastures
Description: Vegetation height averaged over the pasture fraction of a grid cell.

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating
Description: clear-sky shortwave heating rates
Processing Note: Identical to AERmon.tntrs but for clear-sky.

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: Surface Pressure .. needed for vertical coordinates

Title: 6 hourly instantaneous vertically integrated water vapor
Description: Variable prw but 6 hourly instantaneous
Processing Note: I don't think table 6hrPlevPt is appropriate but I'm not sure which one is

Title: TOA Incident Shortwave Radiation
Description: TOA incident shortwave radiation

Title: Convective Ice Water Path
Description: calculate mass of convective ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: Heat Transferred to Snowpack by Rainfall
Description: Heat transferred to snowpack by rainfall

Title: Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to TEM Northward Advection and Coriolis Term
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: not, in general, the same as mean sea-level pressure
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, radiativeforcing_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, paleodata_assimilation, paleo_land_atmosphere_surface, DCPP_Wider, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_permafrost

Title: Sea Ice Thickness
Description: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice (NOT volume divided by grid area as was done in CMIP5)

Title: Liquid Water Content of Permafrost Layer
Description: "where land over land", i.e., this is the total mass of liquid water contained within the permafrost layer within the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.

Title: Upwelling Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation
Description: Calculated in the absence of aerosols and clouds (following Ghan). This requires a double-call in the radiation code with precisely the same meteorology.

Title: NH4 Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Dry mass fraction of ammonium aerosol particles in air.

Title: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
Description: In some models part of carbon (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.

Title: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction
Description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
Processing Note: Function of latitude, rho, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftyrho), which should in this case be omitted.  For other models, this transport should be approximated as the transport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.

Title: Tropopause Air Temperature
Description: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

Title: Surface Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface Upwelling Clear-sky Shortwave Radiation

Title: Vertically Integrated Eastward Moisture Transport
Description: Vertically integrated Eastward moisture transport (Mass weighted vertical integral of the product of eastward wind by total water mass per unit mass)

Title: Sea-Salt Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Mass fraction in the atmosphere of sea salt aerosol (dry mass).

Title: CCN concentration at 1.0 percent supersaturation
Description: This is the concentration of cloud condensation nuclei (CCN) at 1.0 percent supersaturation, based on aerosol chemical composition and size

Title: MODIS Ice Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Description: Percentage ice-cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of cloud IWP (cloud ice water path) and r\_eff (effective droplet size).
Processing Note:
7 IWP levels x 6 effective radius levels. NOTE: "p1000" is chosen as a coordinate to enable form submission and should be ignored.  An extra dimension of IWP should also be added to this request (although it is not an option in the form). Metric is further described in [Pincus 2023](https://essd.copernicus.org/articles/15/2483/2023/essd-15-2483-2023-discussion.html).

[BD removed the p1000 coordinate on 4/9/24]
Atmosphere review comment:
Atmosphere team happy to accept variable.

Moved back to in progress, as it has been noted that there are duplicate compound names. Could suggest to the author to submit new physical parameters to avoid this.

NOTE - need to add IWP as an extra dimension

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
Description: To be specified only in  models which do not separate cloud, precipitation and boundary layer terms.  Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive ones.

Title: Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of "Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration" plus "Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration"

Title: Graupel Mixing Ratio
Description: Graupel mixing ratio

Title: Bolus (parameterized) velocity in the northward direction
Description: The bolus (also referred to as parameterised) ocean velocity in the northward direction.

Title: Phytotoxic Ozone Dose
Description: Accumulated stomatal ozone flux over the threshold of 0 mol m-2 s-1; Computation: Time Integral of (hourly above canopy ozone concentration \* stomatal conductance \* Rc/(Rb+Rc) )

Title: Downward Flux of Particulate Iron
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
Processing Note: at 100 m depth.

Title: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Description: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass per unit area from the surface resulting from their direct conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.

Title: mean 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature
Description: **mean 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature**

Title: Calcite Concentration
Description: sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

Title: Dry Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Total Organic Matter
Omega (=dp/dt)
Description: wap is a lower priority request (level 2, not level 1)

Title: total emission rate of C3H8
Description: This is the total emission rate of propane (C3H8) into the atmosphere

Title: Surface Concentration of SO4
Description: mass concentration of sulfate dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer.

Title: Mole Fraction of CH4
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Processing Note: Report only for simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), in which the CH4 does not vary from one year to the next. Report 12 monthly values, starting with January, even if the values do not vary seasonally.  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as ch4global, not ch4.   If  CH4 is spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4 (see the table entry after the next).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

Title: Nitrogen Limitation of Picophytoplankton
Description: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Title: Convective Cloud Optical Depth
Description: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell

Title: Sea-Ice Area Percentage (Ocean Grid)
Description: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_daily, seaice_state_daily_basic, cowclip_wind_wave_variables, DCPP_Wider, biodiv_marine_daily, CFMIP_baseline, cordex [test], seaice_gcos_ecv, dynamical_downscaling_core
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CFMIP, CMIP, CORDEX, DAMIP, HighResMIP, LS3MIP, SIMIP, VolMIP

Title: Water Flux into Sea Water
Description: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.
Processing Note: net flux of water into sea water, including any flux correction. Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.

Title: Altitude of Model Full-Levels
Description: Provide only if altitude of full model levels is fixed

Title: Eastward Wind
Description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

Title: Upwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

Title: 6 hourly instantaneous northward wind in the UTLS region
Description: 6 hourly instantaneous northward wind at 3 pressure levels in the UTLS region (100, 150 and 225 hPa)
Processing Note: subset of 27 pressure levels to cover the UTLS region

Title: Northward Wind at 100m
Description: Meridional wind at 100m above the surface.

Title: Snow Albedo
Description: Snow Albedo

Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Maintenance Autotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Maintenance respiration is defined as the carbon cost to support the metabolic activity of existing live tissue.
Processing Note: This flux and rGrowth provide a breakdown of the higher priority "Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration" [ra]; thus the sum should be identical to that.

Title: particulate organic matter aaod@550nm
Description: This is the particular organic matter aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

Title: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity
Description: Tendency of Specific Humidity

Title: total emission rate of NH3 from all biomass burning
Description: This is the total emission rate of ammonia (NH3) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

Title: 3-hourly Wet Deposition Rate of NH4
Description: 3-hourly Wet Deposition Rate of NH4

Title: Surface Aragonite Concentration
Description: sum of particulate aragonite components (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

Title: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor
Description: Upward geothermal heat flux per unit area on the sea floor
Processing Note: If this field is time-invariant, then save it instead as one of your "fixed" fields (see the fx table). Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air Temperature
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_daily, clouds_basic_average, temperature_variability_daily_lowpriority, DAMIP_daily, DCPP_Wider, CFMIP_baseline, cordex [test]
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CFMIP, CMIP, CORDEX, DAMIP, HighResMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere

Title: Surface Altitude
Description: This is needed in case the ice sheet elevation changes in time

Title: ISCCP Mean Cloud Albedo
Description: time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction - see  <http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html>

Title: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Description: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
Processing Note: Function of Y, Z, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftmzmpa) and should in this case be omitted.

Title: Liquid Water Content of Soil Layer
Description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

Title: Product of Eastward Wind and Northward Wind
Description: u\*v

Title: Ocean Kinetic Energy Dissipation per Unit Area Due to XY Friction
Description: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from lateral frictional dissipation associated with Laplacian and/or biharmonic viscosity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.
Processing Note: 2-d time dependent field

Title: Dissolved Iron Concentration
Description: dissolved iron in sea water is meant to include both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not, e.g., particulate detrital iron)
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: TOA Outgoing Longwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

Title: Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic NOx
Description: Store flux as Nitrogen. Anthropogenic fraction. NOx=NO+NO2, Includes agricultural waste burning but no other biomass burning. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Title: Sea Level Pressure
Description: not, in general, the same as surface pressure
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Product of Air Temperature and Omega
Description: Product of air temperature and pressure tendency

Title: Leaf Area Index
Description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

Title: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon at 1000m
Description: The phrase 'expressed\_as' is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
Processing Note: see epc100

Title: Carbon Mass in Products of Land-Use Change
Description: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through  land use change.

Title: Water Vapor Path
Description: Column-integrated water vapour

Title: Average Layer Fraction of Frozen Moisture
Description: mass\_fraction\_of\_frozen\_water\_in\_soil\_layer

Title: Land Ice Vertical Front Mass Balance Flux
Description: Total mass balance at the ice front (or vertical margin). It includes both iceberg calving and melt on vertical ice front

Title: X-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
Description: X-component of ocean stress on sea ice

Title: Monthly od550volso4
Description: As od550volso4 but monthly averaged

Title: Surface Downward Northward Wind Stress
Description: Downward northward wind stress at the surface
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, Bjerknes_Index_ENSO, paleo_land_atmosphere_surface, DCPP_Wider, FireMIP_monthly, CFMIP_baseline

Title: Bedrock Altitude
Description: This is needed in case bed rock elevation changes in time

Title: Omega (=dp/dt)
Description: Model levels or plev\_27

Title: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
Description: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.
Processing Note: In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe. Report on native horizontal grid. If a function of depth, perform online remapping to depth or pressure, if not native vertical grid.

Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Convection
Description: Tendencies from cumulus convection scheme.

Title: Y-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "y" indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. "basal" means the lower boundary of the land ice.

Title: Precipitation Flux of Snow and Ice Containing Oxygen-17 (H2 17O)
Description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-17 isotope (H2 17O), including solid phase only.

Title: Carbon-14 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: The rate of synthesis of carbon-14 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

Title: Black Carbon Optical Thickness at 550nm
Description: Total aerosol AOD due to black carbon aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

Title: Dry and Wet Deposition of Reactive Nitrogen onto Land
Description: Surface deposition rate of nitrogen.

Title: Eastward Wind at 10hPa
Description: Zonal wind on the 10 hPa surface

Title: Boundary Layer Depth
Description: Boundary Layer Depth every 3 hours

Title: Total Inorganic Bromine Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Bry = Br + BrO + HOBr + HBr + BrONO2 + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic bromine (e.g., HBr and inorganic bromine oxides and radicals (e.g., BrO, atomic bromine (Br), bromine nitrate (BrONO2)) resulting from degradation of bromine-containing organicsource gases (halons, methyl bromide, VSLS), and natural inorganic bromine sources (e.g., volcanoes, sea salt, and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields

Title: anthropogenic emission rate of CH4
Description: This is the anthropogenic emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere

Title: Boundary Layer Depth
Description: Boundary layer depth

Title: Northward gridbox length at t points
Description: The width of the ocean model gridbox in at the t-point (dy)

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air Temperature

Title: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: only requested for DECK HIST, 1980-present

Title: Total Water Content of Soil Layer
Description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

Title: Sea-Ice Area Percentage (Ocean Grid)
Description: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, seaice_budget_area_monthly, seaice_state_monthly_basic, DAMIP_monthly, CVDP_input, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, paleodata_assimilation, DCPP_Essential, paleo_cryosphere, ref_ocean_and_seaice, SO_BGC-cloud_ocean_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, cordex [test], paleo_cryosphere_high_priority
Priority 1 (CMIP6): C4MIP, CFMIP, CMIP, CORDEX, DAMIP, DCPP, FAFMIP, GMMIP, GeoMIP, HighResMIP, LS3MIP, PAMIP, PMIP, RFMIP, SIMIP, VIACSAB

Title: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change
Description: There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, DCPP_Wider, omip_scalar_fields, dynamical_downscaling_ocean_core, omip_scalars_high_priority

Title: Sinking Flux of Particulate Iron Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Description: Downward sinking flux of particulate iron at seafloor
Processing Note: Variable value should be reported as the flux exiting the bottom of the deepest ocean layer
Cross-thematic group review comment: Matches pattern of existing Omon variables.

Title: Water Flux into Sea Water
Description: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.
Processing Note: net flux of water into seawater, including any flux correction. Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.

Title: Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Description: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.

Title: Total runoff over land
Description: This follows Emon.mrro, but at daily resolution where this variable does not yet exist
Processing Note: Not sure whether Lday may be an alternative place for this.

Title: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Convective Cloud
Description: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.

Title: Total Ice Algal Carbon Amount
Description: Sum of ice algal carbon component content

Title: Daily mean surface SOA
Description: This is the daily mean secondary organic aerosol mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

Title: Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Downwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and top-of-atmosphere)
Processing Note: Report on model half-levels (i.e., interfaces between model layers).

Title: Wet Deposition Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass
Description: Surface deposition rate of black carbon (dry mass) due to wet processes

Title: Carbon Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stems and Roots
Description: E.g. fruits, seeds, etc.

Title: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: TOA Outgoing Longwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

Title: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC12
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC12 is CF2Cl2.  The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane.

Title: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Air Temperature
Description: monthly mean of the daily-maximum near-surface air temperature.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, DCPP_Essential, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, biodiv_land_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_atmosphere, ref_impacts_and_adaptation
Processing Note: normally, this should be reported at the 2 meter height.

Title: Salt Flux from Sea Ice
Description: Total flux of salt from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; salt flux is upward (negative) during ice growth when salt is embedded into the ice and downward (positive) during melt when salt from sea ice is again released to the ocean.

Title: Sea Surface Temperature
Description: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature.
Processing Note: Note change from CMIP5 K to CMIP6 C. Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.

Title: Ice Sheet Surface Temperature
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: NO2 Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Conservative Temperature
Description: Full column sum of density\*cell thickness\*conservative temperature. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Nitrate Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
Description: Total aerosol AOD due to nitrate aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

Title: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Melt
Description: the rate of change of snow mass through melt divided by sea-ice area

Title: Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from additional phytoplankton component alone
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: X-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "x" indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. "basal" means the lower boundary of the land ice.

Title: Total Respiration from Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: added for completeness with Ra\_root

Title: Aerosol Level Single Scattering Albedo for Each Band
Description: The single scattering albedo is the fraction of radiation in an incident light beam scattered by the particles of an aerosol reference volume for a given wavelength. It is the ratio of the scattering and the extinction coefficients of the aerosol particles in the reference volume.

Title: Eastward Wind at 100m
Description: Zonal wind at 100m
Processing Note: Instantaneous values

Title: Amount of Total Ice Algae Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Ice
Description: Sum of chlorophyll from all ice algal group concentrations

Title: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate organic iron component concentrations

Title: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as Abiotic 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Gas exchange flux of abiotic 14CO2 (positive into ocean)

Title: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud
Description: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over liquid stratiform cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.

Title: Northward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Description: lower priority

Title: Near-Surface Air Temperature
Description: This is sampled synoptically.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_subdaily, clouds_basic_average, landatm_coupling_3hA, urban_impacts_essential, Impact_energy_river_temperature, ISIMIP3hourlyAtmos
Processing Note: normally, report at 2 meters above the surface

Title: Total Soil Moisture Content
Description: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

Title: Chemical Production of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter
Description: If model lumps SOA emissions with POA, then the sum of POA and SOA emissions is reported as OA emissions. "mass" refers to the mass of primary organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone.

Title: Surface Altitude
Description: Monthly mean orography (needed if land ice has time varying altitude)

Title: Land Ice Area Percentage
Description: This is needed in case the ice sheet area changes in time

Title: Surface Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation

Title: Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

Title: Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux
Description: includes both evaporation and sublimation
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, radiativeforcing_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, Bjerknes_Index_ENSO, poleward_heat_transports, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, paleodata_assimilation, DCPP_Essential, paleo_cryosphere, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, seaice_budget_energy_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_permafrost, landice_glaciers_allfreq, paleo_cryosphere_high_priority

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Silicon in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate silica component concentrations

Title: Sub-daily Aerosol Number Concentration at CF sites
Description: The variable represents the instantaneous Aerosol Number Concentration at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
Processing Note: Unsure about what cell measures to use in this case. This field seems to be blank for equivalent entries in the database!

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air Temperature

Title: TOA outgoing shortwave flux assuming reference methane
Description: This is the outgoing shortwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field

Title: Mole Fraction of N2O
Description: N2O volume mixing ratio

Title: Zonal mean westward Reynolds stress from non-orographic gravity wave parameterization
Description: Zonal mean vertical wave flux of zonal momentum within the non-orographic GW parameterization.

Title: Iron Limitation of Diazotrophs
Description: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Title: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Description: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced diffusive transport (i.e., neutral diffusion). Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.
Processing Note: For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.

Title: Carbon Mass in Above-Ground Litter
Description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Surface litter" means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon has the standard name litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon.

Title: Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Calcite in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure calcite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Aerosol Sulfate Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Dry mass of sulfate (SO4) in aerosol particles as a fraction of air mass.

Title: Loss of Tropospheric Methane by all chemical destruction
Description: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane by all chemical destruction. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp).

Title: Sublimation of the Snow Free Area
Description: sublimation\_amount\_assuming\_no\_snow

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Shortwave Radiative Heating
Description: shortwave heating rates

Title: Convective Cloud Area Percentage
Description: Include only convective cloud.

Title: Canopy Covered Area Percentage
Description: Canopy covered fraction

Title: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Clear Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations in clear sky conditions

Title: Lateral Transfer of Nitrogen out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean
Description: leached nitrogen etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.

Title: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Description: The phrase "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. "Specific" means per unit mass. Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due\_to\_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name of tendency\_of\_specific\_humidity\_due\_to\_stratiform\_cloud\_and\_precipitation should contain the effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation to or from water vapor. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).

Title: Groundwater Recharge from Soil Layer
Description: water\_flux\_from\_soil\_layer\_to\_groundwater

Title: Area Covered by Grounded Ice Sheet
Description: Antarctica

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation for Each Band
Description: Calculated with aerosols but without clouds. This is a standard clear-sky calculation

Title: Ocean Heat Y Transport
Description: Contains all contributions to "y-ward" heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Title: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from All Processes Except Fire
Description: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to all processes other than fire

Title: Lateral Sea Ice Melt Rate
Description: The rate of change of sea ice mass through lateral melting divided by grid-cell area (report 0 if not explicitly calculated thermodynamically)

Title: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as Natural CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Gas exchange flux of natural CO2 (positive into ocean)

Title: Precipitation onto Canopy
Description: the precipitation flux that is intercepted by the vegetation canopy (if present in model) before reaching the ground.

Title: Frozen Water Content of Soil Layer
Description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in ice phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

Title: Grounded Ice Sheet Area Percentage
Description: This is needed in case the grounded ice sheet area changes in time (NO floating ice shelf)

Title: Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Description: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content.  Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.

Title: Surface Downward Northward Wind Stress
Description: surface, now requesting daily output.

Title: Ocean Grid-Cell Volume
Description: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields
Processing Note: a 3-d field: For oceans with more than 1 mesh, report on grid that applies to temperature

Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: only requested for DECK HIST, 1980-present

Title: 6 hourly relative humidity at 700 hPa
Description: Variable hur but at 70 hPa and 6 hourly instantanous

Title: Fraction of Rainfall on Snow
Description: mass\_fraction\_of\_rainfall\_onto\_snow

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Description: The phrase "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due\_to\_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name tendency\_of\_air\_temperature\_due\_to\_stratiform\_cloud\_and\_precipitation should contain net latent heating effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation between water vapour, liquid or ice phases. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).

Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Due to Biological Activity
Description: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic silicon
Processing Note: integral over upper 100 m only.

Title: Mass Fraction of Cloud Ice
Description: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is calculated as the mass of cloud ice in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell. It includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Processing Note: Report on model layers (not standard pressures).

Title: All-Sky Surface Shortwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust
Description: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover.

Title: Near-Surface Air Temperature
Description: near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature

Title: Sea-Ice Freeboard
Description: Mean height of sea-ice surface (=snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: simple change from existing monthly variable to daily.

Title: Area Covered by Grounded Ice Sheet
Description: Greenland

Title: Daily mean surface Sea Salt
Description: This is the daily mean Sea Salt mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

Title: Carbonate Ion Concentration
Description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Daily water evaporation flux from canopy
Description: The same as the current variable evspsblveg but defined on daily timescales.

Title: Sea-Ice Area Percentage Tendency Due to Thermodynamics
Description: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through thermodynamic processes

Title: 6 hourly instantaneous vertical integral of zonal water vapor flux
Description: This is the same as intuaw but defined on 6hrPlevPt
Processing Note: I've selected 6hrPlevPt for the table as there didn't seem to be another option that was appropriate but I think it should just be 6hrPt.

Title: Sea Water X Velocity
Description: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, surgemip_variables, Bjerknes_Index_ENSO, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_3d_monthly, marine_bgc_baseline, paleo_ocean_3D, DCPP_Wider, SO_BGC-cloud_ocean_monthly, fish_model_expand_mon, dynamical_downscaling_ocean_core, tipmip_baseline, omip_vectors_high_priority
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Net Conductive Heat Fluxes in Ice at the Bottom
Description: the net heat conduction flux at the ice base

Title: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice
Description: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Snow Thermodynamics
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "Snow thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.
Processing Note: In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe. Report on native horizontal grid. If a function of depth, perform online remapping to depth or pressure, if not native vertical grid.

Title: Geopotential Height
Description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

Title: MODIS Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: MODIS Total Cloud Fraction

Title: Mole Fraction of CH4
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Processing Note: For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If CH4 is spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4 (see the table entry after the next one).   Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Mole Fraction of N2O
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.
Processing Note: Report only for simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), in which the N2O does not vary from one year to the next. Report 12 monthly values, starting with January, even if the values do not vary seasonally.  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as n2oglobal, not n2o.   If  N2O is spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry after the next).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

Title: Iron Limitation of Picophytoplankton
Description: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Title: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Land-Use Tile [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Computed as npp minus heterotrophic respiration minus fire minus C leaching minus harvesting/clearing. Positive rate is into the land, negative rate is from the land.  Do not include fluxes from anthropogenic product pools to atmosphere

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Radiative Heating
Description: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Radiative Heating

Title: Northward Humidity Transport
Description: Northward integrated moisture transport

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, clouds_basic_average, radiativeforcing_monthly, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, paleo_radiation_fluxes, DCPP_Wider, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_atmosphere

Title: Water Flux into Sea Water from Land Ice
Description: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to land ice (runoff water from surface and base of land ice or melt from base of ice shelf or vertical ice front) into the ocean divided by the area ocean portion of the grid cell

Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Iron Due to Biological Activity
Description: Net of biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron

Title: The Cell Area of the Ice Sheet Model
Description: When interpolated to a regular grid, it should be interpolated (not summed) with a conservative scheme to preserve total area

Title: Northward Ocean Salt Transport Due to Gyre
Description: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
Processing Note: For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.

Title: Surface Upwelling Shortwave on Land-Use Tile
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation
Description: Calculated in the absence of aerosols and clouds.

Title: Altitude of Model Half-Levels
Description: This is actual height above mean sea level, not geopotential height.  This is actual height above mean sea level, not geopotential height.  Includes both the top of the model atmosphere and surface levels.

Title: CALIPSO Scattering Ratio CFAD
Description: CALIPSO Scattering Ratio CFAD

Title: Daily Net Conductive Heat Flux in Ice at the Surface
Description: the net heat conduction flux at the ice surface
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: "positive direction" adjusted to match standard name,

Title: Terrestrial Water Storage
Description: canopy\_and\_surface\_and\_subsurface\_water\_amount

Title: Global Average Sea Water Potential Temperature
Description: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field
Processing Note: Note change from CMIP5 K to CMIP6 C

Title: Ocean Tracer Epineutral Laplacian Diffusivity
Description: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced diffusive transport oriented along neutral or isopycnal directions. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the neutral diffusivity or isopycnal diffusivity or Redi diffusivity.

Title: Relative Humidity
Description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

Title: Square of Sea Surface Salinity
Description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Surface wind speed Eastward Components
Description: **uas:** eastward component of wind at 10 meters above the surface. It measures wind speed in the east-west direction (positive values indicate wind blowing toward the east).

Title: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

Title: Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column of Land-Use Tile
Description: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface layer; integrate over uppermost 10cm

Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Advection
Description: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Advection

Title: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Model Physics
Description: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physicsl.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.

Title: CO Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Near-Surface Specific Humidity
Description: Near-surface (usually, 2 meter) specific humidity.
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Total Carbon Loss from Natural and Managed Fire on Land-Use Tile, Including Deforestation Fires [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Different from LMON this flux should include all fires occurring on the land use tile, including natural, man-made and deforestation fires

Title: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model
Description: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.

Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Numerical Diffusion
Description: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.

Title: Mass Concentration of Other Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll from additional phytoplankton component concentrations alone
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Basal Growth
Description: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to vertical growth of existing sea ice at its base divided by grid-cell area.

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
Description: Heating rate due to diabatic processes

Title: Pressure on Model Half-Levels
Description: Air pressure on model half-levels
Processing Note: This field is needed only for models in which the pressure cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored already for each variable.  Thus, the pressures are needed for height or theta-coordinate models, for example, but not sigma- or eta-coordinate models.

Title: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Pool (Summed over Vertical Levels)
Description: For models with multiple soil carbon pools, report each pool here. If models also have vertical discretisation these should be aggregated

Title: Biogenic Iron Production
Description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
