A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

Title: Daily Upwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
Description: the upwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always negative)
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: "positive direction" adjusted to match standard name,

Title: Sea-Salt Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
Description: Total aerosol AOD due to sea salt aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Title: Ambient Fine Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
Description: od550 due to particles with wet diameter less than 1 um  ("ambient" means "wetted"). When models do not include explicit size information, it can be assumed that all anthropogenic aerosols and natural secondary aerosols have diameter less than 1 um.

Title: Surface Downward Northward Wind Stress
Description: Downward northward wind stress at the surface
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Rate of Change of Biological Alkalinity Due to Biological Activity
Description: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of alkalinity
Processing Note: integral over upper 100 m only.

Title: Sea Surface Temperature
Description: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, surgemip_variables, CVDP_input, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, paleodata_assimilation, DCPP_Essential, marine_bgc_baseline, paleo_ocean, ref_ocean_and_seaice, SO_BGC-cloud_ocean_monthly, fish_model_core_mon, FireMIP_monthly, cordex [test], omip_scalar_fields, dynamical_downscaling_ocean_core, tipmip_baseline, omip_scalars_high_priority
Processing Note: Note change from CMIP5 K to CMIP6 C. Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.
Priority 1 (CMIP6): AerChemMIP, C4MIP, CMIP, CORDEX, DAMIP, DCPP, GMMIP, GeoMIP, HighResMIP, LS3MIP, OMIP, PAMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: Ocean Tracer Epineutral Laplacian Diffusivity
Description: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced diffusive transport oriented along neutral or isopycnal directions. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the neutral diffusivity or isopycnal diffusivity or Redi diffusivity.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air Temperature

Title: Nudging Increment of Water in Snow
Description: nudging\_increment\_in\_surface\_snow\_and\_ice\_amount

Title: Mole Concentration of CFC11 in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3. The IUPAC name for CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress
Description: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: ISCCP Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the International Satellite Cloud Climatology Project (ISCCP) analysis. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  (MODIS). Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

Title: Change in Snow and Ice Cold Content
Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops
Description: This variable represents monthly mean Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops

Title: Hourly Temperature at Surface
Description: Hourly Temperature at 2m above the surface

Title: Needleleaf Deciduous Tree Area Percentage
Description: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by needleleaf deciduous trees.

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: surface pressure, not mean sea level pressure

Title: Square of Sea Surface Temperature
Description: Square of temperature of liquid ocean, averaged over the day.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: Ocean Temperature Extremes, CFMIP_baseline, omip_scalar_fields, omip_scalars_low_priority
Processing Note: Report on the ocean horizontal native grid.

Title: Total Calving Flux
Description: Greenland

Title: Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

Title: MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice
Description: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint  distribution, ice

Title: Eastward Near-Surface Wind
Description: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Grid Averaged Methane Consumption (Methanotrophy) from Wetlands
Description: Biological consumption (methanotrophy) of methane (NH4) by wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air temperature at 700hPa
Processing Note: at 700 hPa level

Title: Percentage of Grid Cell That Is Land but neither Vegetation Covered nor Bare Soil
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by  neither vegetation nor bare-soil (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)

Title: Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Upwelling shortwave radiation  (includes also the fluxes at the surface and top of atmosphere)
Processing Note: Report on model half-levels (i.e., interfaces between model layers).

Title: Snow Evaporation
Description: liquid\_water\_evaporation\_flux\_from\_surface\_snow

Title: Eastward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Rainfall Flux
Description: Rainfall rate

Title: Broadleaf Deciduous Tree Area Percentage
Description: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by broadleaf deciduous trees.

Title: Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2.

Title: Aragonite Concentration
Description: sum of particulate aragonite components (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

Title: Percentage of Area by Vegetation or Land-Cover Category
Description: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their  PFT definitions.   This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc.   Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid-cell that is land.
Processing Note: need to explain how to define vegtype.  To facilitate model comparison, it is also requested that the aggregated land cover types called for in lines 28 to 35 be archived (but not in this variable).  Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).   Note that the "types" will be model dependent and for each type there should be a full description of the PFT (plant functional type).

Title: Freshwater Flux from Sea Ice
Description: Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; This flux is negative during ice growth (liquid water mass decreases, hence upward flux of freshwater), positive during ice melt (liquid water mass increases, hence downward flux of freshwater)

Title: Ocean Vertical Salt Diffusivity
Description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic salinity field.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: MODIS Total Cloud Area Fraction
Description: Percentage of total cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.
Processing Note: Latitude x longitude x time. NOTE: Both of the entries in _Coordinates_ and _Extra Dimensions_ should be ignored as they were only included for form submission.
Atmosphere review comment:
Atmosphere team happy to accept variables based on the fix below.

There was a typo in the initial submission of clmodis and cltmodis which had the metadata for the two variables swapped. MZ contacted submitter to confirm this. On confirmation, the variables have been corrected.

Title: Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-14 Concentration
Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon-14 (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Title: Ice Sheet Thickness
Description: This is needed in case ice sheet thickness changes in time

Title: Ocean Vertical Tracer Diffusivity Due to Background
Description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to tracers due to the background (i.e. caused by a time invariant imposed field which may be either constant over the globe or spatially varying, depending on the ocean model used).

Title: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Nitrogen
Description: Net time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)
Processing Note: integral over upper 100 m only.

Title: Pressure at Model Full-Levels
Description: Air Pressure (required only if pressure on model levels cannot be derived from other fields, e.g. for a non-hydrostatic model)

Title: Product of Northward Wind and Omega
Description: v\*omega

Title: Natural Total Alkalinity
Description: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components) at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Description: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.
Processing Note: This differs from sbl appearing in table Limon in that the flux is averaged over the entire grid cell, not just the land portion.

Title: Precipitation onto Canopy
Description: precipitation\_flux\_onto\_canopy

Title: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation
Description: TOA outgoing shortwave radiation

Title: TOA Incident Shortwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
Description: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Ice Sheet Near-Surface Air Temperature
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Sea Water Conservative Temperature
Description: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Title: Ocean Vertical Momentum Diffusivity Due to Background
Description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to momentum due to the background (i.e. caused by a time invariant imposed field which may be either constant over the globe or spatially varying, depending on the ocean model used).

Title: Heat Flux Correction
Description: Flux correction is also called "flux adjustment". A positive flux correction is downward i.e. added to the ocean. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
Processing Note: If this does not vary from one year to the next, report only a single year.  Positive indicates correction adds heat to ocean. Report on native horizontal grid as well as remapped onto a latitude/longitude grid.

Title: Reference mole fraction of ozone in air
Description: This is the ozone mole fraction that is used in a diagnostic call to the model's radiation scheme. It is only applicable when an ozone double call is active in the model.

Title: Sea salt Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites
Description: This variable represents instantaneous surface sea salt aerosol mass mixing ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

Title: Load of Dust
Description: The total dry mass of dust aerosol particles per unit area.

Title: TOA Outgoing Longwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Convection
Description: Tendencies from cumulus convection scheme.

Title: Wet Deposition Rate of SO2
Description: Deposition rate of sulfur dioxide due to wet processes

Title: Artificial tracer with 90 day lifetime
Description: This is the mole fraction of an artificial tracer with a 90-day lifetime (e90)

Title: Land Ice Basal Drag
Description: Magnitude of basal drag at land ice base

Title: C4 Natural Grass Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 natural grass.

Title: Depth to Soil Thaw
Description: depth\_of\_subsurface\_melting

Title: Abiotic Carbonate Ion Concentration
Description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the abiotic-analogue carbonate anion (CO3). An abiotic analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored.
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Flux Due to Volcanic Aerosols
Description: downwelling longwave flux due to volcanic aerosols at TOA under clear sky to be diagnosed through double radiation call

Title: Surface Altitude
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. Altitude is the (geometric) height above the geoid, which is the reference geopotential surface. The geoid is similar to mean sea level.

Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Longwave Radiative Heating
Description: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Clear Sky Longwave Radiative Heating

Title: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Description: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.
Processing Note: This differs from sbl appearing in table Limon in that the flux is averaged over the entire grid cell, not just the land portion.

Title: Northward Gravity Wave Drag
Description: Parameterised y- component of gravity wave drag

Title: Surface Downward CFC12 Flux
Description: gas exchange flux of CFC12

Title: Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Cloud Water Mixing Ratio
Description: Cloud water mixing ratio

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Boundary Layer Mixing
Description: Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive terms.

Title: Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Stratiform Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
Description: alevel site time1

Title: Water Vapor Path
Description: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

Title: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

Title: Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon  concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone

Title: Lightning Flash Rate
Description: Lightning Flash Rate

Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

Title: Surface Concentration of Dust
Description: mass concentration of dust dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer

Title: Total Emission Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
Description: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Title: Eddy Diffusivity Coefficient for Temperature
Description: Vertical diffusion coefficient for temperature due to parametrised eddies

Title: Downwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

Title: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon
Description: Downward flux of particulate organic carbon
Processing Note: Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

Title: Carbon Mass in Litter Pool
Description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon has the standard name litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon.

Title: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model
Description: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.

Title: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NOy
Description: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NOy

Title: Nitrogen Limitation of Calcareous Phytoplankton
Description: "Calcareous phytoplankton" are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Title: Dissolved Organic Carbon Concentration
Description: Sum of dissolved carbon component concentrations explicitly represented (i.e. not ~40 uM refractory unless explicit)

Title: Sea Surface Temperature
Description: temperature of surface of open ocean, sampled synoptically.

Title: Percentage Cover by Primary Deciduous Tree
Description: This is the fraction of the entire grid cell  that is covered by "total primary deciduous trees."
Processing Note: Agregation of model PFTs as defined in 1st priority to aid model intercomparison.  Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

Title: Ocean Momentum XY Laplacian Diffusivity
Description: Lateral Laplacian viscosity applied to the momentum equations.

Title: TOA Incident Shortwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere

Title: UGRID Grid Specification
Description: Provide for models with unstructured grids only

Title: Basal Temperature of Floating Ice Shelf
Description: quantity averaged over floating land ice

Title: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as Natural CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Gas exchange flux of natural CO2 (positive into ocean)

Title: Downwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
Description: the downwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always positive)

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Longwave Radiative Heating
Description: alevel site time1

Title: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
Description: Concentration 'as seen from space' over ice-cloud portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Title: Root Zone Soil Moisture
Description: water\_content\_of\_root\_zone

Title: Dissolved Nitrate Amount in Sea Ice
Description: Mole amount means moles of substance per unit area.

Title: Ocean Mass X Transport
Description: X-ward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Specific Humidity
Description: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

Title: Area Covered by Floating Ice Shelves
Description: Antarctica

Title: Ocean Grid-Cell Volume
Description: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields
Processing Note: a 3-d field: For oceans with more than 1 mesh, report on grid that applies to temperature

Title: Sea-Ice Area Percentage (Atmospheric Grid)
Description: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice

Title: ISCCP Mean Cloud Top Pressure
Description: time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction - see  <http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html>

Title: Sea-Ice Speed
Description: Speed of ice (i.e. mean absolute velocity) to account for back-and-forth movement of the ice

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature
Description: Tendency of Air Temperature

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air Temperature

Title: Non-Woody Vegetation Percentage Cover
Description: Percentage of land use tile tile that is non-woody vegetation ( e.g. herbaceous crops)

Title: Relative humidity at 700 hPa
Description: Variable hur but at 700 hPa

Title: Near-Surface Specific Humidity
Description: This is sampled synoptically.
Processing Note: normally, report at 2 meters above the surface

Title: Daily mean surface PM10
Description: This is the daily mean PM10 mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

Title: Sea Water Added Conservative Temperature
Description: A passive tracer in an ocean model whose surface flux does not come from the atmosphere but is imposed externally upon the simulated climate system. The surface flux is expressed as a heat flux and converted to a passive tracer increment as if it were a heat flux being added to conservative temperature. The passive tracer is transported within the ocean as if it were conservative temperature. The passive tracer is zero in the control climate of the model.

Title: Basal Temperature of Floating Ice Shelf
Description: quantity averaged over floating ice shelf

Title: Basal Temperature of Floating Ice Shelf
Description: quantity averaged over floating land ice

Title: Sinking Flux of Particulate Organic Nitrogen Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Description: Downward sinking flux of particulate organic nitrogen at seafloor
Processing Note: Variable value should be reported as the flux exiting the bottom of the deepest ocean layer
Cross-thematic group review comment: Matches pattern of existing Omon variables.

Title: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Ocean Heat Y Transport
Description: Contains all contributions to "y-ward" heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale.
Processing Note: 2d field for CMIP6. Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Nitrogen Mass in Soil Pool
Description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Title: Flux of Organic Carbon into Ocean Surface by Runoff
Description: Organic Carbon supply to ocean through runoff (separate from gas exchange)

Title: Mole Fraction of CH4
Description: CH4 volume mixing ratio

Title: Surface Downward Latent Heat Flux
Description: This is defined as with the cell methods string: where ice\_free\_sea over sea
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Sea-Ice Area South
Description: total area of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere

Title: Graupel Mixing Ratio
Description: Graupel mixing ratio

Title: Near-Surface Relative Humidity
Description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_daily, temperature_variability_daily_lowpriority, synoptic_systems_high_priority, DAMIP_daily, aerchemmip_2d_daily, AgModelExpandedDaily, HeatHealthExpandedDaily, CHELSA_land_daily, biodiv_land_daily, ISIMIPMinimalAtmos, CFMIP_baseline, cordex [test]
Processing Note: normally report this at 2 meters above the surface
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CFMIP, CMIP, CORDEX, DAMIP, GMMIP, HighResMIP, LS3MIP, PMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: Total Emission Rate of NOx
Description: Store flux as Nitrogen. NOx=NO+NO2. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Description: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion.

Title: lake depth
Description: depth of a lake; this relates to variable fx.sftlkf and shall provide additional information of the vertical extent of a lake which will influence the heat capacity among other things. This variable shall identify differences in details of the treatment of lakes in climate models.

Title: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops
Description: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration "as seen from space" over stratiform liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Title: Sea-Ice Thickness in Thickness Categories
Description: K=ice depth bands
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: simple change from existing monthly variable to daily.

Title: Eddy Diffusivity Coefficient for Temperature
Description: Vertical diffusion coefficient for temperature due to parametrised eddies

Title: Geopotential Height at 500hPa
Description: geopotential height on the 500 hPa surface

Title: Downward Organic Carbon Flux at Ocean Bottom
Description: Organic Carbon loss to sediments

Title: Total Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic silicon" means the sum of all inorganic silicon in solution (including silicic acid and its first dissociated anion SiO(OH)3-).
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Mass Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll from diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L\_mon and O\_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., "net ecosystem biospheric productivity", for land, and "air to sea CO2 flux", for ocean.)
Processing Note: Report from all simulations (both emission-driven and concentration-driven) performed by models with fully interactive and responsive carbon cycles.

Title: Solar Zenith Angle
Description: solar zenith angle

Title: Global Average Sea Surface Salinity
Description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Title: Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice
Description: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc >0 ) in a grid cell

Title: Net Primary Production Allocated to Wood as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This is the rate of carbon uptake by wood due to NPP

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Description: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection.

Title: Deep Convective Mass Flux
Description: The net mass flux  represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.   This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).
Processing Note: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).

Title: Snowfall Flux where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
Description: computed as the total mass per unit time of solid-phase precipitation falling into the ice-free portion of the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.   (Snowfall flux includes all types of solid-phase precipitation.)
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Land Ice Vertical Front Mass Balance Flux
Description: Total mass balance at the ice front (or vertical margin). It includes both iceberg calving and melt on vertical ice front

Title: Near-Surface Air Temperature
Description: near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature

Title: Dissolved Organic Carbon Concentration
Description: Sum of dissolved carbon component concentrations explicitly represented (i.e. not ~40 uM refractory unless explicit)

Title: Convective Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Title: Surface Ice Melt Flux
Description: Loss of ice mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the total surface melt water on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.

Title: Daily water evaporation flux from soil
Description: Water evaporation flux from soil but for daily averages i.e., the evspsblsoi variable, which is only currently defined for monthly averages

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Autotrophic Respiration on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]. Calculated on vegetation type.

Title: Carbon Mass in Litter Pool
Description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon has the standard name litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon.

Title: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Biospheric Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes  from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux  is into the land.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: c4mip_land_cn_cycle_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, DCPP_Essential, DCPP_Wider, FireMIP_monthly, ref_earth_system

Title: Dissolved Oxygen Concentration
Description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'.

Title: Ice Water Path
Description: calculate mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool
Description: be it food or wood harvest, any carbon that is subsequently stored is reported here

Title: total emission rate of C3H6
Description: This is the total emission rate of propene (C3H6) into the atmosphere

Title: Load of Sea-Salt Aerosol
Description: The total dry mass of sea salt aerosol particles per unit area.

Title: CCN concentration at 0.2 percent supersaturation
Description: This is the concentration of cloud condensation nuclei (CCN) at 0.2% supersaturation, based on aerosol chemical composition and size

Title: Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: seaice_budget_energy_daily, temperature_variability_daily_highpriority, paleo_radiation_fluxes, DCPP_Wider, seaice_budget_energy_daily, CFMIP_baseline, landice_glaciers_allfreq

Title: Ocean Vertical Heat Diffusivity
Description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic temperature field.

Title: Rainfall Rate over Sea Ice
Description: mass of liquid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area

Title: Geopotential Height
Description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

Title: Net Mass Flux of 14C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Flux of carbon-14 as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral\_carbon\_transfer\_over\_land term, see below, will be zero data).

Title: Rainfall Flux over Land Ice
Description: over Land Ice//quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

Title: Surface Dissolved Organic Carbon Concentration
Description: Sum of dissolved carbon component concentrations explicitly represented (i.e. not ~40 uM refractory unless explicit)

Title: Clear-Sky Surface Longwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust
Description: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover. Calculating in clear-sky conditions.

Title: Convective Precipitation
Description: Convective precipitation flux

Title: Evaporation Including Sublimation and Transpiration
Description: at surface; flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: pH
Description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Delta CO2 Partial Pressure
Description: Difference in partial pressure of carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.
Processing Note: Difference between atmospheric and oceanic partial pressure of CO2 (positive meaning ocean > atmosphere)

Title: Net Carbon Mass Flux from Wood and Agricultural Product Pools on Land Use Tile into Atmosphere [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites. Produce this variable i  a model has explicit anthropogenic product pools by land use tile

Title: Rainfall Flux where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
Description: computed as the total mass of liquid water falling as liquid rain  into the ice-free portion of the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Natural Total Alkalinity
Description: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components) at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2

Title: Carbon Mass in Vegetation
Description: Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation.

Title: Change in Interception Storage
Description: change\_over\_time\_in\_canopy\_water\_amount

Title: Ocean Grid-Cell Mass per Area
Description: Tracer grid-cell mass per unit area used for computing tracer budgets. For Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness, masscello = rhozero\*thickcello, where thickcello is static cell thickness and rhozero is constant Boussinesq reference density. More generally, masscello is time dependent and reported as part of Omon.
Processing Note: 3-d field: report on grid that applies to temperature

Title: Land Ice Runoff Flux
Description: Runoff flux over land ice is the difference between any available liquid water in the snowpack less any refreezing. Computed as the sum of rainfall and melt of snow or ice less any refreezing or water retained in the snowpack

Title: Area Covered by Floating Ice Shelves
Description: Greenland

Title: TOA Outgoing Aerosol-Free Longwave Radiation
Description: Flux corresponding to rlut resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation

Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Snow Mass Change Through Snow Fall
Description: mass of solid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by sea-ice area

Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation for Each Band
Description: Calculated with aerosols but without clouds. This is a standard clear-sky calculation

Title: Surface Mass Balance Flux
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods, and as forcing for ISM

Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: This is a 3-hour mean flux.

Title: Global Mean Sea Water Salinity
Description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Title: Lateral Transfer of Carbon out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean
Description: leached carbon etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.

Title: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Floating Ice Shelf
Description: quantity averaged over floating ice shelf

Title: Aragonite Concentration
Description: sum of particulate aragonite components (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton phosphorus components
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating
Description: alevel site time1

Title: MODIS Ice Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Description: Percentage ice-cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same as used by clisccp output from the ISCCP satellite simulator.
Processing Note: 7 pressure levels x 7 optical depth levels. THIS VARIABLE DOES NOT HAVE AN EXTRA COORDINATE - "p1000" is chosen to allow for form submission. [BD removed the p1000 coordinate on 4/9/24]
Atmosphere review comment:
Atmosphere team happy to accept variable.

Moved back to in progress, as it has been noted that there are duplicate compound names. Could suggest to the author to submit new physical parameters to avoid this.

Title: Northward Near-Surface Wind
Description: Northward component of the near surface wind
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, dynvar_basic, DAMIP_monthly, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, DCPP_Essential, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_permafrost
Processing Note: normally, the the wind component should be reported at the 10 meter height

Title: Dissolved Nitrate Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Snow Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized dianeutral mixing. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: O3 Destruction Rate
Description: ONLY provide the sum of the following reactions: (i) O(1D)+H2O; (ii) O3+HO2; (iii) O3+OH; (iv) O3+alkenes (isoprene, ethene,...)

Title: total emission rate of CH4
Description: This is the total emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere

Title: Tendency of northward wind due to orographic gravity waves
Description: Tendency of northward wind induced by the parameterized orographic gravity wave drag
Processing Note: We ask the modelling centers to report the induced tendencies separately for each component of the parameterization (where applicable) and to provide specific values of the tunable parameters used for the simulation in the metadata together with a specification of the part of the gravity wave spectrum that is targeted by the parameterization (e.g., minimally, the effective resolution of the model).

Title: Emission rate of NOx from aviation
Description: The is the emission rate of NOx from aircraft

Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Snowfall
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Title: Surface Downward Net Flux of Iron
Description: Iron supply through deposition flux onto sea surface, runoff, coasts, sediments, etc

Title: va200
Description: Northward wind at 200 hPa, 6 hourly instantaneous

Title: Soil Frozen Water Content
Description: the mass (summed over all all layers) of frozen water.

Title: Ocean Tracer Bolus Biharmonic Diffusivity
Description: Parameterized mesoscale eddy advection occurs on a spatial scale of many tens of kilometres and an evolutionary time of weeks(sometimes called bolus advection). Reference: James C. McWilliams 2016, Submesoscale currents in the ocean, Proceedings of the Royal Society A: Mathematical, Physical and Engineering Sciences, volume 472, issue 2189. DOI: 10.1098/rspa.2016.0117.
Processing Note: 2-d time dependent field

Title: Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Description: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content.  Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.

Title: Geothermal Heat Flux Beneath Land Ice
Bacterial Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of bacterial carbon component concentrations

Title: Daily mean surface NH4
Description: This is the daily mean for NH4 mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

Title: Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

Title: Stratiform Cloud Optical Depth
Description: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell.

Title: Geopotential Height
Description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

Title: Northward Ocean Heat Transport
Description: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.   Use Celsius for temperature scale.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: DAMIP_monthly, poleward_heat_transports, DCPP_Essential, paleo_ocean_transports, tipmip_extended, omip_transports_high_priority
Processing Note: For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.

Title: Global Average Sea Water Conservative Temperature
Description: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Title: Percentage Cover by Secondary Deciduous Trees
Description: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary deciduous trees.
Processing Note: Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

Title: CALIPSO High Level Cloud Area Percentage
Description: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 220hPa

Title: Pressure at Model Full-Levels
Description: Air pressure on model levels

Title: Sea Water Age Since Surface Contact
Description: Time elapsed since water was last in surface layer of the ocean.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence
Description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

Title: Eastward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Description: Tendency of the eastward wind by parameterized nonorographic gravity waves.

Title: Product of Air Temperature and Eastward Wind
Description: Product of air temperature and eastward wind

Title: Sea Surface Temperature
Description: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_daily, ocean_mesoscale, DCPP_Essential, paleo_ocean, fish_model_day, hydrology, biodiv_marine_daily, CFMIP_baseline, cordex [test], omip_scalar_fields, dynamical_downscaling_core, Ocean_acidification_oxygen_extremes, tipmip_extended, omip_scalars_low_priority
Processing Note: Report on the ocean horizontal native grid.
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CFMIP, CMIP, CORDEX, DAMIP, GMMIP, HighResMIP, VolMIP

Title: Stratiform Graupel Flux
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. Stratiform precipitation, whether liquid or frozen, is precipitation that formed in stratiform cloud. Graupel consists of heavily rimed snow particles, often called snow pellets; often indistinguishable from very small soft hail except when the size convention that hail must have a diameter greater than 5 mm is adopted. Reference: American Meteorological Society Glossary <http://glossary.ametsoc.org/wiki/Graupel>. There are also separate standard names for hail. Standard names for "graupel\_and\_hail" should be used to describe data produced by models that do not distinguish between hail and graupel.
Processing Note: report on model half-levels

Title: Cloud Optical Depth
Description: The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical\_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation\_wavelength or radiation\_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. "Cloud" means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.

Title: MODIS Liquid Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Description: Percentage liquid-cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the samed used by clisccp (ISCCP simulator).
Processing Note: 7 pressure levels x 7 optical depth levels. THIS VARIABLE SHOULD HAVE NO EXTRA COORDINATE - "p1000" is selected simply to submit this form. [BD removed the p1000 coordinate on 4/9/24]
Atmosphere review comment:
Atmosphere team happy to accept variable.

Moved back to in progress, as it has been noted that there are duplicate compound names. Could suggest to the author to submit new physical parameters to avoid this.

Title: Eastward Wind
Description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

Title: Sinking Particulate Silicon Flux
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
Processing Note: Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

Title: Ocean Kinetic Energy Dissipation per Unit Area Due to Vertical Friction
Description: Friction, leading to the dissipation of kinetic energy, arises in ocean models as a result of the viscosity of sea water.  Generally, the  lateral (xy) viscosity is given a large value to maintain the numerical stability of the model.  In contrast, the vertical viscosity is usually much smaller. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.

Title: Gross Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total GPP of grass in the grid cell

Title: Total Alkalinity
Description: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components)

Title: CALIPSO High Level Cloud Area Percentage
Description: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 220hPa

Title: Dissolved Silicon Amount in Sea Ice
Description: Mole amount means moles of substance per unit area

Title: Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Carbon concentration of diatoms
Description: Carbon concentration of diatoms
Processing Note: Analogous to Oday.phyc

Title: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 100m
Description: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 100m, monthly
Processing Note: Max instantaneous gust over grid cell, recorded monthly

Title: Condensed Water Path
Description: Liquid water path

Title: Surface Bacterial Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of bacterial carbon component concentrations

Title: Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)
Description: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force

Title: Ice Sheet Thickness
Description: The thickness of the ice sheet

Title: Natural Grass Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.

Title: Specific Humidity
Description: Specific Humidity

Title: Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer
Description: where land over land: this is computed as the total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the snow layer of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.

Title: Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

Title: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile
Description: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell\_method attribute "time: max")

Title: Chemical destruction of atmospheric H2
Description: This is the loss rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) from the atmosphere due to chemical destruction

Title: Percentage Cover of Sea Ice by Meltpond
Description: Percentage of sea ice, by area, which is covered by melt ponds, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .

Title: pH
Description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.
Processing Note: The variable at the depth of 200 meters is requested.

Title: Near-Surface Specific Humidity
Description: Near-surface (usually, 2 meter) specific humidity.

Title: Surface Water Storage
Description: Total liquid water storage, other than soil, snow or interception storage (i.e. lakes, river channel or depression storage).

Title: Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm Due to Stratospheric Volcanic Aerosols
Description: aerosol optical thickness at 550 nm due to stratospheric volcanic aerosols

Title: Sea Level Pressure
Description: Sea Level Pressure

Title: Mass of 13C in Vegetation
Description: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass).

Title: Specific Humidity
Description: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CFMIP, CMIP, CORDEX, DAMIP, HighResMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
Description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into soil from litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

Title: Aerosol Number Concentration
Description: "Number concentration" means the number of particles or other specified objects per unit volume. "Aerosol" means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. "Ambient\_aerosol" means that the aerosol is measured or modelled at the ambient state of pressure, temperature and relative humidity that exists in its immediate environment. "Ambient aerosol particles" are aerosol particles that have taken up ambient water through hygroscopic growth. The extent of hygroscopic growth depends on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles.

Title: Sea Water Vertical Velocity
Description: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

Title: Net Primary Production on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed\_as" is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.

Title: mrso5
Description: Soil moisture in the top 5 cm of the soil column
Processing Note: only provided for land locations

Title: Thickness of Refrozen Ice on Melt Pond
Description: Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by meltpond covered area
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: simple change from existing monthly variable to daily.

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Calculated in the absence of clouds.
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Gross Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total GPP of shrubs in the grid cell

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Phytoplankton Nitrogen in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton nitrogen component concentrations

Title: Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux
Description: includes both evaporation and sublimation

Title: Downward Flux of Aragonite
Description: Downward flux of Aragonite
Processing Note: Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

Title: Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Downwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

Title: PM10 Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Mass fraction atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 10 micrometers

Title: Near-Surface Relative Humidity
Description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
Processing Note: express as a percentage.  Normally, the relative humidity  should be reported at the 2 meter height

Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Litter on Land
Description: Needed to calculate litter bulk turnover time. Includes respiration from CWD as well.

Title: Percentage Cover by Shrub
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.

Title: OH Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Sea Level Pressure
Description: Sea Level Pressure
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CMIP, CORDEX, HighResMIP, VolMIP

Title: Aerodynamic Resistance
Description: aerodynamic\_resistance

Title: Relative Humidity
Description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

Title: Geothermal Heat Flux Beneath Land Ice
Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating
Description: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating

Title: Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of phytoplankton carbon component concentrations. In most (all?) cases this is the sum of phycdiat and phycmisc (i.e., "Diatom Carbon Concentration" and "Non-Diatom Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration"
Processing Note: The variable at the depth of 200 meters is requested

Title: Rainfall Flux
Description: rainfall flux at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the liquid phase

Title: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
Description: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
Processing Note: For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If CH4 is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Mole Fraction of CH4 (see the table entry before the previous one).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

Title: Total Respiration from Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total autotrophic respiration from all belowground plant parts.  This has benchmarking value because the sum of Rh and root respiration can be compared to observations of total soil respiration.

Title: Sinking Particulate Organic Nitrogen Flux
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
Processing Note: Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

Title: 6 hourly instantaneous integral of meridional moisture flux
Description: Same as intvaw but 6 hourly instantaneous
Processing Note: I don't think 6hrPlevPt is the appropriate table but I didn't know what table to select

Title: Carbon Mass in Fast Soil Pool
Description: fast is meant as lifetime of less than 10 years for  reference climate conditions (20 C, no water limitations).

Title: Convective Mass Flux
Description: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).
Processing Note: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).

Title: Surface Upwelling Clean Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface Upwelling Clear-sky, Aerosol Free Shortwave Radiation

Title: Temperature of Soil
Description: Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea".
Processing Note: If soil layer thicknesses vary from one location to another, interpolate to a standard set of depths.  Ideally, the interpolation should preserve the vertical integral.

Title: TOA Incident Shortwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, radiativeforcing_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, poleward_heat_transports, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, DCPP_Essential, ref_earth_system, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, CFMIP_baseline

Title: Snowfall Flux
Description: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, paleo_land_atmosphere_surface, DCPP_Wider, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_atmosphere, paleo_permafrost, omip_surface_fluxes_medium_priority, snow_allfreq

Title: Refreezing of Water in the Snow
Description: surface\_snow\_and\_ice\_refreezing\_flux

Title: Nitrogen Mass Flux out of Land Due to any Human Activity
Description: will require some careful definition to make sure we capture everything - any human activity that releases nitrogen from land  instead of into product pool goes here. E.g. Deforestation fire, harvest assumed to decompose straight away, grazing...

Title: C2H6 Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Geopotential Height
Description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CMIP, CORDEX, VIACSAB

Title: Instantaneous surface total organic aerosol mass mixing ratio at CF sites
Description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface organic aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours.
Processing Note: Unsure which cell measures to use in this case!

Title: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
Description: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

Title: Wet deposition of nitrate aerosol
Description: This is the loss rate of nitrate aerosol from the atmosphere due to wet deposition

Title: CloudSat Radar Reflectivity CFAD
Description: CloudSat Radar Reflectivity CFAD

Title: CALIPSO Percentage Cloud Cover
Description: CALIPSO Cloud Area Fraction

Title: O3 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Ridged Ice Thickness
Description: Sea Ice Ridge Height (representing mean height over the ridged area)

Title: C2H5OH  volume mixing ratio
Description: This is the mole fraction of ethanol (C2H5OH) in air

Title: Specific Humidity
Description: Specific Humidity

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized dianeutral mixing. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: TOA outgoing clear sky shortwave

Title: Downward Flux of Particulate Nitrogen
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
Processing Note: at 100 m depth.

Title: Vertically Integrated Eastward Dry Statice Energy Transport
Description: Vertically integrated eastward dry static energy transport (cp.T +zg).v (Mass\_weighted\_vertical integral of the product of eastward wind by dry static\_energy per mass unit)

Title: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
Description: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any "flux adjustment") .
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as remapped onto a latitude/longitude grid.

Title: Eastward Wind
Description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

Title: Convective Condensed Water Path
Description: calculate mass of convective condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: C2H2 Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Autotrophic Respiration on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total RA of shrubs in the grid cell

Title: Oxygen Minimum Concentration
Description: mole concentration of oxygen at the local minimum in the concentration profile that occurs closest to the sea surface.

Title: Relative Vorticity at 850hPa
Description: Relative vorticity is the upward component of the vorticity vector i.e. the component which arises from horizontal velocity.

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).
Processing Note: on all model levels
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CMIP, CORDEX, PMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, radiativeforcing_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, Bjerknes_Index_ENSO, poleward_heat_transports, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, paleodata_assimilation, paleo_radiation_fluxes, DCPP_Wider, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, biodiv_land_monthly, seaice_budget_energy_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_permafrost, landice_glaciers_allfreq

Title: Eastward Wind
Description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

Title: HCl Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydrogen chloride is HCl.

Title: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-13 as 13CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Gas exchange flux of abiotic 13CO2 (positive into ocean)

Title: total emission rate of C4H10
Description: This is the total emission rate of butane (C4H10) into the atmosphere

Title: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon
Description: Downward flux of particulate organic carbon
Processing Note: Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Convection
Description: Tendencies from cumulus convection scheme.

Title: Harvested Biomass That Goes Straight into Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: any harvested carbon that is assumed to decompose immediately into the atmosphere is reported here

Title: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Prognostic Salinity
Description: Full column sum of density\*cell thickness\*salinity. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.
