Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Eddy Viscosity Coefficient for Momentum
Description: Vertical diffusion coefficient for momentum due to parametrised eddies

Title: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice
Description: Surface temperature of all surfaces except open ocean, sampled synoptically.

Title: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
Description: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.

Title: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water
Description: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: Atmosphere CO2
Description: As co2, but only at the surface

Title: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice
Description: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: pH
Description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

Title: Surface albedo
Description: This is a band-average value for the surface albedo

Title: Total Net Production of Anthropogenic Secondary Organic Aerosol
Description: anthropogenic part of chepsoa

Title: Load of Dust
Description: The total dry mass of dust aerosol particles per unit area.

Title: Downwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

Title: Net Latent Heat Flux over Sea Ice
Description: the net latent heat flux over sea ice

Title: Surface Downward SF6 Flux
Description: gas exchange flux of SF6

Title: Cloud Water Mixing Ratio
Description: Cloud water mixing ratio

Title: Maximum Shear of Sea-Ice Velocity Field
Description: Maximum shear of sea-ice velocity field (second shear strain invariant)

Title: Tendency of Ocean Potential Energy Content Due to Tides
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  Potential energy is the sum of the gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the centripetal potential energy. (The geopotential is the specific potential energy.)  "Due to tides" means due to all astronomical gravity changes which manifest as tides.  No distinction is made between different tidal components. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

Title: Sea Water Y Velocity
Description: Prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Carbon Mass in Above-Ground Litter
Description: Surface or near-surface litter pool fed by leaf and above-ground litterfall

Title: Northward Near-Surface Wind
Description: Near surface northward wind

Title: Load of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
Description: atmosphere dry organic content: This is the vertically integrated sum of atmosphere\_primary\_organic\_content and atmosphere\_secondary\_organic\_content (see next two table entries).

Title: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Description: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.
Processing Note: For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.

Title: Hourly Surface PM1.0 Mixing Ratio
Description: Hourly PM1.0 Mass Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer

Title: Dust Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Dry mass fraction of dust aerosol particles in air.

Title: Natural Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2. In ocean biogeochemistry models, a "natural analogue" is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure difference between sea water and air is positive when the partial pressure of the dissolved gas in sea water is greater than the partial pressure in air.

Title: Surface Downward Y Stress Correction
Description: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
Processing Note: If this does not vary from one year to the next, report only a single year. Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: C3H8 Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Radiative Heating
Description: Model levels or plev\_27

Title: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface
Description: This is the flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Precipitation
Description: includes both liquid and solid phases

Title: Temperature at Snow-Ice Interface
Description: Report surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero
CMIP7 Variable Groups: seaice_state_monthly_advanced, paleo_cryosphere, CFMIP_baseline, snow_allfreq, paleo_cryosphere_high_priority, paleo_cryosphere_medium_priority

Title: Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Fluxes are requested at all levels

Title: Sinking Flux of Particulate Silicon Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Description: Downward sinking flux of particulate silicon at seafloor
Processing Note: Variable value should be reported as the flux exiting the bottom of the deepest ocean layer
Cross-thematic group review comment: Matches pattern of existing Omon variables.

Title: Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Floating Ice Shelf
Description: quantity averaged over floating land ice

Title: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Evaporation and Sublimation
Description: The rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area

Title: Surface pH
Description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

Title: Snow Depth
Description: where land over land, this is computed as the mean thickness of snow in the land portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire land portion, including the snow-free fraction).  Reported as 0.0 where the land fraction is 0.

Title: CH3OH  volume mixing ratio
Description: The is the mole fraction of methanol (CH3OH) in air

Title: Surface Carbonate Ion Concentration
Description: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).

Title: ISCCP Mean Cloud Top Pressure
Description: time-means weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction - see <http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html>

Title: Mass Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll concentration from the calcite-producing phytoplankton component alone
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation
Description: Flux corresponding to rsutcs resulting from aerosol-free call to radiation, following Ghan (ACP, 2013)

Title: Eastward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Description: Tendency of the eastward wind by parameterized orographic gravity waves.

Title: Non-Biogenic Iron Scavenging
Description: Dissolved Fe removed through nonbiogenic scavenging onto particles

Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Boundary Layer Mixing
Description: Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive terms.

Title: Temperature Flux Due to Evaporation Expressed as Heat Flux out of Sea Water
Description: This is defined as "where ice\_free\_sea over sea"
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Land Ice Calving Flux
Description: Loss of ice mass resulting from iceberg calving. Computed as the rate of mass loss by the ice shelf (in kg s-1) divided by the horizontal area of the ice sheet (m2) in the grid box.

Title: Minimum PBL Height
Description: minimum boundary layer height during the day (add cell\_methods attribute: "time: minimum")

Title: Upward Component of Land-Ice Basal Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). "basal" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere

Title: Ocean Tracer Epineutral Biharmonic Diffusivity
Description: Epineutral diffusivity means a lateral diffusivity along a either a neutral or isopycnal density surface due to motion which is not resolved on the grid scale of an ocean model. The type of density surface is dependent on the model formulation.

Title: Temperature of Soil
Description: Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea".

Title: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, clouds_basic_average, radiativeforcing_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, poleward_heat_transports, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, DCPP_Essential, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_atmosphere, ref_earth_system

Title: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass\_flux\_of\_carbon\_into\_litter\_from\_vegetation\_due\_to\_mortality and mass\_flux\_of\_carbon\_into\_litter\_from\_vegetation\_due\_to\_senescence is mass\_flux\_of\_carbon\_into\_litter\_from\_vegetation.

Title: Carbon Harvested Due to Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Process That Enters Anthropogenic Product Pools on Tile
Description: This annual mean flux refers to the transfer of carbon primarily through harvesting land use into anthropogenic product pools, e.g.,deforestation or wood harvesting from primary or secondary lands, food harvesting on croplands, harvesting (grazing) by animals on pastures.

Title: Basal Temperature of Grounded Ice Sheet
Description: quantity averaged over grounded land ice

Title: Tendency of Ocean Potential Energy Content Due to Background
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  Potential energy is the sum of the gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the centripetal potential energy. (The geopotential is the specific potential energy.)  "Due to background" means caused by a time invariant imposed field which may be either constant over the globe or spatially varying, depending on the ocean model used. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

Title: CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 560hPa

Title: Grid Averaged Methane Emissions from Wetlands
Description: Net upward flux of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

Title: chemical production of atmospheric H2
Description: This is the production of molecular hydrogen (H2) in the atmosphere due to chemical production

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Longwave Radiative Heating
Description: alevel site time1

Title: Time Varying Gridbox thickness at v-points
Description: The time varying thickness of the gridboxes computed on the v-points

Title: Transformed Eulerian Mean Northward Wind
Description: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics v\*, meridional component of the residual meridional circulation (v\*, w\*) derived from 6 hr or higher frequency data fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available).

Title: Transformed Eulerian Mean Upward Wind
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Y-Component of Sea-Ice Velocity
Description: The y-velocity of ice on native model grid
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, seaice_dynamics_basic, paleo_cryosphere, DCPP_Wider, SO_BGC-cloud_ocean_monthly, paleo_cryosphere_high_priority

Title: Calcite Production
Description: Vertically integrated calcite production

Title: Depth of Oxygen Minimum Concentration
Description: Depth of vertical minimum concentration of dissolved oxygen gas (if two, then the shallower)

Title: Mean-Squared Northward Wind Speed
Description: v\*v

Title: Nitrogen Fixation Rate in Ocean
Description: Vertically integrated nitrogen fixation

Title: Percentage of Grid Cell That Is Land but neither Vegetation Covered nor Bare Soil
Description: fraction of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by "non-vegetation" and "non-bare-soil" (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)
Processing Note: add scalar coordinate type???and add "???" to the CF area type table.

Title: Downward Flux of Calcite
Description: Downward flux of Calcite
Processing Note: Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

Title: Water Vapor Path
Description: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CORDEX, DAMIP

Title: HNO3 Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Specific Humidity
Description: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.
Processing Note: on all model levels
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CMIP, CORDEX, PMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Advection
Description: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Advection

Title: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton iron component concentrations

Title: Upward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Transpiration
Description: Transpiration

Title: Total Surface Mass Balance Flux
Description: Greenland

Title: Surface Albedo of Land without Snow
Description: albedo of the portion of land that is not covered by ice, potentially considering sub-gridscale inhomogeneity of ice cover

Title: Calcite Dissolution
Description: Rate of change of Calcite carbon mole concentration  due to dissolution

Title: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress
Description: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Decomposition out of Product Pools to CO2 in Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.

Title: Ice Sheet Surface Snow Melt
Description: Loss of snow mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the surface melt water from snow on the ice sheet portion of the grid cell divided by the ice\_sheet area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 for snow-free land\_ice regions; report as missing where the land fraction is 0.

Title: Near-Surface Air Temperature
Description: Temperature at surface

Title: Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Snow Water Equivalent Intercepted by the Vegetation
Description: canopy\_snow\_amount

Title: Terrestrial Water Storage
Description: requested for C4MIP, OCMIP/OMIP, LUMIP, ScenarioMIP, DECK, DAMIP, GeoMIP, LS3MIP, ??

Title: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
Description: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

Title: Sinking Particulate Silicon Flux
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
Processing Note: Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

Title: Sea-Ice Area North
Description: total area of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere

Title: Mass Fraction of Snow in Air
Description: Snow mixing ratio

Title: Daily Snow Heat Content per Unit Area
Description: Heat-content of all snow in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Snow-water equivalent at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of sea ice.
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: simple change from existing monthly variable to daily.

Title: Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Percentage Crop Cover
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.
Processing Note: Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

Title: Near-Surface Wind Speed
Description: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind
Processing Note: normally, the the wind  should be reported at the 10 meter height

Title: Abiotic pH
Description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1 (abiotic component)..

Title: surface precipitation
Description: This is the total precipitation at the surface
Processing Note: This variable is being requested as instantaneous fields every 6 hours. Was unsure which Table to select! I think I want something like 6hrPt rather than 6hrPlevPt

Title: Grounded Ice Sheet Area Percentage
Description: This is needed to distinguish between grounded glaciated ice (grounded = ice sheet and glacier) and ice shelves (floating over sea water), since land\_ice is by definition ice sheet, glacier and ice shelves

Title: Mole Fraction of N2O
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

Title: MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice
Description: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint  distribution, ice

Title: Photolysis Rate of Ozone (O3) to Excited Atomic Oxygen (the Singlet D State, O1D)
Description: proposed name: photolysis\_rate\_of\_ozone\_to\_O1D

Title: Northern Hemisphere Tracer Lifetime
Description: Fixed surface layer mixing ratio over 30o-50oN (0 ppbv), uniform fixed source (at all levels) everywhere else (source is unspecified but must be constant in space and time and documented). Note that the source could be 1yr/yr, so the tracer concentration provides mean age in years. For method using linearly increasing tracer include a method attribute: "linearly increasing tracer"For method using uniform source (1yr/yr) include a method attribute: "uniform source"

Title: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Advection by Sea-Ice Dynamics
Description: The rate of change of snow mass through advection with sea ice divided by sea-ice area

Title: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Surface Melting
Description: The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice surface divided by grid-cell area

Title: Geopotential Height
Description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CORDEX, HighResMIP

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from calcareous (calcite-producing) phytoplankton component alone

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: Surface Pressure .. needed for vertical coordinates

Title: Mole Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from calcareous (calcite-producing) phytoplankton component alone
Processing Note: "Tracer" concentrations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Processing Note: This is a 3-hour mean flux.

Title: Carbon in Vegetation on Land-Use Tiles
Description: end of year values (not annual mean)

Title: Carbon Mass in Soil on Shrub Tiles
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The "soil content" of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including content\_of\_soil\_layer are used.

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: Surface Pressure .. needed for vertical coordinates

Title: Heterotrophic Respiration on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers), calculated on land-use tiles.

Title: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface
Description: This is the flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Carbon concentration of picophytoplankton
Description: Carbon concentration of picophytoplankton
Processing Note: Analogous to Oday.phyc

Title: Monthly surface snow amount
Description: As snw but defined as Lmon (Not sure about this though - it seems already available as LImon but I'm guessing that's only over land ice?)

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from residual mean (sum of Eulerian mean + parameterized eddy-induced) advection. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Surface Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface Upwelling Clear-sky Shortwave Radiation
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, radiativeforcing_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, paleo_radiation_fluxes, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, CFMIP_baseline

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Calculated in the absence of clouds.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, clouds_basic_average, radiativeforcing_monthly, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, paleo_radiation_fluxes, DCPP_Wider, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_atmosphere

Title: Surface upwelling shortwave radiation
Description: Surface upwelling shortwave radiation

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Net Shortwave Surface Radiation
Description: Net downward shortwave radiation at the surface

Title: Global Average Sea Surface Temperature
Description: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature.

Title: Stratiform Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
Description: Droplets are liquid.  The effective radius is defined as the ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution and the time-mean should be calculated, weighting the individual samples by the cloudy fraction of the grid cell.

Title: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
Description: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.
Processing Note: In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e., it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions). Include enough depth levels to represent the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe. Report on native horizontal grid. If a function of depth, perform online remapping to depth or pressure, if not native vertical grid.

Title: 6 hourly instantaneous northward wind in additional levels within the UTLS region
Description: 6 hourly instantaneous northward wind at 2 additional pressure levels in the UTLS region (175 and 225 hPa)
Processing Note: subset of 27 pressure levels to cover the UTLS region

Title: Carbon Mass in Leaves
Description: Carbon mass per unit area in leaves.
Processing Note: This field and some of the following may sum to yield some of the more generic carbon pool totals given above.

Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Nitrogen Due to Biological Activity
Description: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)
Processing Note: integral over upper 100 m only.

Title: Ocean Tracer Diffusivity Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Description: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced advective transport. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the 'thickness' diffusivity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was called 'ocean tracer bolus laplacian diffusivity'.  The CMIP6 name is physically more relevant.

Title: TOA Outgoing Longwave Radiation
Description: TOA outgoing longwave radiation

Title: Carbon Mass in Litter on Shrub Tiles
Description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon has the standard name litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon.

Title: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Diatoms
Description: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the diatom phytoplankton component alone

Title: Basal Temperature of Grounded Ice Sheet
Description: quantity averaged over grounded ice sheet

Title: Surface Temperature
Description: Surface temperature (skin for open ocean)

Title: Maximum Hourly Precipitation Rate
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Surface Temperature of Sea Ice
Description: Report surface temperature of snow where snow covers the sea ice.

Title: Geopotential Height at 1000hPa
Description: Geopotential height on the 1000 hPa surface

Title: Total Runoff
Description: computed as the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell.

Title: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice
Description: Surface temperature of all surfaces except open ocean.
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CFMIP, CMIP, CORDEX, DAMIP, HighResMIP, PMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: Longitude
Description: Longitude is positive eastward; its units of degree\_east (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid\_longitude should be used instead of longitude. Grid longitude is positive in the grid-eastward direction, but its units should be plain degree.
Processing Note: Note that the CF convention and CMOR2 require that this field will be included in each file that contains a variable that is a function of the "site" dimension, so there is no need to save this field by itself.  It is included here simply to indicate that longitudes should be stored for the site grid in each file written.

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate organic iron component concentrations

Title: Convective Precipitation
Description: Convective precipitation flux

Title: zg925
Description: Geopotential Height at 925 hPa, 6 hourly instantaneous

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate organic nitrogen component concentrations

Title: Tendency of Ocean Eddy Kinetic Energy Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Description: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from parameterized eddy-induced advection. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.
Processing Note: 2-d time dependent field

Title: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Floating Ice Shelf
Description: quantity averaged over floating land ice

Title: Mole Fraction of CO2
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Processing Note: For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Total Atmospheric Mass of CO2 (see the table entry after the next one).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

Title: Precipitation Flux from Shallow Convection
Description: Shallow convection precipitation flux

Title: Convective Precipitation
Description: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Due to Biological Activity
Description: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic carbon
Processing Note: integral over upper 100 m only.

Title: Snowfall Flux
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

Title: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Gas exchange flux of CO2 (positive into ocean)

Title: Internal Stress Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
Description: X-component of force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma)

Title: Net Longwave Surface Radiation
Description: Net longwave radiation

Title: Internal Stress Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)
Description: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma)

Title: Northward Near-Surface Wind
Description: Northward component of the near surface wind
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Instantaneous surface NO3 aerosol mass mixing ratio at CF sites
Description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface NO3 Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
Processing Note: Not sure which cell measures to use here!

Title: Y-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
Description: Y-component of ocean stress on sea ice

Title: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Flux of carbon-14 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.

Title: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
Description: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.
Processing Note: integrate over uppermost 10 cm

Title: Total Basal Mass Balance Flux
Description: Antarctica

Title: 3-hourly u-wind at 100m
Description: 3-hourly u-wind at 100m3-hourly u-wind at 100m3-hourly u-wind at 100m3-hourly u-wind at 100m3-hourly u-wind at 100m3-hourly u-wind at 100m3-hourly u-wind at 100m3-hourly u-wind at 100m

Title: Ocean Momentum XY Biharmonic Diffusivity
Description: Lateral biharmonic viscosity applied to the momentum equations.

Title: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model
Description: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
Description: To be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all bounday layer terms including and diffusive terms.

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

Title: total emission rate of C2H4
Description: This is the total emission rate of ethene (C2H4) into the atmosphere

Title: Sinking Flux of Particulate Organic Phosphorus Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Description: Downward sinking flux of particulate organic phosphorus at seafloor
Processing Note: Variable value should be reported as the flux exiting the bottom of the deepest ocean layer
Cross-thematic group review comment: Matches pattern of existing Omon variables.

Title: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change
Description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

Title: Global Average Sea Surface Temperature
Description: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature.

Title: Near-Surface Air Temperature on Land Use Tile
Description: Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature.

Title: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
Description: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.
Processing Note: integrate over uppermost 10 cm

Title: Percentage Crop Cover
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: TOA outgoing clear sky longwave

Title: Ambient Aerosol Optical Thickness at 440nm
Description: AOD from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 440 nm"

Title: Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

Title: Global Mean Sea Water Salinity
Description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Title: Ice Sheet Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Ice Sheet Thickness
Description: The thickness of the ice sheet

Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity
Description: Tendency of Specific Humidity

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air Temperature
Processing Note: on all model levels
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CMIP, CORDEX, PMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: Total emission rate of molecular hydrogen (H2)
Description: This is the total emission rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) into the atmosphere (i.e., integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field)

Title: Surface Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: This is a 3-hour mean flux.

Title: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation in 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

Title: Omega (=dp/dt)
Description: commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

Title: Ocean Tracer Epineutral Laplacian Diffusivity
Description: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced diffusive transport oriented along neutral or isopycnal directions. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the neutral diffusivity or isopycnal diffusivity or Redi diffusivity.
Processing Note: 2-d time dependent field

Title: CALIPSO Liquid Cloud Percentage
Description: CALIPSO Liquid Cloud Fraction

Title: Net Chemistry Tendency of O3 in troposphere
Description: This is the net chemical tendency of ozone in the troposphere. The distinction between the stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the definition of the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp).

Title: Sea Water Potential Temperature at Sea Floor
Description: Potential temperature at the ocean bottom-most grid cell.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.

Title: sea salt aaod@550nm
Description: This is the sea salt aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

Title: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NH3
Description: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NH3 at surface

Title: Northward Wind
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Mole Concentration of Dimethyl Sulphide in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration of dimethyl sulphide in water

Title: Net Primary Production Allocated to Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This is the rate of carbon uptake by roots due to NPP

Title: Carbon Mass in Model Soil Pool
Description: Carbon mass in the full depth of the soil model.

Title: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Wood debris" means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent.

Title: Percentage Cover of Sea Ice by Meltpond
Description: Percentage of sea ice, by area, which is covered by melt ponds, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: simple change from existing monthly variable to daily.

Title: Carbon Mass Flux from Litter, CWD or any non-Living Pool into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources

Title: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
Description: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
Processing Note: Report only for simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), in which the CH4 does not vary from one year to the next. Report 12 monthly values, starting with January, even if the values do not vary seasonally.  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as ch4globalClim, not ch4global.  If CH4 is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4 (see the table entry before the previous one).   Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Boundary Layer Mixing
Description: alevel site time1

Title: Turnover Rate of Each Model Soil Carbon Pool
Description: defined as 1/(turnover time) for each soil pool. Use the same pools reported under cSoilPools

Title: Sea Surface Salinity
Description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, surgemip_variables, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, paleodata_assimilation, DCPP_Essential, marine_bgc_baseline, paleo_ocean, fish_model_core_mon, omip_scalar_fields, dynamical_downscaling_ocean_core, tipmip_baseline, omip_scalars_high_priority
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.

Title: Photolysis Rate of Diatomic Molecular Oxygen
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Net Rate of Absorption of Shortwave Energy in Ocean Layer
Description: "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. "Layer" means any layer with upper and lower boundaries that have constant values in some vertical coordinate. There must be a vertical coordinate variable indicating the extent of the layer(s). If the layers are model layers, the vertical coordinate can be model\_level\_number, but it is recommended to specify a physical coordinate (in a scalar or auxiliary coordinate variable) as well. Net absorbed radiation is the difference between absorbed and emitted radiation.

Title: Oxygen Minimum Concentration
Description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'. The concentration of any chemical species, whether particulate or dissolved, may vary with depth in the ocean.  A depth profile may go through one or more local minima in concentration. The mole\_concentration\_of\_molecular\_oxygen\_in\_sea\_water\_at\_shallowest\_local\_minimum\_in\_vertical\_profile is the mole concentration of oxygen at the local minimum in the concentration profile that occurs closest to the sea surface.

Title: Near-Surface Wind Speed
Description: Near surface wind speed

Title: Downward Heat Flux into Snow Where Land over Land
Description: the net downward heat flux from the atmosphere into the snow that lies on land divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing for snow-free land regions or where the land fraction is 0.

Title: Surface Calcite Concentration
Description: sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

Title: Total Wave Significant Wave Height
Description: Wind driven surface gravity waves at the ocean surface, generated by the wave model , wave Height
Processing Note: Grid point normal output from wave model

Title: Elemental Carbon Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Dry mass fraction of black carbon aerosol particles in air.

Title: Irradiance Limitation of Diazotrophs
Description: Growth limitation of diazotrophs due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

Title: Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress
Description: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Sea Water Y Velocity
Description: Prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, surgemip_variables, Bjerknes_Index_ENSO, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_3d_monthly, marine_bgc_baseline, paleo_ocean_3D, DCPP_Wider, SO_BGC-cloud_ocean_monthly, fish_model_expand_mon, dynamical_downscaling_ocean_core, tipmip_baseline, omip_vectors_high_priority
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Surface Dissolved Iron Concentration
Description: dissolved iron in sea water is meant to include both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not, e.g., particulate detrital iron)

Title: Surface Downward Eastward Wind Stress
Description: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Description: The phrase "residual mean advection" refers to the sum of the model's resolved advective transport plus any parameterized advective transport. Parameterized advective transport includes processes such as parameterized mesoscale and submesoscale transport, as well as any other advectively parameterized transport. When the parameterized advective transport is represented in the model as a skew-diffusion rather than an advection, then the parameterized skew diffusion should be included in this diagnostic, since the convergence of skew-fluxes are identical (in the continuous formulation) to the convergence of advective fluxes.

Title: Mole Fraction of N2O
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

Title: Sea-Ice Mass Change from Dynamics
Description: Total change in sea-ice mass through dynamics-related processes (advection,...) divided by grid-cell area

Title: Westward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization
Description: The vertical flux of zonal momentum within the orographic GW parameterization.

Title: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Relative Humidity
Description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: AgModelExpandedDaily, AgWaterCore, AgWaterExt, HealthHeatCoreDaily, HeatHealthExpandedDaily, HealthPollutionDaily, CFMIP_baseline
Processing Note: normally report this at 2 meters above the surface

Title: Sea-Ice Freeboard
Description: Mean height of sea-ice surface (=snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level

Title: Wet Deposition Rate of SO4
Description: proposed name: tendency\_of\_atmosphere\_mass\_content\_of\_sulfate\_dry\_aerosol\_due\_to\_wet\_deposition

Title: Percentage Cover by C4 Plant Functional Type
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C4 PFTs (including grass and crops).
Processing Note: Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

Title: Net Shortwave Surface Radiation
Description: Net shortwave radiation

Title: Net Longwave Surface Radiation
Description: Net longwave surface radiation

Title: Convective Mass Flux
Description: convective mass flux

Title: Gross primary production in sea ice as carbon amount flu
Description: Total GPP of ice algae in sea ice

Title: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
Description: This variable measures the virtual salt flux into sea water due to the melting of sea ice. It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.
Processing Note: The priority set by the WGOMD was 2 for this field.  The sea-ice folks requested that the priority be raised to 1. Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Sea Water Volume
Description: Total volume of liquid sea water.

Title: Abiotic Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2. In ocean biogeochemistry models, an "abiotic analogue" is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure difference between sea water and air is positive when the partial pressure of the dissolved gas in sea water is greater than the partial pressure in air.

Title: Daily mean surface BC
Description: This is the daily mean elemental carbon mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

Title: Carbon Transferred to Soil or Litter Pools Due to Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Processes on Tile
Description: This annual mean flux refers to the transfer of carbon into soil or litter pools due to any land use or land-cover change activities

Title: Specific Humidity
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CORDEX, HighResMIP

Title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Calcareous Phytoplankton
Description: Primary (organic carbon) production by the calcite-producing phytoplankton component alone

Title: Ice Sheet Mass That Does not Displace Sea Water
Description: Antarctica

Title: Surface Dissolved Oxygen Concentration at Saturation
Description: "Mole concentration at saturation" means the mole concentration in a saturated solution. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen".

Title: Dust Optical Depth at 865nm
Description: Total aerosol AOD due to dust aerosol at a wavelength of 865 nanometres.

Title: Ice Sheet Total Runoff
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Near-Surface Wind Speed
Description: near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.

Title: Y-Component of Land Ice Vertical Mean Velocity
Description: The vertical mean land ice velocity is the average from the bedrock to the surface of the ice

Title: Carbon Mass in Slow Soil Pool
Description: fast is meant as lifetime of more than 100 years for  reference climate conditions (20 C, no water limitations)

Title: Primary Organic Carbon Production by All Types of Phytoplankton
Description: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton.  This should equal the sum of intpdiat+intpphymisc, but those individual components may be unavailable in some models.

Title: Cloud Condensation Nuclei Concentration at Liquid Cloud Top
Description: proposed name: number\_concentration\_of\_ambient\_aerosol\_in\_air\_at\_liquid\_water\_cloud\_top

Title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Diazotrophs
Description: Primary (organic carbon) production by the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

Title: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
Description: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: hu500
Description: Relative humidity at 500 hPa, 6 hourly instantaneous

Title: CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Fraction

Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: Surface downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Permafrost Layer Thickness
Description: permafrost\_layer\_thickness

Title: Wet Bulb Potential Temperature
Description: plev\_7

Title: Ocean Drag Coefficient
Description: Oceanic drag coefficient that is used to calculate the oceanic momentum drag on sea ice

Title: Heterotrophic Respiration on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total RH of trees in the grid cell

Title: Total Column Ozone
Description: Total ozone column

Title: Iron Production
Description: Vertically integrated biogenic iron production

Title: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Description: zero for models using real water fluxes.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Aerosol Water Optical Thickness at 550nm
Description: proposed name: atmosphere\_optical\_thickness\_due\_to\_water\_ambient\_aerosol

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Total Emission Rate of NH3
Description: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Title: Convective Mass Flux
Description: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  The flux is computed as the mass divided by the area of the grid cell.
Processing Note: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).

Title: TOA Clear-Sky Longwave Radiative Forcing Due to Aerosols
Description: Clear-Sky LW-RF Aerosols at TOA

Title: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Gas exchange flux of CO2 (positive into ocean)
CMIP7 Variable Groups: DAMIP_monthly, DCPP_Essential, marine_bgc_baseline, DCPP_Wider, c4mip_ocean_carbon_cycle_tier1, FireMIP_monthly, ref_earth_system, co2_emissions_concentration_mapping

Title: Surface Albedo of ice-covered Surface
Description: This describes the albedo of any surface covered by ice, land and ocean

Title: Sea Water Additional Potential Temperature
Description: The quantity with standard name sea\_water\_added\_potential\_temperature is a passive tracer in an ocean model whose surface flux does not come from the atmosphere but is imposed externally upon the simulated climate system. The surface flux is expressed as a heat flux and converted to a passive tracer increment as if it were a heat flux being added to potential temperature. The passive tracer is transported within the ocean as if it were potential temperature. The passive tracer is zero in the control climate of the model. The passive tracer records added heat, as described for the CMIP6 FAFMIP experiment (doi:10.5194/gmd-9-3993-2016), following earlier ideas. Potential temperature is the temperature a parcel of air or sea water would have if moved adiabatically to sea level pressure.

Title: Meltpond Mass per Unit Area (as Depth)
Description: Meltpond Depth
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: simple change from existing monthly variable to daily.

Title: Snow Soot Content
Description: the entire land portion of the grid cell is considered, with snow soot content set to 0.0 in regions free of snow.

Title: Dissolved Silicon Amount in Sea Ice
Description: Mole amount means moles of substance per unit area

Title: Snow Surface Temperature
Description: Snow Surface Temperature

Title: Dissolved Iron Concentration
Description: dissolved iron in sea water is meant to include both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not, e.g., particulate detrital iron)

Title: Eastward Wind
Description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

Title: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics
Processing Note: If only the vertically integrated heat flux is available, report as this 2-d field; otherwise hfibthermds should be used.

Title: Load of SO4
Description: The total dry mass of sulfate aerosol particles per unit area.

Title: Gas-Phase Production Rate of SO4
Description: proposed name: tendency\_of\_atmosphere\_mass\_content\_of\_sulfate\_dry\_aerosol\_due\_to\_gas\_phase\_net\_chemical\_production

Title: Maximum Shear Stress in Sea Ice
Description: Maximum shear stress in sea ice (second stress invariant)

Title: Carbon Mass in Below-Ground Litter
Description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "subsurface litter" means the part of the litter mixed within the soil below the surface. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon has the standard name litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon.

Title: TOA Outgoing Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation
Description: Flux corresponding to rsut resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation

Title: total emission rate of NOx from all biomass burning
Description: This is the total emission rate of nitrogen oxides (NOx) from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

Title: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Near-Surface Air Temperature
Description: near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton nitrogen component concentrations

Title: Precipitation over Crop Tile
Description: includes both liquid and solid phases

Title: Near-Surface Air Temperature
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

Title: Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Downwelling Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Downwelling longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

Title: Zonal mean northward Reynolds stress from non-orographic gravity wave parameterization
Description: Zonal mean vertical wave flux of meridional momentum within the non-orographic GW parameterization

Title: Particulate Organic Carbon Content
Description: Vertically integrated POC

Title: Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Ecosystem Productivity on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Net Ecosystem Exchange

Title: Rate of Change of Total Alkalinity
Description: vertical integral of net time rate of change of total alkalinity
Processing Note: integral over upper 100 m only.

Title: Upward Component of Land-Ice Surface Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere

Title: CALIPSO Percentage Cloud Cover
Description: Percentage cloud cover in CALIPSO standard atmospheric layers.
Processing Note: 40 height levels

Title: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
Description: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.
Processing Note: For models with a distinct shallow convection scheme only.

Title: Aerosol Extinction Coefficient
Description: Aerosol Extinction @550nm

Title: Temperature Tendency Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Dissipation
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Surface Snow and Ice Melt Flux
Description: Loss of snow and ice mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the total surface melt on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.

Title: sea_ice_temperature_expressed_as_heat_content_daily

Processing Note: Time and Area Mean on Single Level, Masked (Sea), daily

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Dimethyl Sulphide in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration of dimethyl sulphide in water in the near surface layer

Title: Ice Sheet Surface Mass Balance Flux
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Snowfall Flux

Description: Tendency of the zonal mean zonal wind due to the divergence of the Eliassen-Palm flux.

This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Title: Specific Humidity
Description: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

Title: Snow Depth
Description: where land over land, this is computed as the mean thickness of snow in the land portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire land portion, including the snow-free fraction).  Reported as missing where the land fraction is 0.

Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Cloud Ice

Title: TOA outgoing longwave flux assuming clear sky and reference methane field
Description: This is the outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field

Title: Ocean Tracer Diffusivity Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Description: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced advective transport. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the "thickness" diffusivity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was called "ocean tracer bolus laplacian diffusivity".  The CMIP6 name is physically more relevant.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Description: Upper 2000m, 2D field

Title: Northward Gravity Wave Drag
Description: Parameterised y- component of gravity wave drag

Title: Surface Downward Eastward Wind Stress
Description: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface

Title: Surface Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
Description: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Title: CALIPSO Low Level Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 840hPa

Title: Total Emission Rate of Dust
Description: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: Surface downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation

Title: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius
Description: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere.TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Title: 6 hourly instantaneous temperature in the UTLS region
Description: 6 hourly instantaneous temperature at 3 pressure levels in the UTLS region (100, 150 and 225 hPa)
Processing Note: Subset of 27 pressure levels to cover the UTLS region

Title: ISCCP Cloud Area Percentage
Description: ISCCP 7x7

Title: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O
Description: Global mean Nitrous Oxide (N2O)
Processing Note: For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If N2O is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry before the previous one).   Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

Title: Emon.alb
Description: surface albedo at grid cell level (i.e. the albedo averaged over all potential subgrid-scale structures) over all wave-bands; this shall apply to all realms (land, ocean, sea ice, land ice)
Processing Note: There is a variable AERmon.albsrfc, but I am not sure whether the definition applies to the description above; furthermore, the variable would also be of relevance outside of the AER focus, hence we may consider whether it should go into another category as well (I had Emon in mind.); Whether this variable should be provided at atmosphere/land or ocean grid, and the respective grid cell metrics, must be discussed.

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air Temperature

Title: Total Alkalinity
Description: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components)
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of "Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration" plus "Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration"
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer" concentrations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Total Nitrogen Added for Cropland Fertilisation (Artificial and Manure)
Description: Total Nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure). Relative to total land area of a grid cell, not relative to agricultural area

Title: Mole Fraction of O3
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: Floating Ice Shelf Area Percentage
Description: This is needed in case the floating ice sheet area changes in time (NO grounded ice sheet)

Title: Land Ice Calving Flux
Description: Loss of ice mass resulting from iceberg calving. Computed as the rate of mass loss by the ice shelf (in kg s-1) divided by the horizontal area of the ice sheet (m2) in the grid box.

Title: Surface Temperature on Landuse Tile
Description: Surface temperature (i.e. temperature at which long-wave radiation emitted)

Title: Mass of Water Vapor Containing Oxygen-17 (H2 17O) in Layer
Description: Water vapor path for water molecules that contain oxygen-17 (H2 17O)

Title: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus
Description: vertical integral of net  time rate of change of phosphate
Processing Note: integral over upper 100 m only.

Title: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O
Description: Global mean Nitrous Oxide (N2O)
Processing Note: Report only for simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), in which the N2O does not vary from one year to the next. Report 12 monthly values, starting with January, even if the values do not vary seasonally.  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as ch4globalClim, not ch4global.  If N2O is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry before the previous one).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

Title: Hourly downward solar radiation flux at the surface
Description: Hourly downward solar radiation flux at the surface

Title: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: Surface Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-14 Concentration
Description: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic 14carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Title: Calcite Saturation Depth
Description: Depth of calcite saturation horizon (0 if < surface, "missing" if > bottom, if two, then the shallower)

Title: Total Nitrogen Loss to Leaching or Runoff (Sum of Ammonium, Nitrite and Nitrate)
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due\_to\_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Leaching" means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, "runoff" refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.

Title: Sea Water Vertical Velocity
Description: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, Bjerknes_Index_ENSO, aerchemmip_3d_monthly, marine_bgc_baseline, paleo_ocean_3D, DCPP_Wider, SO_BGC-cloud_ocean_monthly, fish_model_expand_mon, omip_vectors_high_priority
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

Title: Surface daily mean PM1.0
Description: This is the daily mean for PM1.0 mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

Title: MODIS Condensed Water Path
Description: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column) as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.

Title: Surface Snow Melt
Description: The total surface snow melt rate on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; report as zero for snow-free land regions and missing where there is no land.

Title: Upwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

Title: Depth Below Geoid of Interfaces Between Ocean Layers
Description: Depth below geoid
Processing Note: This 3-d time dependent field should only be saved for models where it cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored in the file.

Title: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC11
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3.  The IUPAC name for CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane.

Title: Upward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Convective Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
Description: alevel site time1

Title: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
Description: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.
