CMIP7 Variable Groups: temperature_variability_daily_highpriority, HealthFloodingDaily, hydrology, biodiv_freshwater_daily, biodiv_land_daily, WaterResources_daily, CFMIP_baseline
Processing Note: integrate over uppermost 10 cm

Title: Surface Upwelling Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation in Bands
Description: Calculated in the absence of aerosols and clouds, following Ghan (ACP, 2013). This requires a double-call in the radiation code with precisely the same meteorology.

Title: Leaf Area Index
Description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.
Processing Note: Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

Title: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Atmosphere as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature
Description: Tendency of Air Temperature

Title: Surface Radiative Temperature
Description: Surface Radiative Temperature

Title: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Grounded Ice Sheet
Description: quantity averaged over grounded land ice

Title: Snow Internal Temperature
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

Title: Specific Humidity
Description: in Amon

Title: Carbon Mass in Wood
Description: Carbon Mass in Wood

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.

Title: Average Layer Fraction of Liquid Moisture
Description: mass\_fraction\_of\_unfrozen\_water\_in\_soil\_layer

Title: Ocean Grid-Cell Volume
Description: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields
Processing Note: a 3-d field: For oceans with more than 1 mesh, report on grid that applies to temperature

Title: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction
Description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
Processing Note: Function of Y, rho, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftmrho) and should in this case be omitted.

Title: Ocean Tracer Diffusivity Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Description: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced advective transport. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the 'thickness' diffusivity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was called 'ocean tracer bolus laplacian diffusivity'.  The CMIP6 name is physically more relevant.

Title: Dry deposition of HNO3
Description: This is the loss of nitric acid (HNO3) from the atmosphere due to dry deposition

Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Graupel
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Title: Sea-Surface Tilt Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)
Description: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt

Title: Land Surface Temperature
Description: Surface temperature on land

Title: total emission of DMS from all biomass burning
Description: This is the total emission rate of dimethyl sulfide (DMS) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

Title: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water
Description: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Longwave Radiative Heating
Description: Heating rate due to longwave radiative flux

Title: Percentage Cover by Secondary Evergreen Trees
Description: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary evergreen trees.
Processing Note: Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

Title: Canopy Albedo
Description: Canopy Albedo

Title: Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Processing Note: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: Surface Pressure .. needed for vertical coordinates

Title: Carbon  in Above and Below-Ground Litter Pools on Land-Use Tiles
Description: end of year values (not annual mean)

Title: Specific Humidity
Description: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, radiativeforcing_monthly, paleo_atmosphere, DCPP_Wider, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_atmosphere

Title: Sea Ice Salinity
Description: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: simple change from existing monthly variable to daily.

Title: Total Organic Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4\*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available.

Title: Near-Surface Wind Speed
Description: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, paleodata_assimilation, DCPP_Essential, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, biodiv_land_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_permafrost
Processing Note: normally, the the wind  should be reported at the 10 meter height

Title: Photolysis Rate of Ozone (O3)
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Diatoms
Description: Primary (organic carbon) production by diatom phytoplankton components alone

Title: Mole Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon from the diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Snow Internal Temperature
Description: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice.  When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as "missing in regions free of snow on land.

Title: Snow Mass Flux Through Straits
Description: Flux across 4 straits

Title: Floating Ice Shelf Area Percentage
Description: This is needed to distinguish between grounded glaciated ice (grounded = ice sheet and glacier) and ice shelves (floating over sea water), since land\_ice is by definition ice sheet, glacier and ice shelves

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.

Title: Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux
Description: Latent heat flux

Title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Picophytoplankton
Description: Primary (organic carbon) production by picophytoplankton components alone

Title: Daily Downwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
Description: The downwelling shortwave flux over sea ice (always positive by sign convention)
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: "positive direction" adjusted to match standard name,

Title: Surface Downward Eastward Wind Stress
Description: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, Bjerknes_Index_ENSO, paleo_land_atmosphere_surface, DCPP_Wider, FireMIP_monthly, CFMIP_baseline

Title: Sea Water X Velocity
Description: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Snow Water Equivalent on Land-Use Tile
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "lwe" means liquid water equivalent. "Amount" means mass per unit area. The construction lwe\_thickness\_of\_X\_amount or \_content means the vertical extent of a layer of liquid water having the same mass per unit area. Surface amount refers to the amount on the ground, excluding that on the plant or vegetation canopy.

Title: Sea Mass Area Flux Through Straits
Description: Flux across 4 straits

Title: C2H4  volume mixing ratio
Description: The is the mole fraction of ethene (C2H4) in air

Title: Downward Heat Flux at Snow Base
Description: Downward heat flux at snow botton

Title: Hourly Surface PM10 Mixing Ratio
Description: Hourly PM10 Mass Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer

Title: Latitude
Description: Latitude is positive northward; its units of degree\_north (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid\_latitude should be used instead of latitude. Grid latitude is positive in the grid-northward direction, but its units should be plain degree.
Processing Note: the above comment also applies to latitude.

Title: Net Primary Production Allocated to Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: added for completeness with npp\_root

Title: Nitrogen Limitation of Other Phytoplankton
Description: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Miscellaneous phytoplankton" are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Title: Square of Sea Surface Height Above Geoid
Description: Surface ocean geoid defines z=0.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.

Title: Total Soil Wetness
Description: relative\_soil\_moisture\_content\_above\_field\_capacity

Title: Subsurface Runoff
Description: subsurface\_runoff\_flux

Title: Relative Humidity
Description: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

Title: Sea Level Pressure
Description: Sea level pressure

Title: Depth Below Geoid of Interfaces Between Ocean Layers
Description: Depth below geoid
Processing Note: This 3-d time dependent field should only be saved for models where it cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored in the file.

Title: X-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "x" indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing
Description: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized dianeutral mixing.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Mass of 14C in Litter Pool
Description: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

Title: Vertically Integrated Northward Moisture Transport
Description: Vertically integrated Northward moisture transport (Mass\_weighted\_vertical integral of the product of northward wind by total water mass per unit mass)

Title: Nitrogen Mass in Stem
Description: including sapwood and hardwood.

Title: Dissolved Oxygen Concentration
Description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'.
Processing Note: The variable at the depth of 200 meters is requested.

Title: Depth Below Geoid of Ocean Layer
Description: Depth below geoid
Processing Note: This 3-d time dependent field should only be saved for models where it cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored in the file.

Title: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Description: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass resulting from their conversion to water vapor.  Computed as the total sublimation on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing for snow-free land regions; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0.

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_daily, temperature_variability_daily_lowpriority, DAMIP_daily, aerchemmip_3d_daily, DCPP_Wider, CHELSA_land_daily, CFMIP_baseline, cordex [test]
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CFMIP, CMIP, CORDEX, DAMIP, HighResMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: Tree Cover Percentage
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.

Title: Minimum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Description: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.

Title: Average Normal Stress in Sea Ice
Description: Average normal stress in sea ice (first stress invariant)

Title: TOA shortwave flux assuming reference ozone field
Description: This is top-of-atmosphere shortwave flux for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme, using a reference ozone field

Title: Daily Downwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
Description: the downwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always positive)
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: "positive direction" adjusted to match standard name,

Title: Total Atmospheric Mass of CO2
Description: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide
CMIP7 Variable Groups: c4mip_atmosphere_carbon_cycle_tier1, biodiv_land_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_earth_system, co2_emissions_concentration_mapping, carbon_conservation_check_variables
Processing Note: For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If CO2 is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Mole Fraction of CO2 (see the table entry before the previous one).

Title: CALIPSO Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the  Cloud-Aerosol Lidar and Infrared Pathfinder Satellite Observation (CALIPSO) instrument. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

Title: C4H10  volume mixing ratio
Description: This is the mole fraction of butane (C4H10) in air

Title: Surface Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of "Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration" plus "Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration"

Title: Stratospheric Optical Depth at 550nm (All Aerosols) 2D-Field (Stratosphere Only)
Description: From tropopause to stratopause as defined by the model

Title: Zonal Mean Diabatic Heating Rates
Description: The diabatic heating rates due to all the processes that may change potential temperature

Title: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor
Description: Upward geothermal heat flux per unit area on the sea floor
Processing Note: If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon fields (see the Omon table)

Title: Mass Fraction of Water
Description: includes all phases of water

Title: Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile
Description: End of year values (not annual mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac\_lnd = 0.5, frac\_ocn = 0.5, frac\_crop\_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac\_lut(crop) = 0.5\*0.2 = 0.1)

Title: Geopotential Height
Description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

Title: Daily Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux Under Sea Ice
Description: the net sensible heat flux under sea ice from the ocean
Cross-thematic group review comment: MJ: "positive direction" adjusted to match standard name,

Title: Upwelling Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Upwelling Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

Title: Phosphorus Production
Description: Vertically integrated biogenic phosphorus production

Title: total depth of soil
Description: This shall provide the total depth of soil, summed up over all soil layers, that may differ between  models; the idea is to be able to identify differences in treatment of soils across climate models.

Title: Snow Mass per Area
Description: (in OImon, sim included snow and sea ice mass)
CMIP7 Variable Groups: seaice_budget_mass_monthly, seaice_state_monthly_basic, hydrology, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_cryosphere, paleo_cryosphere_high_priority

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content
Description: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from all processes.

Title: Total Canopy Water Storage
Description: canopy\_water\_amount

Title: Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: Fluxes are requested at all levels

Title: NO3 Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Dry mass fraction of nitrate aerosol particles in air.

Title: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Description: Report only if there is a submesoscale eddy parameterization.
Processing Note: Function of latitude, Z, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftyzsmpa), which should in this case be omitted.  For other models, this transport should be approximated as the transport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.

Title: CALIPSO Percentage Cloud Cover
Description: Percentage cloud cover in CALIPSO standard atmospheric layers.
Processing Note: 40 levels

Title: Specific Humidity
Description: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

Title: Sedimentation Flux of Dust Mode Coarse Insoluble
Description: Dry mass deposition rate of dust aerosol.

Title: Land Ice Runoff Flux
Description: Runoff flux over land ice is the difference between any available liquid water in the snowpack less any refreezing. Computed as the sum of rainfall and melt of snow or ice less any refreezing or water retained in the snowpack

Title: Longwave Flux Due to Volcanic Aerosols at the Surface
Description: downwelling longwave  flux  due to volcanic aerosols at the surface to be diagnosed through double radiation call

Title: Albedo of the surface
Description: This follows the requested definition of Emon.alb, but we request data at daily resolution
Processing Note: This follows the requested definition of Emon.alb, but we request data at daily resolution

Title: Carbon Mass in Stem
Description: including sapwood and hardwood.

Title: Near-Surface Relative Humidity
Description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, paleo_land_atmosphere_surface, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, biodiv_land_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_permafrost
Processing Note: express as a percentage.  Normally, the relative humidity  should be reported at the 2 meter height

Title: Broadleaf Evergreen Tree Area Percentage
Description: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by broadleaf evergreen trees.

Title: PARASOL Reflectance
Description: PARASOL Reflectance

Title: Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux
Description: Mass flux of surface meltwater which refreezes within the snowpack. Computed as the total refreezing on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.

Title: Convective Rainfall Flux
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
Processing Note: report on model half-levels

Title: Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: Downwelling Longwave Radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)
Processing Note: Report on model half-levels (i.e., interfaces between model layers).

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Description: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Water Vapor Path
Description: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

Title: PARASOL Reflectance
Description: PARASOL Reflectance

Title: TOA Solar Irradiance for Each Band
Description: Solar irradiance at a horizontal surface at top of atmosphere.

Title: hur850
Description: Relative humidity at 850 hPa

Title: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation
Description: As Amon.rsut, but at daily resolution.

Title: Eastward Wind at 100m
Description: Zonal wind at 100m

Title: Upward Ocean Mass Transport
Description: Upward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

Title: ISCCP Cloud Area Percentage
Description: Percentage cloud cover in optical depth categories.
Processing Note: 7 levels x 7 tau

Title: Eastward Near-Surface Wind
Description: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind

Title: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Gyre
Description: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
Processing Note: For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.

Title: TOA Outgoing Longwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, clouds_basic_average, radiativeforcing_monthly, poleward_heat_transports, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, DCPP_Essential, ref_atmosphere, ref_earth_system, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, CFMIP_baseline

Title: Eastward gridbox length at t-points
Description: The width of the ocean model gridbox in at the t-point (dx)

Title: Ice Water Path
Description: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: MODIS Liquid Cloud Percentage
Description: MODIS Liquid Cloud Fraction

Title: Autotrophic Respiration on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total RA of grass in the grid cell

Title: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Growth in Supercooled Open Water (Frazil)
Description: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to sea ice formation in supercooled water (often through frazil formation) divided by grid-cell area. Together, sidmassgrowthwat and sidmassgrowthbot should give total ice growth

Title: Precipitation Flux of Water Containing Oxygen-18 (H2 18O)
Description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-18 isotope (H2 18O), including solid and liquid phases.

Title: Condensed Water Path
Description: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 10m
Description: Wind speed gust maximum at 10m above surface

Title: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_daily, cfmip_daily, temperature_variability_daily_lowpriority, DAMIP_daily, aerchemmip_2d_daily, CHELSA_land_daily, biodiv_land_daily, ISIMIPMinimalAtmos, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_permafrost, statistical_downscaling_core_daily, tipmip_extended

Title: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC113
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC113 is CCl2FCClF2.  The IUPAC name for CFC113 is 1,1,2-trichloro-1,2,2-trifluoro-ethane.

Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: This is a 3-hour mean flux.

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation in Bands
Description: Calculated in the absence of aerosols and clouds, following Ghan (2013, ACP). This requires a double-call in the radiation code with precisely the same meteorology.

Title: Stratiform Cloud Optical Depth
Description: Stratiform cloud optical depth

Title: total emission of CH4 from all biomass burning
Description: This is the total emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

Title: Pressure at Model Full-Levels
Description: Air pressure on model levels
Processing Note: This field is needed only for models in which the pressure cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored already for each variable.  Thus, the pressures are needed for height or theta-coordinate models, for example, but not sigma- or eta-coordinate models.

Title: Water Table Depth
Description: Depth is the vertical distance below the surface. The water table is the surface below which the soil is saturated with water such that all pore spaces are filled.

Title: River Inflow
Description: water\_flux\_to\_downstream

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Shortwave Radiative Heating
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Total Emission Rate of NMVOC
Description: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field. \_If\_ fixed molecular weight of NMVOC is not available in model, please provide in units of kilomole m-2 s-1 (i.e. kg m-2 s-1 as if model NMVOC had molecular weight of 1) and add a comment to your file.

Title: Sea-Ice Volume per Area
Description: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area (this used to be called ice thickness in CMIP5)

Title: 6 hourly instantaneous temperature in additional levels within the UTLS region
Description: 6 hourly instantaneous temperature at 2 additional pressure levels in the UTLS region (175 and 225 hPa)
Processing Note: subset of 27 pressure levels to cover the UTLS region

Title: Ice Water Path
Description: Ice water path

Title: Dynamic Sea Level
Description: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. zos is the effective sea level as if sea ice (and snow) at a grid cell were converted to liquid seawater (Campin et al., 2008). For OMIP, do _not _record inverse barometer responses from sea-ice (and snow) loading in zos. See (Griffies et al, 2016, https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-3231-2016).

Title: Total Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic phosphorus" means the sum of all inorganic phosphorus in solution (including phosphate, hydrogen phosphate, dihydrogen phosphate, and phosphoric acid).
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Wind Speed
Description: Daily maximum near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.

Title: Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
Description: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

Title: Bedrock Altitude
Description: The bedrock topography beneath the land ice

Title: Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: 3-hourly Dry Deposition Rate of NOy
Description: 3-hourly Dry Deposition Rate of NOy

Title: Mean-Squared Vertical Velocity (Omega)
Description: omega\*omega

Title: X-Component of Sea-Ice Velocity
Description: The x-velocity of ice on native model grid

Title: Tendency of Eastward Wind from Numerical Artefacts
Description: Other sub-grid scale/numerical zonal drag excluding that already provided for the parameterized orographic and non-orographic gravity waves. This would be used to calculate the total 'diabatic drag'. Contributions to this additional drag such Rayleigh friction and diffusion that can be calculated from the monthly mean wind fields should not be included, but details (e.g. coefficients) of the friction and/or diffusion used in the model should be provided separately.

Title: Ocean X heat transport
Description: Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale

Title: Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
Description: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

Title: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid
Description: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint distribution, liquid

Title: Pressure at Model Full-Levels
Description: Air pressure on model levels
Processing Note: This field is needed only for models in which the pressure cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored already for each variable.  Thus, the pressures are needed for height or theta-coordinate models, for example, but not sigma- or eta-coordinate models.

Title: Load of Black Carbon Aerosol
Description: The total dry mass of black carbon aerosol particles per unit area.

Title: Sea Water Mass
Description: Total mass of liquid sea water. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

Title: Depth of 20 degree Celsius Isotherm
Description: 20C isotherm depth

Title: Irradiance Limitation of Other Phytoplankton
Description: Growth limitation of miscellaneous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Title: CALIPSO Scattering Ratio CFAD
Description: CALIPSO Scattering Ratio

Title: Artificial Tracer with 50 Day Lifetime
Description: Fixed surface layer mixing ratio over 30o-50oN (100ppbv), uniform fixed 50-day exponential decay.

Title: Reference mole fraction of methane in air
Description: This is the methane mole fraction that is used in a diagnostic call to the model's radiation scheme. It is only applicable when a methane double call is active in the model.

Title: Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice
Description: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc >0 ) in a grid cell

Title: Total Respiration from Stem as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: added for completeness with Ra\_root

Title: Total Inorganic Chlorine Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Cly = HCl + ClONO2 + HOCl + ClO + Cl + 2\*Cl2O2 +2Cl2 + OClO + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic stratospheric chlorine (e.g., HCl, ClO) resulting from degradation of chlorine-containing source gases (CFCs, HCFCs, VSLS), and natural inorganic chlorine sources (e.g., sea salt and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields

Title: Zonal Mean Shortwave Heating Rate Due to Volcanic Aerosols
Description: shortwave heating rate due to volcanic aerosols to be diagnosed through double radiation call, zonal average values required

Title: Total Deposition Rate of Dust
Description: Fdry mass deposition rate of dust

Title: Northward gridbox length at v points
Description: The width of the ocean model gridbox in at the v-point (dy)

Title: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs
Description: computed as the iceberg melt water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Processing Note: If only the vertically integrated melt water flux is available, report as this 2-d field; otherwise ficeberg should be used.

Title: Northward Ocean Salt Transport Due to Overturning
Description: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
Processing Note: For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.

Title: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
Description: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.
Processing Note: If only the vertically integrated runoff flux is available, report as this 2-d field; otherwise hfrunoffds should be used.

Title: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction
Description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
Processing Note: Function of latitude, Z, basin.  For models not on a cartesian grid, this transport should be approximated as the transport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.

Title: Sea Water Potential Temperature
Description: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.
Processing Note: Note change from CMIP5 K to CMIP6 C. Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

Title: Downward Flux of Calcite at 1000m
Description: The phrase 'expressed\_as' is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Standard names also exist for aragonite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.
Processing Note: see epcalc100

Title: X-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "x" indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. "basal" means the lower boundary of the land ice.

Title: Dissolved Oxygen Concentration at Saturation
Description: "Mole concentration at saturation" means the mole concentration in a saturated solution. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen".

Title: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Grounded Ice Sheet
Description: quantity averaged over grounded ice sheet

Title: Global Mean Mole Fraction of HCFC22
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for HCFC22 is CHClF2.  The IUPAC name for HCFC22 is chloro-difluoro-methane.

Title: CALIPSO Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the  Cloud-Aerosol Lidar and Infrared Pathfinder Satellite Observation (CALIPSO) instrument. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

Title: Ocean Tracer Epineutral Biharmonic Diffusivity
Description: Epineutral diffusivity means a lateral diffusivity along a either a neutral or isopycnal density surface due to motion which is not resolved on the grid scale of an ocean model. The type of density surface is dependent on the model formulation.

Title: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress
Description: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Other Phytoplankton
Description: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by other phytoplankton components alone

Title: Net chemical production of nitrate aerosol
Description: This is the net chemical production rate of nitrate aerosol in the atmosphere

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Convection
Description: Tendencies from cumulus convection scheme.

Title: Ice Sheet Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model
Description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Clear-Sky Surface Shortwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust
Description: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover. Calculated in clear-sky conditions.

Title: Sand Fraction
Description: Sand Fraction

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Longwave Radiative Heating
Description: zonal mean; hence YZT

Title: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
Description: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

Title: Tendency of eastward wind due to orographic gravity waves
Description: Tendency of eastward wind induced by the parameterized orographic gravity wave drag
Processing Note: We ask the modelling centers to report the induced tendencies separately for each component of the parameterization (where applicable) and to provide specific values of the tunable parameters used for the simulation in the metadata together with a specification of the part of the gravity wave spectrum that is targeted by the parameterization (e.g., minimally, the effective resolution of the model).

Title: Instantaneous surface aerosol water mass mixing ratio at CF sites
Description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface aerosol water Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
Processing Note: Unsure which cell measures to use in this case!

Title: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation, Litter or Soil Pools into the Atmosphere Due to any Human Activity [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Anthropogenic flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. That is, emissions influenced, caused, or created by human activity. Anthropogenic emission of carbon dioxide includes fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change, except forest regrowth.

Title: Mole Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon from the diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

Title: Convective Updraft Mass Flux
Description: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).
Processing Note: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).

Title: Stratiform Cloud Emissivity
Description: This is the in-cloud emissivity obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell.

Title: Upwelling Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Upwelling longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

Title: Mass Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Title: Northward Ocean Heat Transport
Description: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.   Use Celsius for temperature scale.
Processing Note: For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.

Title: Remineralization of Organic Carbon
Description: Remineralization is the degradation of organic matter into inorganic forms of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus and other micronutrients, which consumes oxygen and releases energy.

Title: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Clear Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations in clear sky conditions

Title: X-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice
Description: X-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice

Title: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere

Title: Sea-Ice Area Percentage Tendency Due to Dynamics
Description: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence...)

Title: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
Description: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any "flux adjustment") .

Title: Ocean Momentum XY Laplacian Diffusivity
Description: Lateral Laplacian viscosity applied to the momentum equations.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

Title: Precipitation over Crop Tile
Description: includes both liquid and solid phases

Title: Load of NH4
Description: The total dry mass of ammonium aerosol particles per unit area.

Title: Dissolved Ammonium Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature
Description: Tendency of Air Temperature

Title: Zonal mean westward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization
Description: Zonal mean of the vertical flux of zonal momentum within the orographic GW parameterization

Title: Particulate Organic Carbon Content
Description: Vertically integrated POC

Title: Downward Inorganic Carbon Flux at Ocean Bottom
Description: Inorganic Carbon loss to sediments

Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: Surface Pressure .. needed for vertical coordinates

Title: Natural Grass Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.
Processing Note: add scalar coordinate typegrass and add "natural\_grass" to the CF area type table.  Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

Title: Square of Sea Surface Temperature
Description: Square of temperature of liquid ocean, averaged over the day.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Total Vegetated Percentage Cover
Description: Percentage of grid cell that is covered by vegetation.This SHOULD be the sum of tree, grass (natural and pasture), crop and shrub fractions.

Title: Northward Surface Stress from Planetary Boundary Layer Scheme
Description: surface

Title: Gross Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.

Title: Snow Internal Temperature
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

Title: Mass of 13C in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
Description: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil, and forestry and agricultural products (e.g. paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock).

Title: Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.

Title: Total loss rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) from the atmosphere via soil sink
Description: This is the total loss rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) from the atmosphere via its soil sink due to bacterial consumption.

Title: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
Description: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: mean 2m daily NOAA heat index
Description: **mean 2m daily NOAA heat index**

Title: Isoprene Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction of isoprene in air.

Title: Westward Reynolds stress from non-orographic gravity wave parameterization
Description: Vertical flux of zonal momentum within the non-orographic GW parameterization.

Title: Northward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Description: Tendency of the northward wind by parameterized orographic gravity waves.  (Note that CF name tables only have a general northward tendency for all gravity waves, and we need it separated by type.)

Title: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton phosphorus components

Title: Convective Precipitation
Description: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

Title: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice
Description: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Title: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid
Description: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint  distribution, liquid

Title: Momentum Flux
Description: Momentum flux

Title: Ambient Aerosol Absorption Optical Thickness at 550nm
Description: Optical thickness of atmospheric aerosols at wavelength 550 nanometers.

Title: Load of Dry Aerosol Primary Organic Matter
Description: The total dry mass of primary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.

Title: Net Nitrogen Release from Soil and Litter as the Outcome of Nitrogen Immobilisation and Gross Mineralisation
Description: Loss of soil nitrogen through remineralization and immobilisation. Remineralization is the degradation of organic matter into inorganic forms of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus and other micronutrients, which consumes oxygen and releases energy. Immobilisation of nitrogen refers to retention of nitrogen by micro-organisms under certain conditions, making it unavailable for plants.

Title: Surface Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Title: Net Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total NPP of shrubs in the grid cell

Title: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Silicon in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate silica component concentrations

Title: Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Title: total emission rate of black carbon aerosol mass from all biomass burning
Description: This is the total emission rate of black carbon aerosol into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

Title: Sea Water Transport
Description: Transport across\_line means that which crosses a particular line on the Earth's surface; formally this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the transport. The transport should be evaluated for the full depth of the ocean, except for the Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is averaged from the surface to 350m.
Processing Note: Full depth mean, apart from Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is only top 350m.

Title: Natural pH
Description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1 (natural component).

Title: Rainfall Flux
Description: Rainfall rate

Title: Nitrogen Mass in Above-Ground Litter (non CWD)
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Surface litter" means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood\_debris\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen, surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

Title: total emission rate of CO from all biomass burning
Description: This is the total emission rate of carbon monoxide (CO) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

Title: Total Respiration from Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: added for completeness with Ra\_root

Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton phosphorus components

Title: Nitrogen Mass in Litter Pool
Description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Title: Water Flux into Sea Water from Land Ice
Description: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to land ice (runoff water from surface and base of land ice or melt from base of ice shelf or vertical ice front) into the ocean divided by the area ocean portion of the grid cell

Title: Mole Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

Title: Specific Humidity
Description: These are standard variables from CMIP5.

Title: Mass Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll from diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

Title: Downward Heat Flux at Land Surface
Description: Ground heat flux

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Temperature on the 500 hPa surface

Title: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Conservative Temperature
Description: Full column sum of density\*cell thickness\*conservative temperature. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.

Title: Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Methane
Description: monthly averaged atmospheric loss

Title: Net Primary Production Allocated to Stem as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: added for completeness with npp\_root

Title: Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Tendency of Ocean Potential Energy Content
Description: Rate that work is done against vertical stratification, as measured by the vertical heat and salt diffusivity. Report here as depth integrated two-dimensional field.

Title: Surface Dissolved Oxygen Concentration
Description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'.

Title: Surface Natural Total Alkalinity
Description: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components) at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2

Title: Mole Concentration of microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

Title: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as Abiotic CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Gas exchange flux of abiotic CO2 (positive into ocean)

Title: Geopotential Height
Description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, radiativeforcing_monthly, dynvar_basic, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, paleodata_assimilation, DCPP_Essential, paleo_atmosphere, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_impacts_and_adaptation

Title: 6 hourly instantaneous eastward wind in additional levels within the UTLS region
Description: 6 hourly instantaneous eastward wind at 2 additional pressure levels in the UTLS region (175 and 225 hPa)
Processing Note: subset of 27 pressure levels to cover the UTLS region

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

Title: Nitrogen Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stem and Root
Description: E.g. fruits, seeds, etc.

Title: TOA shortwave flux assuming clear sky and reference ozone
Description: This represents the top-of-atmosphere outgoing shortwave radiative flux assuming clear-sky conditions when a reference ozone field is used in a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme

Title: Mole Fraction of O3
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Title: TOA Incident Shortwave Radiation
Description: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere

Title: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Other Phytoplankton
Description: Primary (organic carbon) production by other phytoplankton components alone

Title: Eastward Wind
Description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

Title: Amount of Total Ice Algae Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Ice
Description: Sum of chlorophyll from all ice algal group concentrations

Title: Grid Averaged Methane Production (Methanogenesis) from Wetlands
Description: Biological emissions (methanogenesis) of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

Title: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water
Description: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water

Title: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Overturning
Description: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
Processing Note: For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.

Title: Carbon Mass in Litter on Tree Tiles
Description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon has the standard name litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon.

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Model levels or plev\_27

Title: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, radiativeforcing_monthly, DAMIP_monthly, Bjerknes_Index_ENSO, poleward_heat_transports, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, paleodata_assimilation, DCPP_Essential, paleo_radiation_fluxes, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, biodiv_land_monthly, seaice_budget_energy_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, paleo_permafrost, landice_glaciers_allfreq

Title: Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Isotopic Ratio of Oxygen-17 in Sea Water
Description: Ratio of abundance of oxygen-17 (17O) atoms to oxygen-16 (16O) atoms in sea water

Title: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate organic phosphorus component concentrations
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Rainfall Flux over Land
Description: rainfall\_flux

Title: Convective Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
Description: Droplets are liquid.  The effective radius is defined as the ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution and the time-mean should be calculated, weighting the individual samples by the cloudy fraction of the grid cell.

Title: Sea Water Mass
Description: Total mass of liquid sea water. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

Title: Tendency of northward wind due to non-orographic gravity waves
Description: Tendency of northward wind induced by the parameterized non-orographic gravity wave drag
Processing Note: We ask the modelling centers to report the induced tendencies separately for each component of the parameterization (where applicable) and to provide specific values of the tunable parameters used for the simulation in the metadata together with a specification of the part of the gravity wave spectrum that is targeted by the parameterization (e.g., minimally, the effective resolution of the model).

Title: Ocean Model Cell Thickness
Description: "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid-cell.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

Title: Particulate Organic Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
Description: total organic aerosol AOD due to secondary aerosol formation

Title: Convective Snowfall Flux
Description: convective\_snowfall\_flux

Title: TOA Outgoing Longwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)
Processing Note: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

Title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Diazotrophs
Description: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the diazotrophs alone

Title: Aerosol Level Asymmetry Parameter for Each Band
Description: The asymmetry factor is the angular integral of the aerosol scattering phase function weighted by the cosine of the angle with the incident radiation flux. The asymmetry coefficient is here an integral over all wavelength bands.

Title: Gross primary production in sea ice as carbon amount flux
Description: Total GPP of ice algae in sea ice

Title: Integral with Respect to Depth of Product of Sea Water Density and Potential Temperature
Description: Integral over the full ocean depth of the product of sea water density and potential temperature.

Title: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Downwelling shortwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air Temperature
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, clouds_basic_average, radiativeforcing_monthly, dynvar_basic, DAMIP_monthly, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, DCPP_Essential, paleo_atmosphere, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, FireMIP_monthly, CFMIP_baseline, ref_atmosphere

Title: Column Integrated Cloud Droplet Number
Description: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

Title: Evaporation from Canopy
Description: the canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).

Title: Geopotential Height
Description: Model levels or plev\_27

Title: Carbon Mass in Medium Soil Pool
Description: medium is meant as lifetime of more than than 10 years and less than 100 years for  reference climate conditions (20 C, no water limitations)

Title: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Description: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
Processing Note: Function of Y, rho, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftmrhompa) and should in this case be omitted.

Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: Surface downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_monthly, radiativeforcing_monthly, Hadley_Walker_Circulations, aerchemmip_2d_monthly, paleo_radiation_fluxes, SO_BGC-cloud_met_monthly, CFMIP_baseline

Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Due to Biological Activity
Description: Net of biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic silicon

Title: Sea Water Redistributed Conservative Temperature
Description: A passive tracer in an ocean model which is subject to an externally imposed perturbative surface heat flux. The passive tracer is initialised to the conservative temperature in the control climate before the perturbation is imposed. Its surface flux is the heat flux from the atmosphere, not including the imposed perturbation, and is converted to a passive tracer increment as if it were being added to conservative temperature. The passive tracer is transported within the ocean as if it were conservative temperature.

Title: Snow Heat Content per Unit Area
Description: Heat-content of all snow in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Snow-water equivalent at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of sea ice.

Title: Autotrophic Respiration on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]. Calculated on land-use tiles.

Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Advection
Description: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Advection

Title: Delta O2 Partial Pressure
Description: The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume.  The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.
Processing Note: Difference between atmospheric and oceanic partial pressure of O2 (positive meaning ocean > atmosphere)

Title: X-Component of Sea-Ice Mass Transport
Description: Includes transport of both sea ice and snow by advection

Title: Net Flux of CO2 Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral\_carbon\_transfer\_over\_land term, see below, will be zero data).

Title: Heterotrophic Respiration on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total RH of grass in the grid cell

Title: global_average_thermosteric_sea_level_change
Description: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change

Title: Surface Dissolved Oxygen Concentration
Description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'.

Title: Snow Area Percentage
Description: quantity averaged over ice sheet  only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Title: Number Concentration of Nucleation Mode Aerosol
Description: includes all particles with diameter smaller than 3 nm

Title: Altitude of Model Full-Levels
Description: This is actual height above mean sea level, not geopotential height

Title: Annual Gross Percentage of Land-Use Tile That Was Transferred into Other Land-Use Tiles
Description: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as percentage of atmospheric grid cell

Title: Snow Thickness
Description: Actual thickness of snow (snow volume divided by snow-covered area)

Title: Ocean Model Cell Thickness
Description: "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid-cell.
CMIP7 Variable Groups: baseline_fixed, ocean_coordinates, ocean_grid, marine_bgc_baseline, paleo_fx, omip_geometry_physics
Processing Note: If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon fields (see the Omon table)

Title: Northward Near-Surface Wind
Description: This is sampled synoptically.

Title: Column Integrated Cloud Droplet Number
Description: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

Title: Irradiance Limitation of Calcareous Phytoplankton
Description: Growth limitation of calcareous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Title: Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Nitrous Oxide
Description: monthly averaged atmospheric loss

Title: Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
Description: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Title: Dust Optical Thickness at 550nm
Description: Total aerosol AOD due to dust aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

Title: Total Land N2O Flux
Description: Surface upward flux of nitrous oxide (N2O) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.

Title: Cloud-Top Effective Radius of Liquid or Ice Cloud at Liquid or Ice Cloud Top
Description: This variable represents the monthly mean Cloud-Top Effective Radius of Liquid or Ice Cloud at Liquid or Ice Cloud Top

Title: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface
Description: This is the flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.
Processing Note: Report on native horizontal grid.

Title: Eastward Wind
Description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).
Processing Note: on all model levels
Priority 1 (CMIP6): CMIP, CORDEX, PMIP, VIACSAB, VolMIP

Title: Abiotic pH
Description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1 (abiotic component)..
Processing Note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

Title: Surface Snow Melt
Description: The total surface snow melt rate on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; report as zero for snow-free land regions and missing where there is no land.

Title: Surface Upwelling Longwave on Land-Use Tile
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere

Title: Vertically Integrated Mass Content of Air in Layer
Description: The mass of air in an atmospheric layer.

Title: TOA Outgoing Longwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere.

Title: Fraction of Snowfall (Including Hail and Graupel) on Snow
Description: mass\_fraction\_of\_snowfall\_onto\_snow

Title: Mass Concentration of Other Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll from additional phytoplankton component concentrations alone

Title: Northward Wind
Description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

Title: Nitrogen Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Wood debris" means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood\_debris\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen, surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

Title: Wood and Agricultural Product Pool Carbon Associated with Land-Use Tiles
Description: Anthropogenic pools associated with land use tiles into which harvests and cleared carbon are deposited before release into atmosphere PLUS any remaining anthropogenic pools that may be associated with lands which were converted into land use tiles during reported period. Examples of products include paper, cardboard, timber for construction, and crop harvest for food or fuel. Does NOT include residue which is deposited into soil or litter; end of year values (not annual mean).

Title: hur100
Description: Relative humidity at 100 hPa

Title: Carbon Mass in Soil on Tree Tiles
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The "soil content" of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including content\_of\_soil\_layer are used.

Title: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics
Processing Note: In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe. Report on native horizontal grid. If a function of depth, perform online remapping to depth or pressure, if not native vertical grid.

Title: Total Surface Mass Balance Flux
Description: Antarctica

Title: Evaporation Including Sublimation and Transpiration
Description: at surface; flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

Title: Downwelling Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free, Shortwave Radiation in Bands
Description: Calculated in the absence of aerosols and clouds (following Ghan). This requires a double-call in the radiation code with precisely the same meteorology.

Title: Instantaneous Aerosol Sulfate Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites
Description: This variable is for instantaneous surface mass mixing ratio of sulfate aerosol at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

Title: Net Mass Flux of 13C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Flux of carbon 31as carbon dioxide into the land.
